The other Assamites don't show the faintest signs of exhaustion yet. But then, who can tell?
A few more Inquisitors drop dead from severed heads and cut throats. Their blood sprays the air as they all meet a messy end. The parking lot begins to fill up with the dead and the dying.
John is cutting open an SI operator's abdomen and slashing across his torso with a brutal uppercut. Another Assamite blinks back and forth, slicing (and dicing) up the Inquisitors, while another stabs her dagger into the heart of a dying foe, making sure that they stay dead.
Now, there's only a few Inquisitors left. Maybe they'll make a run for it? But then, something happens...and not the good kind of happening.
John's eyes go wide in horror. His hands go slack, and his jaw drops as he looks around the lot, his eyes frantically darting from 1 direction to the next.
Commander Gallant and the other thugs arrive. He's decked out in full-body armor and carries a shotgun in 1 hand. He takes a moment to look around. He can smell the fighting, and he can feel the chaos and destruction in the area.
Screams, erratic gunfire, howling, growling, bones snapping, gross squelching sounds, and so on.
Inquisitors in heavy riot gear emerge out of the SUV and begin firing their incendiary shotguns and flamethrowers, spreading a hazy orange glow of hellish fire about the place. The parking lot is slowly (but surely) beginning to resemble a hellish inferno of doom.
Samir hisses and begins to feel his skin burning up. He desperately tries to find cover as the fire spreads to some cars. He hides behind a column and screams in pain. His Rötschreck is triggered, and he winces as he can feel the intensity of those flames.
Chloe's Wraith reappears again, giggling and floating around Svetlana as the fire spreads to her position. Her hand extends and taps Svetlana's shoulder. She almost yelps out in shock. She can't hear the fire or see the smoke; she's got tunnel-vision for the Wraith, and nothing more.
Abdullah's hand begins to twitch.
An Inquisitor raises his gun and points it at Svetlana's head while another one approaches her with a long wooden stake. Svetlana, her hands stained in blood, stares at the shimmering child in front of her, completely and totally distracted.
John slashes another goon and notices his Childe from the corner of his eye. He gasps and his eyes widen. He musters up everything within his undead being and flashes to her in a hurry. His Celerity carries him like a storm as he slashes across an Inquisitor's throat.

Svetlana takes a quick moment to gather her composure. Zeina is engaged in fisticuffs with someone who is VERY keen on ramming a stake in her chest.
Abdullah is still hiding behind a column and keeps a watchful eye on his teammates. The fire is beginning to spread to his area, so he runs for better cover as bullets fly past him. A bullet grazes his ear. He keels over and winces in pain.

His blood rains down on her. She pushes the body away and thanks her fellow Assassin. He points and gestures at the others, who are in trouble- they need to move NOW!
Abdullah tries to push forward to get to a more advantageous position. He gets cut off by 2 other goons, 1 armed with an incendiary shotgun and another wielding a long, wooden stake.
"Don't even think about it."

"What the...?"
The 2 Inquisitors begin to wheeze and choke. They claw at their necks as if there's some invisible force around it. They start gasping for air and fall to their knees, desperately struggling for their lives.
Abdullah looks down on the 2 thugs with an air of pity. He snaps his fingers, and the Inquisitors' bodies crumple to the ground, eyes rolled over into the back of their skulls and mouths frothing.

Samir's Rötschreck has reduced, but he's still afraid of the searing flames and the bright lights of the fire. He tries to push forward to help his fellow Assamites. He rushes at 1 of the thugs in a wild bum-rush when his foot gets shot- a few AP rounds go into his ankle and shin, sending him sprawling on the concrete.

Another Assamite goes to assist Samir but is quickly taken out with a flamethrower. Svetlana hears him screaming and gasps. Her hand instinctively goes for her dagger and she's about to rush into battle, but she hesitates.

A loud ringing begins to sound in Svetlana's ears. It gets louder and louder, as does everything around her. Her head spins, and her eyes grow hazy.

She was just 18 when it happened.
It all comes flooding back. A damp and musty hotel room in India. 4 Israeli men and 1 Israeli woman were present on that fateful and horrible evening.

Commander Gallant scares off a few approaching vampires with his incendiary shotgun rounds while Svetlana, shivering in her boots, struggles to disappear out of sight.

A flash of something metallic gleams in the fire and slashes the back of the approaching Inquisitor's head. The stake clatters onto the concrete, and they fall face-first onto the concrete floor with a dull thud, blood seeping out from their neck.
Another goon spots the flickering Svetlana. He aims his gun and squeezes the trigger, but he is quickly taken out by a slash of a blade, followed by a loud scream from 1 of the other Assamites.
This is a disaster. The SI clearly has the upper hand here. A few more Assamites are turned to ash either by the incendiary rounds or flamethrowers.
Zeina tries to dash at Commander Gallant, but his fiery shotty rounds send her fleeing in the other direction, wildly screeching and hissing as the hot flames singe her hair and flesh.
Svetlana's gaze remains transfixed on the Commander. Her face is blank, and sanguine tears continue to flow down her face as she flickers in and out of sight.
She remains motionless and mute. All the memories she had buried deep in the darkest depths of her mind begin to resurface in a violent storm as her eyes remain fixed on that horrible, terrible man.
The way he and the other men laughed at her. The way that other woman...recorded the whole fucking thing and laughed along with the others.
John yells at his Childe, "SVETLANA! WHAT'S THE MATTER WITH YOU?!"
Abdullah uses his Blood to create more corrosive red mist that envelops the area around Svetlana. Inquisitors and drones alike fall to the ground as the mist does its work. But he knows that this won't last long.

Samir stabs and slashes a heavy shotgunner and limps away as a gaping bullet wound on his abdomen begins to mend itself. Zeina howls as she gets hit by more incendiary shotty rounds and goes scrambling into the shadows.

Commander Obed Gallant hacks and coughs in the smokey lot. He can't see a goddamn thing! He orders his soldiers to move up as his vision gets blurrier, and his eyes catch something out of the corner.
Some of the troops are beginning to choke on and die from the red mist. The others fall back as they see it gathering up near their feet.
John and the other surviving Assamites are clearly at their limit. He screams, "OUT! OUT!"
Commander Gallant smugly smirks and lifts his chin upon hearing his foe admit defeat. He calls out, "There is no place that you can hide, blank body! Show yourself and I promise to make it quick."
John shakes his head and winces in pain as he sees a light bullet wound in his chest begin to close up, "Dammit. We'll be back to finish you off! Asshole. Let's go!"

Svetlana still hasn't moved from her spot. At least Abdullah's red mist keeps her safe from those fascist assholes...for now.
John shouts at his Childe and calls her name again, "SVETLANA! For fuck's sake!" he grabs her hand and yanks her away. He sees the Commander raise his gun at him and blinks away just in time.
Abdullah follows closely and wonders what's up with Svetlana, "Is she fine, habibi?! What's the matter with her?!" he's panting. He is quite low on Vitae right now.
John shakes his head, "I have no clue! I don't know!" he slows down and looks at her with a look of pity.
Svetlana, with a blank and distant stare, mutely and listlessly follows John, as if her Sire were leading her through an unknown world. Her body shivers, her legs are numb, her mouth is agape and dry.
She remembers being a terrified, confused, and lonely girl all those years ago, traveling by herself. The hotel room...
She was 18 then. Backpacking in India was all she could afford after her babushka had passed away. Given the socio-economic situation in post-USSR Ukraine, it was all that was left for her to do.
The tears flow as Svetlana gets yanked through blurry surroundings, with nothing but those horrid memories flooding her brain and paralyzing her very being.
She doesn't see the other Assamites. She doesn't see the tired faces and singed clothes. She doesn't see John trying his best to pull her away from all the madness and danger.
Going to India was originally suggested by a friend of hers. She really wanted to go to somewhere nicer, like Italy, but money was quite tight at the time, so she took a gamble and went to India.
Svetlana sees nothing but those 4 young guys and that horrible, terrible woman in her memories. Her green eyes remain locked in a frozen, blank stare. Her arms are numb, and her body goes slack as she walks. She barely even remembers anything else.
She had just turned 18.
John continues to call Svetlana's name and drags her along with the others as they run out of the lot, the fiery smoke (and rapidly dissipating red mist) obscuring the area while they all get to safety.
Svetlana sees that hotel room in India, sees those 5 Israelis...
"NYET! NYET! NOOOOO! AAAAAAAAAH! AAAAAAAARGH! HELP! HELP!" the Assamite starts to shake and convulse as more and more of these horrid, suppressed memories begin to flood her mind.
Her Sire's eyes widen in shock as she continues to scream at the top of her lungs. Svetlana starts clawing at her own arms, "HELP ME! HELP ME! HEEEEEELP MEEEE! NO! NO TOUCH! DON'T TOUCH! NOOO!"
Zeina's face goes from tired and weary to concerned as she listens to this, "What is happening to her?! She's...screaming! Someone do something!"

It all began in Magnolia City, USA. The Swinging 1960s were in full effect. Space, civil rights, 'Nam, and so on. John was in the midst of it all. His ultra-religious mum had just died, but it wasn't peaceful, if anything, it was preventable.
"She was a real Jesus freak, Svetlana. I tried, so--so many times, to talk sense into her. I tried to get a doctor to see her, but that went about as well as you'd expect."
Eventually, she died, leaving John all alone and with a lot of unresolved issues. John's father, a Mexican laborer, was never really in the picture to begin with. John never knew the guy and was dissuaded from asking.
All his mother would ever tell him was that his dad was just "some handsome beaner" whom she had met long before she came to Jesus. Yup.
"That's...how she described him," John laughs nervously and wrings his hands together.
He's very nervous, and rightfully so, "That's how my own mom referred to my dad, yeah." John chuckles bitterly and looks down at the floor.
He has a sad smile on his face, but his eyes are welling up with bloody tears, "She...she was a piece of work, huh? A real piece of work. A pain on the best of days and a nuisance on the worst. Then again, she did provide for me..."
As a child, he recalls seeing his mother dressed in some diner uniform: candy-striped shirt and matching short skirt, white stockings, a paper hat, and shiny black shoes. She smiled, but it was always a tired and worn-out one.
She always complained about the skirt's length.
Her hair was always in a bun, and her lips were always covered in bright red lipstick of the cheap variety. Her other job was as a part-time secretary for some industrial tycoon. It paid a little better than the diner, but she was still exhausted and stressed out most of the time.
She worked a lot. When she wasn't slinging hash in the diner or shuffling papers at the fancy art deco office, she was out somewhere else, doing something else. It was just the 2 of them for the longest time. She raised him on her own. It was rough, but they somehow made do.

There's also some sadness there, too. His lips curl upwards a bit.
By the time his mother had passed on, John had secured for himself a very comfy and well-paying job at a now-defunct yellow rag. It was a job offer that was too good to refuse. He worked as a junior feature writer and would occasionally dip his toes in other areas.
It wasn't the most prestigious (or well-respected, let alone well-liked) of publications, but the pay was great, the benefits were solid, and the company had a good track record of being in the green despite all the loathsome filth they'd constantly churn out.

The lady in question was named Ladonna Hughes. She was in her late-20s, had lovely frizzy hair, a slim figure, and an infectious smile.
"She was just beautiful, Svetlana. Absolutely stunning. Even I admit, I was initially mesmerized when she opened her mouth and started to sing, and then...well--she sang her heart out that night. Sang like a goddamn goddess. It was...incredible. Truly...incredible now that I think back on it."
John felt something stir inside him during that performance. He felt...something. Something warm, fuzzy, and good. Ladonna was resplendent in a shiny sequins dress that glittered under the dazzling lights.
"She was like beauty itself, Svetlana. Impeccable, tasteful, and a--a goddess. But the bossman wanted her to be the opposite of those things. So, I did what any loyal, obedient, and subservient lapdog would do. I obeyed orders and did what he wanted."
After the show ended, he came back, sat in front of his brown-colored typewriter...clack, clack, clack. The venomous words flew out with such ease that John felt a high (that usually comes from tearing decent people down from a place of relative safety, comfort, and distance).
He didn't understand or question why it was so easy for him to type all this crap out.
"I typed up a VERY nasty little article and sent it back to the editor. I...I wasn't proud of what I had done, Svetlana. But I did it, and I felt good about it, at the time. REAL good."
The very last lines of that foul article read: "And one can't help but ask oneself- is all this Civil Rights talk a huge mistake? Well, we are starting to think it is. Subpar Negro mediocrity being awarded and even lauded is the last thing that the culture needs. It might be a hard pill for America to swallow, but better sooner rather than later."
(It was all John's words, mind you; the editor didn't really have to do much, save for a few grammar fixes here and there.)
"Well, shit. Now you know, Svetlana. You now know who I was. That's--that's me, Svetlana. I used to be...that. I used to be THAT kind of guy. I don't expect you to forgive me, and I hope that this won't change how you view me, but..."
He stops for a moment and adds, "Oh, yeah...you're wondering how this all connects to my Sire. It does. It...does."
The woman who'd go on to become John's Sire, Fatima Ibn Rashid (a Banu Haqim Elder of the Blade of Haqim), was present in the audience that very night.
She was seated in the back, dressed in casual wear- dark bell bottoms, a plain blouse, and a colorful scarf.
"She was--I didn't even notice her when I walked in. I think I took her picture..."
In truth, Fatima was deeply in love with Ladonna. Imagine if something like THAT had gotten out back then! It was only much later that John became aware of his Sire's relationship with Ladonna.
"I shall think of you / Think of you / Think of you / Till I die" Ladonna sang that as she looked straight into the eyes of the woman she loved. No one really clocked it back then, but Fatima had to hold back tears of blood. She simply smiled and nodded back at her lover.
After the concert, they simply touched foreheads in the dressing room and held each other's hands. They whispered words of love and affection to one another. Fatima gave Ladonna a bouquet of white lilies and kissed her cheek.
After that, they parted ways. Ladonna did a little meet-and-greet, signed a few autographs, posed for a few pics, the usual. The entire crowd (save for John) gave her a standing ovation that lasted for about 4 minutes.
Being the smug contrarian that he was, he simply folded his legs and looked all disinterested and apathetic.
"I mean, the applause was just insane, Svetlana! There were people standing and clapping and shouting and whistling and hollering! They loved her. It was something!"
Meanwhile, the woman John would come to know as his Sire, Fatima, was already preparing to leave. She brushed past him and disappeared into the cold winter night.
Eventually, poison must act. And act it certainly did. John's article spread like a goddamn wildfire due to its...incendiary nature. Poor Ladonna was inundated with angry mail and death threats, undue and unwanted attention, and all sorts of nasty crap.
The public was in an uproar, and the authorities had to get involved. It was a whole big mess, and she even had to go into hiding for a while. The yellow rag's circulation was up for a while, and the boss was pleased with John's work.
He received a big bonus that month and tickets to Varosha, Cyprus- quite a popular tourist destination back in the 60s.
In time, the pressure got so bad, that poor Ladonna completely withdrew from the public altogether. Scheduled appearances were abruptly cancelled, she became very reclusive, and it somehow leaked that Ladonna was a lesbian when she was caught with another woman, having some fun.
The vultures in the yellow press fucking ran with that, like there was literally nothing else of importance going on in the world at the time.
Ladonna's career was effectively over. She moved to someplace outside Magnolia City and didn't even bother to show her face in public no more.
Fatima, for her part, was absolutely horrified at the turn of events. She did everything in her power to track down Ladonna, but it was futile.
By the time the Elder Assamite had tracked her lover, it was already too late. Ladonna Hughes was found, suspended from a ceiling fan in a small motel room, hanging from a rope. There were withered white lilies at her feet.
A note was left on the bedside table, which simply read: "I just can't do this no more. It's all too much, the media circus, the madness. I'm sorry. Fatima, I love you. I've never forgotten you. Oh, Fatima, your smile, your touch, it meant so much to me. I couldn't say for sure today whether your eyes were blue or grey."
The note ended: "I shall think of you. Think of you, think of you, till I die."
With bloody tears running down her cheeks, Fatima pocketed the note (for obvious reasons) and took it upon herself to cremate the body of her dead lover and spread the ashes across the waters.
"I killed her, Svetlana. The woman that my Sire was in love with...I killed her! I didn't need a gun or a knife or cyanide to do it. I did it, smugly, from the comfort of my...cigarette smoke-ridden workplace, I--"
John buries his face in his hands and sobs, tears of blood seeping through the cracks of his fingers, "Oh god, Svetlana, I KILLED HER!"
Svetlana simply places a reassuring hand on her Sire's shoulder.
John lifts his head and looks back at Svetlana with a pained expression on his face, "It--it isn't over yet..."
After that, Fatima began her investigation. She'd stalked the yellow rags, read through the articles, and dealt with anyone who seemed like they deserved to die.
Suicide is after all, a form of murder. Social murder. John and other merchants of lies and tripe are the ones who were ultimately responsible for Ladonna's untimely death.
"She'd read through them all and if she felt like someone needed to be...Judged, she'd go and just do it, and that's it. No one ever found the bodies and the MCPD gave up on searching for 'em."
By then, John was happy as can be- at the top of the world, as it were. He was getting ready for his all-expenses-paid vacay to Cyprus. The plane tickets were already booked, the night sky was clear, the stars were twinkling, and it was a great time. The flight was due to leave in less than an hour.
"The bossman, the same bastard who had ordered me to write that shit, the same bastard who'd call me a half-caste and all that racist garbage, he...he gave me this huge ass raise and a promotion along with the promise of a corner office in the new building when I came back."
As John was dragging his suitcases out of his house, Fatima was already outside, waiting and watching. Darkness gleamed in the Elder Assassin's eyes. Her fangs were fully out, as were her claws.
"My Sire...she was apparently still out there searching for ALL of those who were responsible for Ladonna's suicide. And I--I'm right there, near the tippy-top of her list. I don't know where she is or how she is, but--"
She was there to kill him that night. And, well, she did. After all, to Embrace someone, a Kindred must first drain them, exsanguinate them, of all their blood.
She approached this man from behind and viciously grabbed him. Her long and pointy fangs burrowed into his skin as he struggled, wheezed, and gasped. She drained him of his blood and discarded his corpse.
"She did the deed right at my front door. It was cold and lonely. There was no one there, no one to help, no one to see. It was...the end for me."
Or so he thought.
Fatima, her mouth crimson with fresh blood, knelt down besides his motionless body and ran her hand across his body. Her lips trembled and she felt...pity and remorse when she looked at John.
Her bitter expression softened, and she used her razor-sharp nails and cut her wrist open, allowing her own Vitae to flow. She opened John's mouth and allowed some of her Vitae to seep inside him.
"She...Embraced me. Gave me a second chance. A--an opportunity to make amends, to be a better man, a better person, y'know? It was...a kindness that I wasn't worthy of. A--A--Another shot at things."
The process was slow and excruciating. The first few nights were hell for him. John spent his first nights as a Fledgling Assamite locked inside his house. He couldn't leave, his entire body was sore and in constant pain, and the Hunger was unbearable.
Fatima would visit him, usually with a mortal to feed from, and offer some words of encouragement and advice, albeit in a very cold and distant manner.
Her mien still indicated that she was holding back some deep-seated rage and resentment for the man who was the most responsible for killing the woman that she was in love with, but she still chose not to kill him.
Killing him is probably something that Ladonna wouldn't have wanted. It wouldn't be a way to honor her memory.
Regardless, Fatima had her own reasons for doing so, reasons that she alone is privy to. Even John isn't too sure why she chose him while killing the other scandalmongers and slop-pushers.
"To THIS VERY NIGHT, I'm still not sure why she spared me, and not the others. I guess I'll never really know. I've always been a bit curious, but...it's a sensitive issue, so I've chosen not to ask about it or prod too much."
He was her Childe, and she was his Sire. Well, formally at least. Was it an authorized Embrace?
Ehhhh...
Magnolia City was going through some issues in the Kindred leadership structure back in the 60s. By the end of all the long and drawn-out hullabaloo, a bunch of Salubri (3-eyed vampires) had gained control over the Domain.
"Anyways, I could feel Fatima's disdain and loathing every time she was around. She didn't want anything to do with me, but she did it anyway. She did it, because she...probably felt sorry for me."
Svetlana is just sitting there, silently listening. Her facial expressions haven't changed.
"And that's--that's pretty much the skinny, Svetlana. I dunno what you think about this or how you feel, but...there's something else I haven't told you yet. There's a whole lot more to the story."
Of course there is.
Fatima eventually left Magnolia City a few weeks after John's Embrace. Some say she was Beckoned off to somewhere else. As an Elder bloodsucker, that was kinda expected, really. Or maybe she couldn't bare to be in the city where she had lost the love of her Unlife.
"Before she disappeared, she left me in the care of this Palestinian doctor named George Fateh. Same Clan. I've talked a lot about him before."
"Take care of this one, Dr. George. He is fast, too fast for his own good at times. If he becomes trouble, Judge him. It would certainly be a shame if that is the case. He...he shows some promise to our cause, nevertheless. But keep him under your watchful eye all the same, yes?" this was the last thing that John overheard his Sire tell Dr. George.
She then walked out the door without looking back or saying another word.
"Well, well, well. Fatima's Childe, eh? You do not know the power that courses through your veins. She has told me all about you, Fledgling. Come, come, follow me. There is much for you to learn about the Blade of Haqim. Much indeed!"
After a night, John took the opportunity to run away from the man whose care he had been thrust into.
"I um...booked it, heh."
Well, from there, John goes on to tell his Childe about how he fell in with a (sort of) wrong crowd, the kinds that have fangs and claws, too.
Eventually, he would go on to goad a Lasombra named Jacob into Diablerizing a Hecata Elder named Giordano.
Svetlana gasps at that but chooses to say nothing. She simply nods and continues to listen. Her eyes widen slightly, but that's about it. She takes it all in. It is...a lot to process. Her Sire has quite a history!
"I--I Diablerized a few, too, but I kinda feel bad...looking back on it. Poor Jacob. I uh...hope he's doing OK, wherever he is, whatever he's up to. I scared him."
(Jacob is definitely NOT doing OK, he still struggles with Giordano's "essence" and voice in his head and whatnot. Guy was a freaking Elder, after all.)
John then goes on to talk about how he'd eventually found his way back to Dr. George. John still remembers standing on that porch, shamefaced and head hung low. He was so embarrassed when he stood there.
However, Dr. George wasn't even angry or mad or disappointed. He was extraordinarily patient, kind, and understanding. He welcomed the then-Fledgling with open arms.
The little old man had an eternal spring in his step and always seemed to have a little nugget of wisdom to share.
"You have run far and wide, Fledgling. Come inside, sit, rest your body, tell me how it went. I hear our very own Elder Necromancer, Giordano, went missing recently. YOU wouldn't happen to know anything about that, would you? Come, come."
John turns his head aside, "I...really didn't deserve him, Svetlana. From there, he set me on the right path and showed me the way of the Blade of Haqim. And, well, the rest you already know, since we've talked about it before."
He sniffles and adds, "God, I hope the old man's doing OK. He's uh...I think he chose to stay in Magnolia City while I...chose to leave it all behind and try to--try to do good elsewhere."
Dr. Fateh often told his charge, "What you did, of course, is unforgivable. But Fatima still saw...something in you, Fledgling. As much as I am not a...fan of vengeance for vengeance's sake, Fatima would've been justified in leaving your exsanguinated corpse on your doorstep. Yet, she chose not to. What does this tell us, hmm?"
John remembers sheepishly replying, "That...we all deserve second chances to make amends and right our wrongs?"
The Assamite doctor merely smiled and chuckled as he put his hands behind his back and strolled around the room.
The doc looked over his shoulder and said, "Perhaps there is hope for you, Fledgling. Tomorrow night, we go to the racetrack. Your Celerity is wild- it requires some...taming, yes?"
That's pretty much it from John's side of things. He's now done. He takes a moment to compose himself and looks at his Childe, silently gauging her reaction. Svetlana sits there quietly, still listening, and nodding slowly.
"That's it, Svetlana. That's what I've um...been keeping from you. I'm sorry, I should've told you sooner."
Svetlana weakly nods, "And I am also sorry for not telling you my--"
John cuts her off, "No, no, no. You don't owe anyone an apology. What happened to you was--was truly awful. I'm sorry for what happened to you, Svetlana."
As John was busy talking about his past, what happened to Svetlana stuck to his mind throughout this heart-to-heart conversation.
For his part, he feels really guilty and bad for what his actions caused to happen to poor Ladonna Hughes. Now, John's trying so hard to be a better man, a good man. To make amends and do right by those who matter.
That's the man that Svetlana has come to know in her 5 years of Unlife. John Suarez, a product of the tumultuous 1960s, exchanged his pen (typewriter) for the sword. It's usually the other way around, innit?
Maybe there's an opportunity for him to make amends, do good, and Judge the unjust. He's certainly taken the effort, contritely and sincerely.
As for Svetlana Bobrov, she has suffered so much, so much more than he ever has or likely ever will. She does wonder, what became of the other 3 men who raped her on that horrible evening?
She's seen Obed Gallant, who now commands and leads the Unit 8211 branch here in the UAE.
What of the other 3 men and that 1 woman? Did they fall down the steps and break their necks? Did they die early? Did they (at the very least) get caught doing something similar, and stopped from doing so?
Sadly, no, no, and no.
1 of the men is now someone who works with the UKLFI (the UK Lawyers For Israel). Go figure.
The 2nd guy is, not surprisingly, an important Rabbi in Australia closely associated with the notorious Settler movement back in Israel. Not surprising.
The 3rd guy is a CEO of a biopharma company, worth billions of dollars, that's connected to the notorious Pentex Group.
And last but not least, that woman who was there, recording the whole vile thing and cheering the boys on. Here's the kicker: she's part of an Israeli feminist organization. That's...such despicable irony.
Or maybe it's par for the course, considering it's fuckin' Israel. Scum like that are pretty representative of the only democracy in the Middle East (tm).
To this very night, they remain unpunished for their crimes. And it's people like Svetlana (and countless others) that are left with that horrific trauma, misery, and despair.
All the while, those who caused it are living it up and have even more money, power, and success than ever before. Their wealth and influence continue to grow. They're getting away with it. The world isn't fair sometimes; you learn that shit pretty early in life.
Svetlana doesn't say a word. She merely sits there, looking at her Sire. She leans forward and hugs him, red tears rolling down both their cheeks.
She whispers into his ear, "I forgive you, John. I--I forgive you. You--you are now a--a good man, John."
Svetlana knows that what happened to Ladonna Hughes was a horrible tragedy, inexcusable, even. And it's likely that no one will ever truly know why Fatima chose to spare John and not the others.
She knows that her Sire has done much good in her short time in this world that she now finds herself in, this world of darkness and secrets.
John hugs her tightly and replies, "And you're...a good person, too. Thank you for everything, Svetlana. Thanks for...understanding."
Svetlana breaks the hug and wipes the bloody tears off her face, leaving red smudges across her cheeks. She smiles tightly, "I am here for you, as you are also here for me. That is...good, yes? Watching each other's backs, like you said, no?"
John nods, "Of course, Svetlana. You can always count on me. And, um, I'll be there for you, too. We'll be there for each other. We have to, especially now."
He takes a moment to look around his Childe's Haven, "I know it was hard- you telling me what happened to you- but it had to be done, it had to be said. It took a lotta strength and courage from your end, huh?"
Svetlana turns her gaze downward, "And your story...is not easy, no? All that baggage? Do you think Fatima has forgiven you?"
"I haven't seen her or heard from her ever since she left that night. I'd like to think that she has, but I'm not gonna fool myself into thinking that."
He then shrugs and adds, "It's been over, what, 50 years? I honestly doubt we'll cross paths again, even if we wanted to. But I'd still like to think that she has for--forgiven me. She had so much anger and resentment towards me, but...she spared me all the same. Why?"
John sighs and continues, "I mean, I don't know if I've truly forgiven myself for what happened. But what I think or how I 'feel' doesn't really matter. It shouldn't. This is my wrongdoing, and I've got an eternity to make up for it. That's a...that's a pretty long time, heh."
"Da. Is very long time. Do you think it will--" Svetlana's voice cracks and her lips tremble. She closes her eyes and takes a deep breath. Her dead heart aches as she thinks back to those terrible memories, "--get better for all of us?"
John can see that his Childe is still in pain. He slowly and gently places his cold hand on top of hers, "I dunno, Svetlana. Maybe it does, maybe it doesn't. At the very least, I hope things don't get any worse than they are right now."
A sincere answer, all things considered.
Svetlana accepts it with a quick nod, "Hmm. Is much to think about. You promise me, John?"
"Promise you what?"
"That you will help me to Diablerize someone when time is right?" there's a dark glint in her green eyes. She's dead serious. A little too serious, perhaps.
"If that's what you want to do, I'm right there with you, Svetlana. When it happens, we'll do it and I'll guide you through it- gently this time. If it doesn't happen, then we can wait; we're Kindred after all, heh. When you're ready, I'm ready."
"It--it will be like you said the last time- unforgettable experience, da?"
John smiles from ear to ear and nods his head as way of response.
Svetlana then stands up from her sofa. She wipes some more red tears off her face, "Thank you, John. Spasibo. You have--you have been good Sire to me, a very good one. Good teacher and trainer as well. Thank you for everything."
John smiles and gets up, "And uh...thanks for listening, Svetlana. I know I've probably altered your perception of me as this really great guy, but I--I wasn't always this way. It took a lot of sharp turns to get to where I am now."
She merely gives her Sire a weak smile in response. The pair exchange pleasantries, and she wishes him a goodnight. As John is leaving her Haven, he feels...lighter, but only by a bit. He still has a ton of weight on his shoulders, but he's glad that it's been shared.
On his way back to his Haven, he puts his earphones deep in his ear and puts on some Kristin Mainhart tunes to listen to on the long walk back.
John knows that it'll take some time to get over all of this, but he hopes that he's made a good start tonight. Maybe 1 night, he can look back and find the answers to questions about his Sire that still linger in his mind.
Until that night comes, he'll just have to do good and keep in touch with his Humanity.
As for Svetlana Bobrov, she lays back on her couch and just sits there, silently thinking about what the future holds for her and those closest to her- John, Samir, Zeina, Abdullah, Saoirse, Camille, Paul, Tommy, Garth, and whoever else she'll cross paths with in her Unlife.
She hopes that things will get better not just for her, but for all of them. That is the hope and dream that they'll cling to.
That is the hope that'll keep 'em going?
But, where to? Would they even survive? After tonight's skirmishes, the SI thugs are now on full alert and are scouring the entire UAE for the blank bodies. No stone is to be left unturned.
It's gonna be a bumpy ride in the coming nights, no doubt about it!
As the sun is about to rise, Svetlana makes her way to her bed and gets settled in. She feels heavy and sluggish. Still sore from the battle earlier in the evening, she groans as she slowly lays down.
Her last thoughts before the day-sleep embraces her is on her Sire- from their first time ever meeting after her post-Embrace Frenzy, their sparring matches, his training lessons, to the night where she had confided in him- this very night.
Tonight's conversation about their broken and troubling histories- how far they've both come, how far they still have to go, and what the future holds for them.
If there's any future at all...
As for John Suarez, his mind drifts to that song that Ladonna had sung on that night. It was something she herself had written, apparently. Before she could name it or get it released, well...you know.
The lyrics loop in his mind as he is dragged into the welcoming abyss of the day-sleep.
"I've forgotten you / I never think of you / The way you walked, the way you talked, the things you used to say."
By the time the sun rears its head, the last lines of the song ring out in his mind as he completely taken in, "Oh, what a lie! / I shall think of you / Think of you / Think of you / Till I die."
That's when the Assamite Neonate finally slips away for the day-sleep to claim him, his body as still and cold as a corpse.
Svetlana's eyes shut and her body goes completely under; her final thoughts are of the Wraith that is bound to her- little Chloe.
And with that, the Kindred in this particular corner of the globe are fast asleep.
Chapter 17: Clash
As the sun relentlessly beams down on the gilded city below, the Kindred continue to slumber the day away. The sun bathes the city in a golden-yellow glow. Cars and large trucks zoom about the streets. The city's skyline shimmers and sparkles in the early morning sunlight.
The people of this land are hustling and bustling about their daily routines and duties. They are going about their business in the UAE as they would do in any other given day.
Meanwhile, the Emirati authorities are doing their best to cover up all the chaos and destruction that occurred last night. The papers report some fires near the parking lot, nothing to worry about, folks! Just some old cars catching fire!
Hey, look, shiny, why don't you forget all about it, habibi?
After all, you came all the way here to spend (waste) dirhams on useless and meaningless trinkets, didn't you?
There are now even more questions than answers. All the while, the Kindred sleep in peace. Well, most of them do at least. Some, however, find themselves lulled in by dreams.
Dreams of the past and present, dreams of hopes and wishes, dreams of things that have been and dreams of things that might be.
John thinks of the man who mentored him, showed him a better way was possible for all- Kindred, mortal, or otherwise: Dr. George Fateh.
John would often say, "Fatima might be my Sire, but Dr. George will always be someone I consider as one."
Apart from being 1 (of the many) founding members of the Blade of Haqim, Dr. Fateh taught John a lot about the plight of the Palestinian people and how the Blade should strive to help them in any way possible, by any means necessary.
"We are not just warriors, Fledgling. We are scholars, physicians, poets, writers, teachers, singers, philosophers, and more. We are...a people. A people that seek a better world, Fledgling- a more just world. That is what we seek, something you must always remember, now that you are 1 of us."
John's blurry memory of Dr. George Fateh then fades away as the abyssal nothingness of the day-sleep continues to hold him in its cold embrace. The rest of the Kindred do likewise. They sleep the day away.
Dr. George Fateh fled to Magnolia City, alongside with Fatima and a few other Blade of Haqim members because Israel's actions were getting more and more brutal as the nights went on. It was getting perilous for them to stay and fight against the then-still-young Zionist entity.
With sanguine tears running down their ashen faces, they fled Palestine. Staying there, would in all likelihood, incur even greater wrath of their enemies, be they Kine or Kindred.
Some fled to faraway lands whilst others chose to stay and fight. Other Blade members opted for countries that were closer- stories say that they even walked all the way to their intended destinations.
There were even Garou in Palestine, but the Israelis either had their own Garou (or a whole load of silver munitions and deadly weapons) to wipe them out or send them fleeing for their lives.
Dr. Fateh himself, despite being a doctor, had done his fair share of Judging. It was said that he killed 10 mortal members of the Haganah (precursor to the IDF) in the blink of an eye. He had quite the mastery over the Celerity Discipline.
Not surprisingly, this earned the Assamite doctor quite the reputation amongst friend and foe alike. The Israeli Kindred were reluctant to call a Blood Hunt on him, as it would jeopardize their relationship with their mortal counterparts and expose their true nature as bloodsuckers.
After all, the Masquerade still had to be upheld, somehow.
Regardless, Kindred or Kine, the Zionists were absolutely hellbent on ethnically cleansing Palestine.
In due time, that great and mighty star of heat begins its dramatic descent into the horizon. The city is bathed in deep-red hues. As the sun slowly sinks below the horizon, the golden-yellow light gradually shifts to a pink-orange hue.
The stars start to peek out from the twilight sky. The moon begins its climb towards the heavens. Night falls over Al-Kushraf once more.
As the last rays of sunlight disappear, the night's shadows grow longer. Night lights buzz and beam on across the city. The air is warm and crisp as the darkness begins to envelop the entire region.
The nightlife here is just as lively as it is during the day. More so than Dubai, apparently. The bars, nightclubs, restaurants, and other venues of entertainment are alive with warm and sweaty bodies. The streets are full of pedestrians, people on the move, cars and trucks zipping by, and more.
Tried and hunched-over office drones meander onto an already full bus. Broken migrant construction workers trudge past a row of brightly lit restaurants. Loud and boisterous partying students stumble down the street, laughing and singing in Spanish.
As the people of this gilded cage go about their lives and whatnot, the Kindred begin to wake up and stir from their slumber, each with their own plans and tasks for the evening.
The SI thugs are on high alert after last night's skirmishes. Their eyes and ears are wide open and ready for anything that might come their way. They're still no closer to finding out who the blank bodies are, or where they are hiding, but the hunt continues, nonetheless.
Patrols are doubled and Commander Gallant logs on for a chat with his superiors at the Israeli High Command (ILHC). He sits at his desk, wipes some crumbs off his uniform, and clears his throat before initiating the secretive text chat.
OBED: "Commander Obed Gallant reporting in."
ILHC: "What is the situation, Commander Gallant? We've just received the reports of your Lieutenants. These latest developments are not pleasing, to say the least."
OBED: "I admit that last night's attacks were a failure on our part. They split us up- intentionally. We are now working on finding out how these blank bodies were able to do so."
ILHC: "It has something to do with those SD cards they've been looting and salvaging from the corpses of our fallen heroes."
OBED: "Yes, that appears to be the case. Lt. Davidai wisely suggested installing worms deep in our devices. We're also looking into our own ranks, to see if any of them could be compromised."
ILHC: "See that you do so. It seems like the enemy knows far too much about us than they should."
OBED: "Yes, it should be the other way around."
ILHC: "How many did you lose last night?"
OBED: "The exact number is in the reports. You will forgive me if I do not remember it. Regardless, every one of them was a true hero of Am Yisrael. They will not be forgotten, I assure you."

His tone does contain some nostalgia, but it is mixed with regret and longing.

Bullshit.

The 2 idly walk about and look at the various dials and knobs in the generator room. There's a skeleton near the center of it, wearing a worker's uniform. The uniform doesn't appear that old and the skeleton is in some kind of pose.
Seth curiously looks it over, wondering what happened to whoever this was. His attention is soon drawn to the generator itself. It looks like it's still operational somehow, and it seems to be pumping out energy. It hums and purrs softly, but it's caked in layers of dust and other nasties.
A few spider webs cover the ceiling, but Edwin brushes them aside with his bare hand. He curiously turns a few of the dials, but it makes no sense to him.
Seth shrugs and twirls his cane, then pats Edwin's shoulder. He points to a door that leads to a basement, but it's been boarded up, "Hm, hmm. Come on, let's try going this way."
He pries the boards off with his raw preternatural strength and starts making his way down the stairs. The railings are shaky, but the few lights overhead seem to be new.
The muffled sounds of voices come from below and they're a whole lot more audible now. It's still dark, but there's some light. Edwin quietly follows in tow, his hands clenched into fists.
At the bottom of the staircase, Seth is hit by a wave of putrid air. He doesn't react to it, but Edwin gags and has to put his hand over his nose and mouth.
The lights are old-looking, and the power plant's generators are big, old, and softly purring like huge cats. Seth hears the sounds of an argument in the distance and recognizes some of the voices.
Standing afar from the group are those 2 surly Setites- Joyce and Tristan. They're both dressed in formal wear and look a bit stiff. Joyce nods over to the approaching High Priest while Tristan approaches him.
He does a lazy thumb-back to the group and speaks in a muffled tone, "They're having a bit of a chin wag back there, Seth. Everyone's here. All the Primogens, those 2 Assamites--"
Seth's dead eyes light up, "Svetlana's here??"
"Yes, she's here, boss."
Without saying anything, Seth pushes past his 2 fellow Setites and makes a beeline for the group. Paul, the Toreador Harpy, is pacing about and taking long and shuddering drags from his strawberry-flavored vape pen. He's dressed in a casual blue suit and a white button-down shirt. A puffy rose is pinned to his lapel.
There's a tension in the air as he does this, and it's mostly coming from the 2 Assamites who are present- John and Svetlana. The former is arguing with Vizier Mohammed, who is dressed in a black thawb, while the latter is keeping her head hung low and hands clasped in front of her.
Seth quietly approaches and waits for his moment. The Nosferatu Primogen, Tommy, is the first to notice him, and he gives him a wee call out, his Scottish accent ever so grating and thick, "Oi, Sethie, boy! 'Mon here, ya bawbag! Been a wee while, eh?" he waves the High Priest over and lets out a garbled chuckle.
The Setite looks at the Nossie from head to toe and dryly says, "Thomas. How are things? I take it we're making progress in our campaign against the Second Inquisition?"
"Simmer doon, pal, simmer doon, awright? Naw be jumping into things without a wee warm up. I trust yous had no trouble finding this place, eh?"
Seth sighs faintly, "It's a bit off the beaten path, no wonder it's popular with you Crawlers then, hmm?"
Tommy adjusts his trademark mosaic-patterned porcelain mask and tugs on his suit jacket. He shakes his head and waltzes off. Absalom, the Malkavian Primogen, approaches the High Priest, intent guiding his every step.
The Elder Lunatic is dressed in a dark maroon-red thawb. His blue eyes are as cold and piercing as ever. Even Seth (!) feels so taken aback by the Elder's...everything, really. His penetrating stare, his deep and authoritative voice, his very presence. It's all so unnerving.
The Malk bows his head, "High Priest." His voice is as calm and measured as ever, and his eyes are as icy as can be.
Seth faintly smiles, "Absalom. How are things on your end. I know you haven't exactly been working with the Blade to get rid of the SI- you have your reasons- but how are things otherwise?"
Absalom goes on to tell the High Priest about he and his fellow Mockers have been fighting against the forces of the SI. Apparently, they've been waging more...psychological forms of...warfare, if one could call it that.
Using various amalgams of Malkavian Disciplines (Auspex, Obfuscate, Dementation, etc.), they've been subtly spreading fear, uncertainty, and doubt amongst the lower rungs of the Unit 8211 hierarchy. Simple redirections, deterring patrols through a certain region, and so on.
Absalom, for his part, is fairly measured in his explanation of his Clan's activities over the past few nights. He doesn't get over-excited or wildly gesticulate like...Mr. Bean.
Yeah, he's here, too. He's excitedly talking about how he fooled an entire plainclothes patrol unit into driving their vehicle into an open pit, resulting in a single fatality and numerous injuries.
The young Malk wildly gesticulates and makes all kinds of arm movements, while Absalom remains as still as a statue. Seth frowns at this, but he knows that such clowning is probably to be expected from Jesters.
At least they're doing their part.
Mark, the Ventrue Primogen, is awkwardly standing near a wall, his arms folded in front of him, looking out of place. He's dressed in a bulky fur coat, and his sunglasses are in place.
He greets Seth, but his demeanor is cold, and his tone is neutral (a bit forced, too), if not somewhat gruff. The Setite briefly looks him over. He's heard a lot about how Mr. Kincaid here has been taking a free ride in high-end mortal institutions, how he's been misusing the Dominate Discipline, and so on.
Regardless, Seth extends his cold hand and Mark takes it, forcing a tight smile, "Yo, Seth! Hey! 'Sup?"
"You tell me, Mr. Kincaid. I hope you've at least cleared some of the outstanding debts you owe."
The Blue Blood dismissively waves his hand, "Yeah, yeah. I did. Heh." The mischievous undertone in his voice clearly indicates that he did not, well not in the way expected.
It's likely that he just doubles down on Dominate, continuing to turn people's brains to mush just to get VIP access to those fancy casinos and clubs and shit.
"Mm. Good."
Seth proceeds to slowly walk over to the Toreador Primogen. Sebastian is dressed in a custom-made jade suit. His moccasins look imported and he's wearing no socks. His hair is gelled and tied into a fancy bun.
He stands casually and looks at his nails like they're the best thing in the world, not really bothered about anyone (or anything) around him.
"Seth. Nice fit. The brown and yellow really do bring out the color in those amber eyes of yours...the shades, though? Nah, I'd ditch those for some nice Guccis, but that's just me."
Seth purses his lips and stiffly nods, "Hmm, interesting. I'll keep that in mind, Mr. Gorsky."
He hears a slight chittering coming from 1 of the nearby generators. Seb continues preening himself and avoiding everyone else.
Lastly, there's Vizier Mohammed Khan. His charge, Ms. Kawasaki is nearby. She's got that permanent scowl on her face. She's wearing a simple leather jacket and black denims. She grits her teeth and holds tightly onto the handle of her tantō, clearly itching for a fight.
The Vizier is busy arguing with John. The latter looks like he's about to lunge forward, but Vizier Mohammed extends his hands out in an almost placating gesture and shoots him a look, warning him to back off.
When Seth approaches, John backs off, grumbling under his breath.
Vizier Mohammed takes Seth's hands in both his hands and gives it a firm shake. He speaks in a strong and booming tone, "Ah, High Priest! Welcome, welcome! How are faring tonight?"
Seth smiles and plainly nods, "By Typhon's grace, I'm doing fine, Mr. Khan. How are you and how's your...charge keeping?"
"I fare well, as does Ms. Kawasaki. It is good that you came when you did, High Priest. This John is getting worse by the minute. He has a temper, and it needs to be controlled!"
The Assamite Primogen huffs and sharply turns his head.
Seth smiles and answers, "I'll talk to him. You just wait here."
With that, the Viper approaches John and simply asks, "So, how are things going, hmm? You're making quite the mess all over this city. Not that I'm complaining, of course. But isn't it getting a bit...out of hand? Ideally, you're supposed to get rid of the SI- discreetly, not start a war."
John's face scrunches in anger, "Yeah, no shit, man! What do you think we've been doing for the past couple of nights, huh? Last night was a mess. Reasons. We lost a few. Like I said numerous times before: there's not very many of us to do this, OK?!"
Getting frustrated, he continues, "So, I was trying to ask Mohammed over there, spineless asshole, if he'd be willing to allow the other Banu Haqim in this city to join us, but he--he--"
The speedy Assamite snarls and shouts at the Vizier, "--HE FUCKING REFUSES TO LET THEM JOIN US! We're of the same Clan, you asshole!"
Seth frowns and firmly stares at John, "Mr. Suarez, please. Calm down. I don't need you blowing a gasket on me here. Talk to me. You need money, weapons--"
John furiously claps back, his dead eyes burning with anger, "We need people, dammit! Not platitudes or toys or--or...cash, but...no, never mind."
Seth puts his hand on John's strained shoulder and looks into his eyes, "I know that look, John. It's desperation, isn't it? What is it, c'mon, tell me. I'm here to help."
John sighs deeply, "Since we're all out there, fighting those Israeli lunatics and all, we've had to take...a lotta time off our work. As it stands, we're already on precarious grounds and we need our jobs to keep a damn roof over our heads--"
Seth firmly says, "Get to the point."
"Svetlana's been turning down babysitting gigs. I've also been turning a few private Kenpo-teaching opportunities down. Real lucrative stuff, heh. The rest of us are doing the same, and it's putting us at risk. We don't wanna be thrown out into the mean streets of this city."
Seth sighs and looks around before responding, "I'm sorry to hear that, Mr. Suarez. Truly. I...wish I could help. I probably could, but it'd end up raising more eyebrows and that's not good for any of us. Especially right now. How's Svetlana doing, by the way?"
"She's uh...yeah, she's a bit shaken up, but she knows how to hold her own in a fight."
Seth doesn't say much else. He merely lifts his chin and approaches Svetlana with a stride of confidence. Overconfidence, perhaps.
She's standing aside, head lowered, and hands still clasped. She has an empty stare in her green eyes.
Seth approaches her, and she looks up at him, "Svetlana. How are you, hmm?" His tone changes from one of contempt to a warm and gentle tone.
Svetlana is taken aback and slightly stutters, "I...I am fine. How...how are you, Seth?" Her lips are slightly trembling.
Seth takes her hand and caresses it gently, "Oh, Svetlana, I'm good, good. I've been well and doing great things, great things indeed. How goes the fight against the SI? I hope they haven't uh...hurt you too much, hmm?"
Svetlana gingerly withdraws her hand and nods, "Is no issue. I know how to fight, and I am very strong and capable--"
She sounds on the verge of tears. Seth lightly lifts her chin, "Hey, hey, easy, easy there, Svetlana. I know how it is. Shh, shh."
The High Priest smiles and tries to calm her, "It's all going to be fine, you'll see. You've got those um...sharp and uh...fancy and pointy daggers of yours, right? Heh, I'm pretty sure no one's gonna...err...mess with you when you've got those."
He lowers his voice, "Anyway, enough about that. How have YOU been doing, Svetlana? Your Sire told me you've been having some money issues? I hope you know I could easily help you out with that--"
Svetlana frowns and tries to shuffle away, "I appreciate your kindness, Seth, but--"
Seth pulls her back and places his hands on her shoulders. He tries to reassure her, "It's no problem, Svetlana. I have enough money, lots of it in fact. I could easily pay your rent, bills, all that, or, if you'd prefer, I can give you some every night for however long you need it. If that's not enough, I can arrange for a good job or 2."
Svetlana faintly smiles and sniffs, sanguine tears rolling down her face, "No, Seth, but I don't want you to--"
"Shh, shh," Seth pulls her into a warm embrace, his hands caressing her back as he does so. His eyes turn into slits, and he feels his dead heart act up as he holds her close. She tries to wiggle out, but it's futile.
He ignores her struggling and goes on, "Shh, shh. Everything will be OK, I promise you that. As Typhon is my witness, I promise you that. I know that you're struggling with all this and I...I'm willing to help you."
Svetlana groans and grunts, "Pl--Please, Seth. Let go of me. No--no touch like that! Errrrgh!"
Seth immediately lets go, but not before stroking her cheek with his trembling hand. Svetlana is taken aback, and she recoils in shock. Her eyes are wide and her expression is...confused.
Seth is unfazed by this, "I just wanna help you, Svetlana. Be there for you, comfort you, protect you, guide you, all that stuff. I mean you no harm. None whatsoever." He is really desperate in his attempts to make her understand his point of view.
Svetlana warily narrows her eyes, "Why? Why so much kindness to me only? You already showed us kindness by allowing us in city. You also bought for me and John new phone, but, why?"
Seth gulps and answers, "Because you're 1 of us, Svetlana. You're a Kindred, just like I am."
"That--that is not the reason..."
Seth tightly smiles, "You're right, that isn't the only reason. Truth is, I've been wanting to get close to you, Svetlana. I'm fascinated by you, Ms. Bobrov. Ever since you and the rest of the Assamites showed up that night. I...I felt something when our eyes first met. I can't explain it."
Woah!
Svetlana gasps and her jaw goes agape. She looks confused, scared, and doubtful at the same time.
Seth licks his lips and adds, "I like you, Svetlana. I--I was debating whether I should tell you or not, but I just couldn't go on like this. You fascinate me. I wanna know what makes you tick. I wanna know what your--your hopes and dreams and--and ambitions are."
With a sparkle in his eyes, he goes on to tell her, "It's not like I wanna do anything...untoward. You're...special. Delicate, even. I just wanna get to know you more, y'know, take this 1 step at a time. We can go as slow as you want..."
Svetlana is at a complete and total loss for words. She just stands there, slack-jawed and dumbfounded by the High Priest's admission.
Seth continues, "Anyway, like I said, I've got lots of money. I'm willing to do what it takes to make things better for you. Only you. All you have to do is...ask and you shall receive. Knock and I'll be there, anytime, to fling open that door and let you in. OK?"
The Assamite Neonate takes a step back, unsure of what to say or how to respond. She just gives Seth a blank look.
"You can ask for help or support whenever you want, Svetlana. If you really need money, I could--"
Svetlana holds up her hand and stammers, "Nyet. Is--is no problem. I--thank you, Seth. You are kind man. You are also, I think, nice man. But I do not know if I--I am ready for what you are asking. It would be better, I think, to be only...friendly with each other, no?"
The High Priest forces a confident smile on his face. He simply answers, "Take your time, Svetlana. I'm not in a rush, neither are you. I'm sorry if I came on a little forceful back there, but I just needed to make you understand."
"Understand?"
"Yes. I think you understand me now. This isn't like any of your previous boyfriends or...whatever. I see something in you, Svetlana. Something special. A spark, a flicker, a fire. You're more than just a Banu Haqim Neonate. More than just a woman capable of fighting, much more than that. There's something about you, Svetlana."
Svetlana gives him a sidelong glance, eyes narrowed, "There is a lot you do not know about me, Seth--"
The Sand-Snake cuts her off and pleads, taking her hands in his, "Then tell me! Tell me everything about yourself! All the secrets, the joys, the fears, the horrors, everything! I won't judge you or--or look at you in a funny way. Trust me, Svetlana. Let me in."
He looks her dead in the eye, "Please, Svetlana."
Svetlana shakes her head, "Nyet. I--I do not know if I can do that. Please, Seth. Not now. We have Second Inquisition to fight. We must put aside all our feelings and only focus on Judging the enemy. Maybe after, when it is all over, we can...talk?"
Seth begrudgingly accepts this, "Hmph. Fine. Yes, you're right, Svetlana. Absolutely right. The squeaky wheel gets the grease; fighting the SI comes first."
"I thank you, Seth. Spasibo. Please, help John, help the Blade. He is very, very worried. We do not have enough people to fight the enemy."
"Of course, Svetlana. Don't worry, I'll talk with the others and see if we can come to some sort of mutually beneficial arrangement." He twirls his cane and walks off, feeling a bit disappointed that things didn't go the way he'd hoped they would.
(What the hell was he hoping to accomplish, anyway?!)
Seth walks to the center of this place and waves for all the Kindred to gather. It takes a little while, but they all eventually gather around him in a circle and listen.
Tommy, Paul, and John look a bit huffy and pissed off, but they manage to stay quiet. Svetlana has that serious, determined look on her face.
Seb and Mark remain indifferent. Absalom and Mr. Bean stand next to each other and fold their arms in front of them.
Vizier Mohammed contemptuously glowers at John and his Childe while Ms. Kawasaki twitches and tries to resist the urge to put her blade through someone's chest.
Seth paces around and speaks, "This is a big night for us. We still have the Second Inquisition running around, taking pot-shots at anyone and anything. It would seem that we've...rattled the hornet's nest."
Paul scratches his nose with his thumb and remarks, "C'mon, Seth, we've barely put a dent in the SI's infrastructure in this city!"
Seth clears his throat, "We'll get to that later, Paul. However, we can take comfort in the fact that they've been drawn out. We know what they are, we have some idea of how they operate, and we also have an inkling of how they fight."
Tommy chimes in, "Aye, they fight dirty! Bunch of fucking wallopers, they are! Grrr!"
Seth chuckles and proceeds, "Thank you, Mr. Bollard, for that insight. Also, it's best that we don't underestimate them. Heh, of course, I'm preaching to the choir at this point. I've heard the Blade's been busy. Mr. Suarez? John? Care to come up here and tell us what you've seen?"
John starts off by saying, "We need people if we're gonna get this shit done with, OK?! Now, our spineless asshole of a Primogen..."
He points a finger to the Vizier, "...REFUSES to let the other Banu Haqim get involved in this damn fight. He's the one who's fucking this up and holding us back here! There--there's barely 40 of us a--and we've already lost a few good people last night! WE NEED HELP!"
Seth calmly nods and offers, "I'm sure all of are willing to do so, if we can reach a common ground."
John's face contorts into a series of twitches and squints, and he lets out an enraged snarl, "The fuck does that mean?! ALL our Unlives are at stake here! We're the ones risking our necks out there, night after goddamn night, to whittle these bastards down! Now ain't the time for petty politics or fuckin' blood oaths, man!"
Tommy awkwardly chuckles and stares at the ceiling, "Aye. Don't mean tae cause a ruckus in this wee gaffe, but John's right. This is no the time for all this shite."
Absalom concurs, "I agree. We have already borne witness to the handiwork of our foes- the Marjan Tower is nothing but rubble. 100s destroyed, all gone in an instant. 1000s more will be claimed and lost unless they are driven from these lands. They have already slain far more than we have. We have to stop them, High Priest."
Mark opines, "Well, I'm not a member of the SI fan club, but I'm also not about to get my hands dirty in this...whatever this is. The Ventrue have their own thing going on and with all the recent chaos, our business interests have um...taken quite a hit."
John angrily spits, "Fuck your business interests."
Mark shrugs that off and continues, "It's just the way it is, buddy. I'm doing my best to deal with this the right way, and I'm getting a ton of pressure from my fellow Ambitiones to make sure that things don't come crashing down all around us- literally and metaphorically. It--it isn't easy, OK?!"
Sebastian muses, "I'm with Mark on this. Unbelievable, I know. Do you know how many shows, photoshoots, auditions, parties, and events I've had to cancel or postpone to NEXT FUCKING YEAR?! You know how much money I've been burning--"
Svetlana cuts him off, "Shut up! Or I will come there and slap you again!" she follows it up with some choice curse words in Ukrainian. Paul faintly chuckles at that and takes a quick huff from his vape pen.
Sebastian gives her a dirty look, but he keeps his mouth shut.
Seth rolls a shoulder and shakes his head, "I'm not asking you to give up your Unlives or your money or resources. Hmph, well not yet anyways. No, if anyone's gonna foot the 'bill' for all this, it's us- the Ministry. It won't be easy, or cheap, but we've more or less spoken amongst ourselves and agreed to pay...should the need arise."
Vizier Mohammed grunts steps forward, "The Banu Haqim will aid YOU and your Clan, High Priest. I refuse to lend any support to the Blade of Haqim. These extremists disgrace our great Antediluvian by bearing his name in vain."
John's face contorts into a mixture of rage and shock, "FUCK YOU, you spineless, sniveling little sh--" he screams and lunges forward, but Svetlana bolts forward and restrains her Sire.
Vizier Mohammed yelps and cowers away while Ms. Kawasaki leaps forward and pulls out her tantō and brandishes it around in a threatening manner.
Svetlana pleads with her Sire to control his anger, "John, John, no! Do not do it. Is not worth it, John, stop. No!"
Ms. Kawasaki growls and taunts her 2 fellow Assamites, "C'mon, you jokers. Just gimme a reason. All I need is a reason to split your heads from your bodies." She looks like she wants, more than anything, to fight.
Mr. Bean snickers at this but quickly catches himself and straightens his back. He clears his throat and looks at Absalom. He looks back at his charge and says nothing in response.
Vizier Mohammed hobbles away and cowers behind his charge, peering over her shoulder and shooting mean, dirty looks at Svetlana and John.
Seth shakes his head and goes on, "Don't worry, Ms. Kawasaki, you'll have your chance to cut loose later on but now is not the time. Anyway, where were we?"
John answers, "A status update! WE have been risking our necks out there, doing YOUR dirty work, and for WHAT?! So, the rest of you assholes can line your fuckin' pockets with MORE cash and shiny trinkets?!"
Absalom sternly commands, "Calm yourself, Saracen. Even the Malkavians have, as you say, been risking their necks in the struggle against the forces of the Second Inquisition. You are not the only ones fighting them."
The Malkavian Elder calmly tilts his head and looks John directly in the eye, "Do not overestimate your capabilities, Assamite. I know better than anyone in here that it is easier to meet Final Death on nights such as these- perilous and savage nights, where the demise of untold 1000s is a certainty and survival is not a guarantee, but a luxury earned."
Mr. Bean quips, "Mmm-hmm. What he basically said, um...yep. We haven't exactly been slashing and slicing those goons up, like--" he makes all kinds of funny sounds and slashing gestures with an imaginary knife.
He awkwardly laughs and brings his fingers to the sides of his head, "We've been playing mind games with 'em! Like, making them doubt their sense of reality, sending them on wild goose chases till they run outta gas, and all that shit. They're definitely a whole lot more confused right now, heh heh!"
Absalom frowns and sighs, "Not...necessarily so, Mr. Bean. But, yes, we have been fighting against our common foe utilizing methods that are more unconventional in nature. Our...unique set of skills has proved useful in helping us stymie their activities in the region."
John's face is a mix of anger, confusion, and shock. He asks, "Is that all you've been doing? Fuckin' theme park mind games?!"
Tommy intervenes and glares at John, "Aye, simmer doon, pal. Simmer doon. It's working, that's all that matters, awright? We help these wee Malks here keep those SI bastards occupied and chasing after the sands. They do that and they're away from you lot, so you don't have that many tae chib. Sounds good, aye?"
John sees the logic of Tommy's reasoning, "Hmm, OK, fine. Yeah, if there's more out there chasing after phantoms, it means there's less to shoot at us when we do encounter each other. Alright, fine. We'll...let the Malkavians do their thing, give 'em a wide berth and all that."
Seth pats John's back and turns to the rest, "Good, good. All on the same page, I hope? Great! Thomas, I believe you have something for us? That's why you called us here, right? Care to share whatever it is with the rest of the class?"
The Nosferatu Primogen rubs his deformed hands together and adjusts his mosaic porcelain mask. He steps forward, but not before giving Mark and Seb a cold glance.
He takes a deep breath and forces it out, "I believe we've found a way into their systems."
Gasps of surprise and murmurs of anticipation erupt from amongst the crowd.
Tommy scratches the side of his mask and goes on to say, "Now, now, no be getting your pants in a twist, awright? No be jumping the gun here, aye? Geez a few more nights, just a few, to gather more data and make sure our own systems are capable of handling whatever these cunts might throw at us."
Seth purses his lips and sighs, "Go on. What do you have, Thomas?"
"Oi, well, it's a wee bit complex, Sethie, boy. We need more data, those SD cards that the Assamites 'ave been providing should do, but we are gonnae need a hell lot more than that. A LOT more than that, that's all I can say at the moment. I don't want to get you all excited. Just wait for a wee bit more time and then we will proceed, aye?"
Seth contemplatively strokes his chin, "Very well. What would you need from us, in terms of...resources and the like?"
Tommy confidently answers, "Computers- powerful ones, not that tech store shite. And lots of them. Space, also lots of it. And leccy, uninterrupted; it's been all dodgy these past few nights. Internet, too, blazing fast. Ours is a wee bit spotty down in those manky auld sewers, heh."
Seth's eyebrows shoot up, "Well, I'll see what I can do. I think I know someone from our Clan who's a VP in an Internet company. I can get them to uh...reroute some bandwidth, or whatever it's called, to you Crawlers. Sound alright? I could also arrange a few computer parts currently languishing in a port. It's been just sitting there, gathering dust, I think."
Tommy claps the Typhonist on the back and answers, "Aye, thanks! Much obliged, pal. Much obliged. Don't worry, no be getting your knickers in a twist over it, eh?"
Seth smiles and nods, "Oh, I'm not worried, not 1 bit. I'm sure that everything will work out great in the end." There's a sinister undertone in his voice, one that no one notices or catches on to.
Absalom, however, narrows his eyes and glares at the High Priest, a subtle smirk forming on the latter's mouth.
Seth extends his hands out, "Well, there's still the numbers problem. I know the Vizier has his mind made up and nothing's gonna change that. Anyone else here willing to offer Kindred who can fight and aren't afraid of the sight of blood and guts and gore- lots of it, heh."
Shaking heads and murmurs all around.
Seth sharply exhales, "Hm, well, it is what it is, I guess. For what it's worth, the Ministry stands by whoever's out there, risking Unlife and limb, to drive these SI hooligans from this Domain."
The Nosferatu Primogen raises his chin and pointedly asks, "Then how come YOU are no out there, fighting these cunts alongside the Assamites and Lunatics?"
Seth's face tics and he forces an awkward, but faint, smile on his face, "Oh, I am offering my support, Mr. Bollard. Don't get me wrong, I'm not a coward or a wimp or anything like that."
He stops for a moment and studies everyone gathered here. He proceeds, "I will never ask you to do anything that I wouldn’t do myself. But I feel strongly that my role in this should be one of support and guidance...of a spiritual nature. The outward wounds may or may not mend themselves with the passage of time, but the inward ones..."
He lets that linger in the air and paces around, "Anyway, I think that's enough for 1 night. We'll continue this later, when the time is right. Keep doing whatever it is you're doing, because that seems to be working, despite the setbacks."
John sighs and shakes his head, "If that's all, then...sure. I'll have to relay the not-so-great news to the rest of us, they're not gonna be too thrilled about it."
Seth smiles and offers, "May Typhon be with you all in your many endeavors, be they mundane, spiritual, or otherwise."
John scoffs and mutters to himself, "Pfft, not exactly worth the paper it's written on. Hfft, fine, thanks anyway. C'mon, Svetlana, let's get the hell outta here. We got some more nests to shake out tonight. Let's hope there's not too many of these fuckers out there..."
Svetlana nods and follows her Sire, "Spasibo, Seth." She curtly bows her head and briskly walks off.
Tommy calls out to the 2 Assamites, "Oi, same arrangement, aye? Geez more of those wee SD cards and shite! Garth will be waiting for yous near the westside sewer entrance, OK? It's a big tunnel, easy to get lost in, so watch yourselves, awright?"
The 2 Banu Haqim nod and head off, determination marking every step they make.
John rubs his hands together, "I think that's all. Let's get back out there and kick some ass, or whatever. And let's hope our asses don't take too hard of a kicking, heh."
"Da."
The rest of the bloodsuckers here either talk amongst themselves about fairly unimportant matters or choose to keep quiet and walk away.
Absalom is the next to leave, followed closely by Mr. Bean.
Vizier Mohammed keeps his head lowered and speaks to the High Priest in a low voice, "Mr. Steale. A word, if you will."
Seth and the Assamite Vizier go to a secluded area and begin to have a very hush-hush chat about something. Tommy's innate curiosity is piqued, and he cranes his neck, trying to overhear them.
Unfortunately, he's too far away. Still, he makes out certain phrases, like "guarantee", "rid", "entire" and so on. He's not exactly sure what they're talking about, but he's sure that it cannae be anything good.
Hmm, interesting.
Seb and Mark exchange a few harsh words before parting ways for the night. Paul the Toreador Harpy is walking about, vaping and admiring the dilapidated state of the abandoned power plant.
"Oh, wow, cool," he says to himself while staring intently at a small growth of flowers on a patchy section of the ground. The flowers are small and reddish in color.
Paul forces some strawberry vape smoke out of his mouth and is transfixed by these little flowers. His jaw hangs open, his eyes are wide, and he's mumbling something inaudible.
Everything around him seems to go quiet, like someone pressed the mute button on a TV remote.
The Aesthete loses grip of his vape pen and continues staring, deeply and keenly, at the small flowers on the ground. The vape pen hits the ground with a light thud and rolls to a stop.
Paul, completely transfixed with these little flowers, squats down and shakily extends his hand toward them, his eyes watering up with blood as he does so.
His hand is a few millimeters away from the flowers when he is suddenly snapped out of his trance. He gasps and leaps back, blinking his eyes rapidly and scratching his head.
"Oh, oh, great. Again, huh. Haha. Uh...where's my vape?" he pats his suit pockets and checks around the ground, but he doesn't find it.
"Well, shoot."
The Harpy brushes the dirt off his knees and struts off to where his vape pen rolled to. As he picks it up, he happens to glance in the direction of the High Priest and the Assamite Vizier. He notices them shaking hands and giving each other some kind of a guarantee, well that's what it seems to look like from where he's standing.
The Harpy can't really tell what's happening there, but he doesn't look like the 2 are shaking hands out of friendship or respect. He also can't read their lips, and the 2 of them are standing a good distance away from him, but it looks like they're talking about...something.
"Hm. Interesting," he thinks to himself and takes another drag from his vape pen. The smoke billows out of his mouth and he smoothly exhales it out. He lets his head hang low and thinks, "Something's up. Something's going down."
Being the Harpy means being privy to certain happenings in the Domain (be they private or public). It also means being aware of everyone's little secrets (the dirty ones, in particular). Of course, there's a lot more to this "position" than mere gossipmonger, and Paul Devers has proved himself to be something of a shrewd and well-spoken Harpy, as well.
Paul thinks to himself, "I gotta get to the bottom of that. Something's brewing in the Ministry. I'm--I'm sure of it."
Something IS indeed brewing within the Ministry, and it all comes back (in some way or the other) to the High Priest- Seth Steale.
But can a single Harpy stand in the way of decades-long plans that are already in their advanced stages and nearing completion, hmm?
Paul, for now, decides to keep a close eye on the High Priest himself, and as the evening draws to a close and everyone else disperses, he makes his way towards the Havens of Kindred he knows (not just fellow Toreadors, but others, too), and he makes himself cozy and gets them to talk.
Secrets for secrets, favors for favors. He even cashes in on a few favors that are owed to him. Where needed, he does a little cajoling, a little schmoozing, and a little buttering up (even if none of it is necessarily his cup of tea).
Paul has got his wits and his connections, and he knows how to play his cards right in the Great Game. He knows when to keep a secret under his guard for decades on end, and he knows when to unload it and leverage it against others.
Regardless, Paul is a simple man, and his goals are not exactly lofty. He's simply doing what he has to do to ensure that everyone comes out of this battle against the SI without too many lasting scratches.
With enough favors and secrets, he can get almost anything done, and with enough agreements made, he can even get people to contribute to the fight against the Unit 8211 threat in more...meaningful ways.
Ah, well...
