Time marches on and it's now approximately 2:40 AM. The sky's still dark, very few stars twinkle above, and mortal life (in the forms of zooming vehicles and large crowds) subsides to a few scattered pockets here and there. There are still Kindred about, of course.
The streets aren't as lively and raucous as during the earlier hours, it's getting quiet and barren as John and Svetlana go, by taxi, to a certain industrial zone on the west side of this vast city, an industrial zone that connects to the many old, abandoned sewers (as well as the not-so-old but barely functioning ones).
Barren and lifeless as can be. The roads aren't paved very well. Cracked asphalt, holes everywhere, and deep grooves where cars, lorries, and other heavy vehicles have traveled down time and time again. Most of the signs have either fallen or have faded so much that they're practically invisible.
Even the taxi driver mumbles some confused phrases in Hindi and has to consult with a few locals (tormented immigrant laborers living around here) to guide him towards this particular location. They just point at some roads that look like the ones they need to go through.
After a few more minutes, the taxi stops at an empty intersection. John reaches into his back pocket, produces a few worn dirhams and gives it to the taxi driver.
The taxi driver counts it and gingerly says, "No change, sir?"
John stifles a sigh and pats the weary mortal on the back, "Mm, it's alright. Keep it." As it is, he's pretty short on money, but he's not about to engage in verbal fisticuffs with this baggy-eyed old man.
Svetlana and her Sire exit the car. The taxi driver reverses and drives off, dust trailing in its wake. Svetlana cranes her neck around and surveys the surroundings, looking at kilometers and kilometers of empty road. A few stray buildings dot the sandy landscape, but most of it is nothing but unclaimed wilderness and emptiness.
She looks back and forth at a few dilapidated warehouses that are near them and sees a few very small signs written in Urdu and Hindi.
John points to a random warehouse and slings his guitar case (containing his sword) over his back, "Right, that looks like it. I think. The others should be around here somewhere, probably. If we're lucky, that is."
Before walking, he turns around to his Childe, "Svetlana, I wanted to...talk to you about something. Quickly."
Svetlana checks her 2 daggers in her purse. She then nods and turns her gaze towards her Sire, "Da, what is it, John?"
"It's about Abdullah. I'm worried about him."
"What is it, John?"
"Despite it all, even after all these years...he's just a kid, Svetlana. 19-years-old at the time of his Embrace. I--I know he's a capable Blood Sorcerer and all, but--I just worry about him."
Svetlana points out, "So far, he has fought well."
John has a rigid expression, "I know that, but I hope that this...doesn't take too much of a toll on him. All this fighting, all that crazy stuff he does with his Blood Magic...I know we have to use whatever weapons we have against our enemies, but...it's still dangerous stuff, Svetlana."
"Abdullah knows how to control it. Otherwise, he would not have come this far," she responds, keeping her voice level.
"I hope you're right," John solemnly responds and walks towards the warehouse with the faded sign that's barely legible.
He stops and clenches his jaw, "Goddamn. I--I don't know if I'd be able to forgive myself if something happened to him, Svetlana. He's like...my best friend, the lil bro I never had, heh. He was the first one who I met when I came to the UAE."
With a lone tear of blood rolling down his left cheek, John says, "I was expecting Banu Haqim here, sure, but it was a surprise when Abdullah said that he's with the Blade. From there, we became great friends. How time has...flown since then."
He rubs his face and wipes the blood-tears away with his sleeve, "Shit, anyway, c'mon, let's go. We got a long fight ahead of us. Let's hope it doesn't turn out to be a disaster like last night."
Svetlana grunts and has an apprehensive look on her face when she hears that.
John notices this and gets what's happening, "Oh, right. Svetlana..."
She struggles to meet her Sire's concerned gaze.
"Svetlana...if--if you see that asshole again--"
She quickly interjects, "I will Judge him, John. Not you or others."
"Fair enough."
After a minute of walking up a muddy and uneven path, Svetlana and her Sire see a warehouse with the door hanging loose. It's dark, dingy, and decrepit as all hell. A lone lamppost weakly illuminates this entrance to this derelict place.
At the door, John mumbles something to himself, "Bollard. Tommy? Thomas. Thomas Bollard. I swear I've heard that name before."
He continues in his thoughtful musing, "I think it was back in the 1980s, some uh...newspaper article about...I forgot. Hmph. Anyway, that can wait. C'mon, Svetlana, let's get set up for tonight."
The door creaks open as Svetlana pushes it open. Inside, most of the Blade of Haqim members are gathered around, furtive and tired looks on their hollow and sunken faces. A few look at the door as Svetlana and John come through, but the majority pay them no mind.
Abdullah, his arms crossed and his brow furrowed, is the only one who gets up to greet the new arrivals. He's dressed in dark denims and a shell jacket. His sneakers are scuffed and tattered.
"As-salamu alaykum," the Blood Sorcerer greets his fellow Assamites.
"Wa alaykumu s-salam," Svetlana smiles, and then frowns when she sees the bags under the Blood Sorcerer's eyes, "You look tired. How are you keeping?"
There's some straining in Abdullah's voice, but it's faint, "I cannot complain, habibi. I shouldn't. Come, come, we have been waiting a long time for you. Some of us were even wondering whether you would show up or not. I got the burner phone here, John."
He pulls out a burner phone (cheap flip-phone variety) and tosses it to the John. He deftly catches it in his palm and flips it open.
Samir is standing in a dark corner, barely visible. His arms are folded and he's leaning against a wall that isn't covered in mold or cracks. He's wearing a tight, collared short sleeved shirt with smiley face patterns and skinny jeans. Cheap brown sandals, too.
He looks a little frustrated and his lower lip moves from side to side as he looks at a newspaper (the jobs section) with a look of deep concentration and dissatisfaction. He flips through a few more pages and shakes his head, mumbling (and likely cursing) in Arabic under his breath.
A few of the others are sitting around a large, circular table. Zeina sits among them. She's dressed in a silk shirt and wide-legged pants. Her hair is combed back. There's a faint frown on her face. She appears to be...on-edge, for some reason. The other Assamites here look bored or fatigued, but otherwise no one appears to be overly troubled by anything.
Zeina springs up and gesticulates, "We have been waiting for you for 40 minutes! I took off from work early and spent an hour trying to find this place! Walla, this had better be worth it!"
John presses his lips into a thin line and acknowledges her (justified) concerns with a curt nod, "I'm sure it will be worth it. Sorry if it seems like we're late."
Zeina tsks and walks off to sit by Abdullah's side. He pats her on the back, a sympathetic expression on his face, "You seem more troubled by this than usual."
She claps back at him, "And you're not?!" Her eyes are wide and she looks ready to spring up and snap at anyone at any given moment.
The Blood Sorcerer answers with a half-hearted shrug, "It is something that we cannot control at the moment, habibi. Regardless, we are here now, ready to Judge the Zionists and avenge those who have fallen by their hands."
John clears his throat and calls everyone to gather closer. Samir angrily tosses the newspaper aside and strides to join his fellow Assamites. They all gather in a rough semi-circle in front of John. The majority look indifferent, a few appear to be nervous, but there's a couple who are obviously eager to get to bidness and kick some Zionist ass.
John blows a raspberry and holds the burner phone up, "Once I make this call, they're gonna come at us. After last night's...debacle, we're not taking any risks, everyone. No mistakes, stay together, and watch each other's backs. OK? No trying to be a hero, heh."
John continues, "I want everyone on guard and ready. You can bet your ass that these assholes will be coming at us with everything they've got- and we've already seen what that means. Eyes up for drones but prioritize those with flamethrowers or incendiary shotguns. No point worrying about the stakes, just don't let 'em get in too close to us."
Nodding heads and sounds of assent all around.
John licks his lips, and his hands shake when he starts to dial a random number. He holds the phone close to his mouth and starts screaming in, "BEAST! BEAST! VAMPIRE! BLOOD! KINDRED! Gimme a few bags of blood! I'm here, the new place, and I want the good stuff in 30 minutes or less. Don't try and screw us over, either--"
In the Unit 8211 Command Center...
An analyst is busy typing away at a mechanical keyboard. She has a mono headset on, and a ping hits her screen. The automated keyword scanner in her monitoring software catches something and it sends her a pop-up notification. Red borders and a few exclamation points. All written in Hebrew.
She looks up, sees the alert and her eyes widen. Her fingers glide across the keyboard and she loudly calls out, "Commander Gallant? Sir? Sir?"
Commander Gallant straightens his back and approaches her with a gait of authority and command. He stands above the analyst and places his hand on her shoulder, "Report. What do you have?"
She grimaces slightly when she sees his hairy hand on her shoulder. She quickly and succinctly summarizes what just came into her screen, "Sir, a phone call JUST came in and some of the keywords we've been scanning for. Potential blank body activity! It's still going on. I am running a trace now, sir."
The Commander smirks and slightly tightens his grip on his subordinate's shoulder. A light gasp escapes her lips, but she manages to retain her professional demeanor. Her fingers clatter against her keyboard, "Running a triangulation now. Tracing."
Things move across a grid map of Al-Kushraf city. Satellite imaging is also in operation. Her software runs at maximum efficiency as she types, clicks, and talks out loud as she does it. Her brow is slightly damp with some sweat, but her eyes remain wide open.
The Commander looks down and takes a moment to inspect his subordinate. He lecherously eyes her up and down, a small smirk on his face as he does so. His subordinate keeps her head facing straight forward, not really looking up at her superior officer. She's too busy tracing this phone call and following up on other alerts that come pouring into other systems.
She gets an exact lock on the phone signal's point of origin. She claps her hands together and gasps in satisfaction, "Got it! Some...old warehouse district, no longer in use. Should I dispatch the nearest team, sir?"
"Hmm, yes."
"Is it an ambush, s--sir?"
Commander Gallant smirks in a snug manner and grimly declares, "I hope it is. Good work, soldier. Tell the other teams to remain close and be on standby. Also, redirect our patrol units- make sure they cut off any and all road exits into and out of those coordinates."
The analyst nods, her hair bobbing in a stiff manner, and she makes those calls. Commander Gallant straightens his uniform and stands with his back straight and his head held high.
He authoritatively hollers out, "We have found them! I want drones up in the sky in 2 minutes! GO! GO! GO! GO!"
Lieutenant Hilda Klein approaches and firmly salutes her superior officer, "Yes, sir?"
The Commander nods and motions for her to approach closer. He lowers his voice and talks in her ear, "The blank bodies are there, Lt. Klein. If, God forbid, our first team is killed by these savages, I want YOU to lead the next squad. Take the grenade launchers, I know how much you like those."
Lt. Klein nods her head, "You know me too well, sir. Capture or kill?"
"If at all possible, capture at least 1 and kill the rest. I'd prefer that Suarez fellow, but any of these savages will do."
Lt. Klein salutes, turns on her heel, and briskly walks off to the Armory to suit up and gather the troops. Commander Gallant rubs his hands together and leans against the chair, waiting for his analysts to come in with more status updates.
A clash is inevitable.
Dark SUVs with tinted windows roar across the (mostly) empty streets of Al-Kushraf at breakneck speed. Some of these goons have submachine guns strapped to their chests or AP-ammo-loaded sidearms in their holsters. Most are dressed in civilian clothing whilst others have more a more obviously "tactical" look with bulky armored vests, gloves, and combat boots.
1 of the drivers calls the Command Center on an encrypted radio. A couple of operators sit at their terminals and listen.
"Command Center, this is Alef-2. Come in, Command Center?"
Lt. Veifer is on comms and replies, "We read you, Alef-2. ETA?"
"Less than 2 minutes."
"Remember the nature of your enemy. Flamethrower units are enroute. Utilize special shotgun ammo and stakes in close-quarter combat. Foes are known to utilize knives and swords. Exercise caution. Keep a distance at all times and do not get complacent, over."
"Roger that."
The driver turns the radio off. His compatriot sitting beside him and a couple of others in the backseat talk among each other. Some Israeli accents are mixed in with some British and American accents.
The driver has a strong British accent when he says, "They're savages, animals, demons...they're the spawn of hell itself. Just keep that in mind, lads. Stay strong, keep your chins up, and don't waste your fucking ammo."
Cheers and other sounds of agreement. A couple of guys have their hands over their hearts, muttering pointless prayers. Others load their guns and inspect their long wooden stakes. They know EXACTLY what they're up against. The driver, however, remains grimly stoic, keeping his eyes on the road.
It isn't long before 4 SUVs roll up to the abandoned warehouse. They stop to a screeching halt and dust trails behind them. A few operators get out and fan out. 3 of them are carrying automatic shotguns (loaded with whitey-p). The other carries a compact SMG. The drivers kill the engine and step out as well.
It's a few minutes before 3:00 AM. There aren't any streetlights out here. A few lights inside the warehouse illuminate some areas around the door.
Through a small crack, Samir spots the Inquisitors. He turns to face John, "They are here."
The Assamite nods and gathers his composure for the fight ahead, "Alright, people. Showtime. You know what you gotta do, so let's get to it."
Some Assamites have a little pep in their step as they march to the doors and wait. Most are tense. Some are worried about the prospect of their own impending demise.
Others put their backs to the wall and pull out whatever sharp melee weapon they've got and grip it tightly. John and Abdullah both look out through the small crack to survey their enemies. Abdullah mumbles something under his breath and does a small hand wave gesture.
John regards his friend with some concern, "More Blood Sorcery, huh?"
"I was practicing some techniques, habibi. Do not worry, I fed a little extra tonight, so I have a good store of Vitae."
John nods, his mind heavy with thoughts of concern and anxiety, "I hope this goes well, man."
Abdullah nods and continues surveying their enemies, "As do I, habibi. Their stakes are sharp, yes?"
John nervously touches his chest and gulps, "Mm-hmm. Don't even get me started on those fire-breathing shotguns of theirs."
"Hmm, yes."
Zeina circles around and readies her long dagger. She twirls it around and prepares herself for a long fight. John pulls out his katana and runs 2 of his fingers across its razor-sharp edge. He then reaches for the door and opens it up.
He strolls out first and flicks his sword around, "Took you fucks long enough, hm? Catch me if you can!" With that, he activates his Celerity Discipline, and his body starts to move much quicker than that of even the fastest mortal.
Some of the Inquisitors fire off warning shots as he zooms about like a mini whirlwind. Some of these rounds go wide and miss, some come close to hitting, and 1 almost burrows through John's flesh.
Zeina sighs and shakes her head, "Hmph, come. It is time..."
Samir uses Obfuscate to blend with the shadows. The darkness itself forms a cloak of protection around his body and conceals his form. He's now undetectable.
Svetlana, too, activates her Obfuscate Discipline and closes the wide gap between herself and the operatives who are wildly firing in the direction of John and the other Assamites who have got their own Disciplines in play.
With their superior speed, some Assamites use Celerity to cut off a few heads in the blink of an eye. 1 of the Inquisitors is frantically scanning for any enemies when a headless body tumbles and collapses in front of him. The head rolls forward and the lifeless eyes look up at him.
He jumps back in fright and curses in Hebrew. Svetlana gets within striking range and buries her dagger into his throat. She uses her other dagger to sever his spine in the blink of an eye and then hops onto another guy and gets to work.
Svetlana hears some screaming, the rapid crack of automatic weapons and shotguns, the wet, sharp, and violent sounds of pointy blades sinking into armor and flesh.
Samir creeps from shadow to shadow and pulls down on his target's arm and twists their neck. There's a wet "crunch" of snapping bones, tearing muscle, and puncturing organs. Svetlana sprints up to another guy and hacks at his legs with both her daggers.
Samir readies his poignard and quickly sinks it into the head of a thug with an automatic shotgun. Blood and brain matter leak onto his hands as he pushes it through the skull and twists it relentlessly. His victim lets out a weak wheeze and crumples to the ground like a rag doll.
Some of the Assamites don't last very long, however, and end up getting burned alive by the fiery shotty rounds.
John sees them turning to ash and screams out, "NO!" He quickly zooms past hails of suppressive fire and furiously slashes with his blade at some Inquisitor's backs.
Zeina does some acrobatics to dodge gunfire and then runs at an angle. She ducks as a volley of shots is sent her way, then quickly springs to her feet, grabs 1 of her enemies by the head and savagely guts them, plunging her dagger in and out, in and out of their belly.
Samir sneaks around, quietly taking out more and more of the goons from behind, getting to work with his poignard and preternatural strength.
Abdullah hides behind a rock and uses his Blood Sorcery to conjure up a tight protective circle around himself. With his bloodied fingers, he deftly draws a circle around himself, says the incantations in Arabic, and then slowly lifts his fingers up from the dirt.
He keeps his concentration and tries to lure some of these stray soldiers closer. Some fall for it, and they end up being taken out by either Abdullah's magic or Zeina's dagger.
Another Inquisitor stumbles when John runs at him, screaming at the top of his lungs as his katana slashes into the air and cuts his foe's head clean off. The head rolls off into some bushes and the body gushes blood out like a broken faucet. John doesn't bother to wipe the blood off his sword and dashes off to engage another goon with an incendiary shotgun.
This soldier shoots 2 whitey-p rounds at him, which are narrowly evaded.
Zeina takes her dagger and cuts 1 guy's stomach open. His intestines leak out onto the grass and soil, his hands frantically reach out to stuff them back in, but Zeina isn't done with him just yet. She yanks his head back and viciously drives her dagger into his mouth, the tip of it protruding from his forehead.
The soldier twitches a couple of times and then collapses onto the ground.
Samir runs up behind a soldier and slits her neck with his poignard. He immediately rematerializes and is pelted with shots from a submachine gun. Samir collapses and the Inquisitor smiles sadistically and moves forward to put his prisoner out of his misery. He readies a wooden stake.
"Hehe, this'll put you out of your misery, you sick f--"
Svetlana shanks him from behind and puts her knife in deep. He crumples and coughs blood into Samir's face.
Svetlana's face is twisted with determination and bestial rage, her hands and arms covered in blood and gore. She helps Samir up and jumps back into the fray of blood, gunfire, steel, and gore.
1 of the operatives screams in horror at the carnage. The gunfire continues to rattle. Some Assamites go down, others get wounded, and most keep up the pace, however.
This wave is almost whittled down. Drones watch the unfolding conflict from high up in the air, streaming the footage back to the Command Center.
Commander Gallant bites his thumb and frowns, "Oh, God of Israel. Grant us victory! Have mercy upon us!"
He makes a quick call, "Lt. Klein, ETA?"
"30 seconds. How bad is it?"
Commander Gallant sees 2 of his soldiers decapitated in a flash, their bodies falling and blood spurting and spraying everywhere. He grimaces at this sight, "Very. Hurry up. Our men and women are dying- they need help!"
John hacks off another soldier's hands, her blood squirts and stains his face. He finishes her off by slashing across her face, opening her eyes and the bridge of her nose and upper lip up in a spray of blood.
She screams as he does so. Her body falls and blood starts to pool under her.
John bares his fangs and wildly screeches into the air. Since he's been using his Celerity so much, he feels the eternal Hunger of his inner Beast begin to gnaw and claw at his mind.
He snarls and dashes to the closest trooper. He pulls them into a choke hold and savagely bites their throat open, tearing a huge chunk of it out. He continues to sink his fangs in and drain them until they're dead. As bullets whiz past him, he drinks deeply, feeling the warm and boiling blood rush through his throat.
After draining that trooper dry, his eyes become bloodshot. The world begins to turn red around him, his heart pumps rapidly in his ears, and he smells nothing but the metallic aroma of blood.
His hands shake uncontrollably, and he feels a shiver across his whole body. He stumbles and then quickly catches himself, the world still looking red to him.
The Beast within roars wildly and without restraint. John can feel his grasp slipping away as a feeling of raw, unadulterated, and primal bloodlust overtakes him.
He lets out a blood-curdling screech and sprints to his enemies with all haste, his claws fully out. His eyes look completely wild and unhinged, and he growls and snarls like an absolute maniac. He charges 2 troopers and viciously tears their heads off, the wet tearing sounds of flesh, muscle, and bone causing others to take notice of this...
Frenzying Assamite.
Oh, no. This is not good. Whatever was in that blood that John drank, it's clearly messed with his entire mind, and it's triggered a Frenzy.
1 of the soldiers sees this and starts to retreat. Svetlana catches her and finishes her off by plunging her blade in and out of her chest.
Some of the other Assamites follow John's idea and bite into their foes. The result is immediate, and it is messy. They begin to Frenzy out of control and go nuts, slashing, biting, and clawing their way to whoever is nearby, be they friend or foe.
Oh, god.
Svetlana gasps when a Frenzying Assamite pounces on her and tries to bite into her jugular. She rolls her over and kicks them away. Zeina runs to help but is pulled back by a trooper and the tip of their wooden stake nearly stabs into her back.
Zeina gasps, rolls, and pushes herself back up to her feet. She fights the stake-wielder who manages to push her onto her back again. She's pelted with some SMG fire and screams out in pain as a few bullets go through her midriff.
Zeina grits her teeth and shrieks as she rolls her hips forward, twists around, and kicks at her enemy with both legs. She takes her long dagger and shanks her foe right in their kidney area. Her victim cries out in pain and tries to shoot her again.
The shots go wild.
Svetlana struggles and groans and tries, with all her preternatural might, to get this Frenzying vampire off of her. Her strength would give her an edge, but not when it's matched with similar power.
Her arms get pinned to the ground, her attacker's face mere inches away from hers. She can see his fangs and that empty look in his eyes. She screams and pleads with him to snap out of it, but it's in vain.
Svetlana closes her eyes and lets out a weak cry, "NO! NYET! STOP! N--"
Her screams are drowned out by the crackle of SMG fire. The Frenzying Kindred leaps towards the source of the gunfire and rips them apart with his fangs and sharp claws.
The trooper cries out, "YAAAAA!" as he's being torn apart and drained. Her blood sprays across the ground. Her cries become softer as her life force slowly leaves her and makes it way down the throat of this Frenzying vamp.
Samir comes to Zeina's aid and finishes off the stake-wielder by plunging his poignard right in their gut, twisting it around, and then kicking them off it.
His eyes widen in shock when a Frenzying John pounces on him in a blurry flash and savagely bites his shoulder. Samir cries out in pain and tries to pry him off, but to no avail. He reaches for something, anything, but nothing is nearby. His poignard lies on the ground, a few feet away from him.
He feels the sharp, gnashing fangs tear his flesh, muscle, and sinew apart. His vision starts to get hazy. He lets out a howl of pain and screams for help.
Abdullah is shocked by this recent development. He musters up the courage and uses some of his Blood Sorcery to try and perhaps, un-Frenzy, his fellow Assamites who have fallen to their most base and bestial instincts and urges.
The Frenzying Assamites look up when he chants in Arabic, "Stop this at once! Stop this insanity!" With blood flowing from his wrist, he waves his arm about.
Nothing. The Frenzying vamps, or those who are on the edge of it, charge forward and try to slash at him, tear into him, and drink deeply from his veins.
He yelps and dodges away as the next wave approaches. Lt. Hilda Klein steps out of a large van, about a dozen soldiers behind her, and they immediately start unloading on the Frenzying bloodsuckers with their shotguns and flamethrowers.
Flesh gets torn apart. The screams are horrible and terrible. Those who haven't yet Frenzied still don't know that it's whatever these Israeli psychos are juicing up with that's causing this. They begin to contemplate falling back.
John has almost completely Frenzied now, his entire body feels hot with blind rage and insatiable Hunger, and nothing else. Samir manages to flee from him, but his wounds take time to mend themselves.
Whatever those Zionists maniacs have been injecting into their bloodstreams is dangerous stuff. That CEDP (Combat-Enhancing Drug Protocol) stuff apparently causes a vampire to enter an uncontrollable Frenzy when they drink the blood of its carriers.
But, why? And how? Who, in their right mind, would make such a vile concoction and who would inject it if they knew its contents? It's probably part and parcel of Unit 8211's interpretation of the infamous Hannibal Directive.
Let the vamps drink and drain the soldier dry, and they'll all go wild, uncontrollably so, and it'll make it easier to wipe them out. If the soldier dies, the soldier dies. Better than letting them become a warm meal for a bloodsucker out on the battlefield, eh?
Sheesh.
These Frenzying vamps start running wild, slashing their everyone apart and tearing anyone who dares cross their line of sight.
Abdullah retreats and tries to cast another Blood Sorcery spell, but it is no good. It fails. His eyes widen in fear as John dashes forward and goes in to savagely attack him with his claws and fangs.
The young Blood Sorcerer holds out his hands, dripping with Vitae, and pleads, "No, habibi! NO! Stop! STOP!" He braces himself for the inevitable.
"NO!" Samir leaps in front of John and tackles him to the side. Still in the state of Frenzy, John snarls and makes all sorts of angry noises as he viciously swipes, bites, and kicks his opponent away.
Samir tries his best to dodge those claws. They're so close, however, that John manages to slash Samir's mouth and open it up on the left side. Samir stumbles back in pain and hisses. His tongue feels loosened. His flesh and muscles tear apart.
Svetlana dodges someone wielding a flamethrower, but she still struggles to close the distance as she runs in the opposite direction of those singeing flames. The flames behind her crackle. She cries out when they get a little too close for comfort.
The heat is enough to sear some of her clothing. Svetlana screams as the flames continue to burn. Her Rötschreck is triggered, and she bolts back to the warehouse without daring to look back at those bright, orange flames.
Samir grasps John by the throat and squeezes him as tightly as he can, trying to choke him or do something to snap him out of this mad state. His opponent, however, is so Frenzied that it does little to no good.
Abdullah helps Zeina up and uses another Blood Sorcery spell to conjure up some of that ol' reliable red mist. The operatives caught in it get choked up and drop dead to the ground almost immediately. Froth comes out of their mouths, their bodies spasm, and their eyes roll up into their skulls.
Lt. Hilda Klein takes notice of the carnage and readies her grenade launcher. She smirks and aims it in the general direction of a few Frenzying Assamites coming her way. She squeezes the trigger, and the explosive round flies right at the vamps, exploding in their faces and blowing their limbs off.
Those who aren't destroyed on sight writhe on the ground or fall into a Torpor from the shock alone.
Lt. Klein gives them no chance. She orders a few of her troops to finish them off. They step closer, aim for the head (or what might remain of it), and blast each and every one of them into fiery smithereens with their weapons.
She grimly chuckles at their misfortune and prepares her next shot as the destroyed Kindred crumble to ash and get scattered across the light and arid wind of this desert.
The carnage is unlike anything any of these operatives has seen thus far. Lt. Klein's soldiers continue to mop up and press the advantage.
In a fit of pure desperation, Abdullah tries an obscure Blood Sorcery technique, something he was just looking into the other night and hasn't perfected it just yet. He draws some Arabic letters on the ground, repeats the words to himself, and rushes towards John.
He smears his magical Vitae all over John and pushes him down, "John! Please! Please!" Abdullah tries his hardest to keep John from slashing his face up with those deadly claws of his.
Abdullah pleads and lets some of the Blood leak from his wrist and down into John's gaping maw, "No, John! Stop! You cannot go on like this! It will be the end of us, the end of you! Stop it, habibi! PLEASE!"
He shakes him with all his might as he desperately tries to calm his friend down, "STOP! HABIBI! This is not you! Put the Beast back in control, make it know its place once again." Sanguine tears roll down the Blood Sorcerer's cheeks.
John growls and hisses and snaps at Abdullah, desperately trying to rip his own friend to pieces and drain him dry. Abdullah clenches his jaw, shuts his eyes, and pushes as hard as he can against John's wild strength and sheer power.
After a moment, John spasms and his body twitches and jerks, but the Frenzy seems to subside somewhat. The wild look in his eyes dies down, his growls turn into groans, and he begins to regain some of his senses.
The shooting and killing still continues, however. Inquisitors corner the Frenzying Assamites and finish them off. Those that remain have started to fall back, not wishing to take any more risks. They've sort of figured out the source of the Frenzy but aren't quite sure yet.
1 of the Inquisitors tries to sneak up on Svetlana, who is still recovering from that her primal fear of the fire. She wildly finishes them off by maniacally stabbing into them until their blood comes out in torrents, drenches her hands and face, and stains her clothing.
Her eyes are completely bloodshot, and the look of utter, raw, primal fury has taken her completely. She can still feel the fire from that flamethrower licking at the back of her mind and burning at her memory.
Zeina hobbles and limps to some nearby solid cover and groans in pain as her wounds begin to close and heal themselves. The bullets come out of her, her vampiric body begins to heal itself, and her flesh knits itself together.
Samir looks over his shoulder and musters up some Vitae to disappear from sight altogether. Clutching his poignard, he slinks back to a safer spot.
John has subsided and (seemingly) recovered from the mad Frenzy he was in. Abdullah helps him up and they limp towards the other Assamites, dodging stray shotgun pellets and SMG bullets along the way.
Zeina pokes her head out of her cover, sees Abdullah, and cries out to him, "Abdullah, here! QUICKLY!"
John's head is spinning, and he can barely let out a legible and cogent sentence, "The f--fuck...?"
Abdullah grabs John and leads him to cover as well, "We have no time for questions! We have to leave now!"
The rest of the Assamites fall back towards the warehouse.
John clutches his head and winces, "What happened? Last thing I remember was biting into 1 of these assholes for a quick top-up. Next--next thing I...just start seeing red. I lose control and--and--!" He looks up at Abdullah with a sense of confused urgency.
Abdullah puts a hand on his shoulder and tells him, "There's no time to worry about that right now, habibi. We have to leave! There--there are too many of them and not enough of us! They--they--"
He peeks from his cover and watches the Unit 8211 thugs flame out a few more Frenzying vamps in quick succession. Their remains are left on the dirt. The operatives all reload their weapons, but that's all he sees.
He slinks back behind cover, and he gasps in fear, "They--they're destroying us! WE HAVE TO FLEE!"
Svetlana shakily points out, "We have no vehicle, nothing! How can we do that?! We have to fight!"
Samir joins in, "NO! It is simply too dangerous!! Abdullah is right. This is a lost battle! We need to leave. NOW! We should take 1 of their vehicles and drive as fast as we can!"
Zeina agrees, "We can't take these odds, Svetlana! There's too many of them and too few of us! And we have already lost so many..." her voice trails off as she says some of the names of those who either Frenzied or perished.
John lets out a loud exhale and grimly nods, "OK, OK. I--I feel...weird. We--We take 1 of those damn vehicles out there, drive as fast and as far as we can, and then we ditch it. We...make plans from there."
He shakes his head a few times, like a dog drying itself, and says, "Alright, alright. OK, I've got it. I feel so...alive. What--what did I just drink??" He peeks around the corner and sees the carnage that Unit 8211 is wreaking, the absolute carnage and devastation they have wrought with these flamethrowers, incendiary rounds, and...
His eyes widen and he calls out, "Oh, shit! Look out!"
Lt. Klein aims her grenade launcher in the direction of the Assamites and fires. The grenade whistles through the air and lands just in front of the Assamites, right near the corner where they're all taking cover behind.
They hiss and begin to disperse. Some dirt and small pebbles get blasted back from the impact area, but the main blast is somewhat diffused by the solid cover that the Assamites are taking.
Zeina lets out a sharp cry of pain and grabs the right side of her abdomen, where she was hit with that SMG fire earlier. The bullet holes in her shirt seem to have closed up, but she's still a little sore there.
John seems to back to his regular self. He looks on in horror as some Frenzying Kindred tear each other apart or run towards the Israeli forces to be burned to a crisp and reduced to ashes. Others who have fallen are swiftly finished off with incendiary rounds or flamethrowers to the face.
They crumble into dust. The Unit 8211 operatives let out a hearty and united cheer of joy and celebration for each of the vampires they destroy. They advance forward while Lt. Klein fires more 'nades, pushing the remaining vamps further back into the warehouse.
They're cornered with no way out. The surviving Judges decide that commandeering a vehicle and making their getaway is the only viable option.
Between them and the available vehicles, however, are a bunch of juiced-up fascist psychos with weaponry meant specifically for vampire extermination and elimination.
The Assamites slowly crawl backwards towards the warehouse. They have no other choice; they have to push and fight their way through these operators, grab a vehicle (anything large enough to fit all of them in), and DRIVE the fuck outta here!
But, where to? Well, driving back to Elysium is simply dumb and it's quite far away. Their respective Havens are out of the question for reasons obvious.
As the Assamites are pondering this, Abdullah lifts his bloodied finger into the air and exclaims, "What about where that Nosferatu told us to meet him? The...westside tunnels or something, yes??"
Zeina and Svetlana look at each other, and the latter fearfully asks, "Is--Is that good idea? We do not know if it is safe, Abdullah!"
The Blood Sorcerer counters by desperately saying, "What other choice do we have? WE NEED a destination. We cannot keep driving and driving without purpose. We need a safe location to lose our foes. I believe that tunnel is our best chance."
Svetlana and Zeina shrug and agree to this suggestion. As do John, Samir, and the remainder of the surviving Assassins.
They're up against a couple dozen heavily armed Zionist shits who all have combat-enhancing drugs in their bloodstreams. Not to mention, shotguns with whitey-p, flamethrowers, and SMGs with painful AP rounds.
Oh, and Lt. Hilda's got a fucking grenade launcher. The drones buzz in the sky and continue to relay live footage back to the Command Center.
Commander Obed cracks a small smile of wicked satisfaction and speaks to Lt. Hilda, "Good work, Lt. Klein. You've got them cornered. Now, go in and finish them off. Capture at least 1, if possible, for questioning."
Lt. Klein puts her fingers to her earpiece and gives him the affirmative, "Understood, sir."
She fires off 1 last grenade that blows the flimsy warehouse doors open. They fall right off their hinges, and a huge plume of dust and dirt flies in all directions. Some of the dust hits the faces of the Assamites and the Inquisitors who were just behind Lt. Klein begin opening fire.
They advance with caution and orderly discipline. Lt. Hilda orders a 3-person team to spread out and secure the perimeter. Her operatives fan out. Some take cover near the fallen doors while another 3 prepare to move inside, checking the corners of the warehouse for any surprises.
Well, it's either now or never!
While his head still thumps and reels, John yells out, "GO! GO! GO!" and he pushes himself forward with all his might and main. The rest follow his lead. They sprint towards the fallen doors and try to use them as cover, hoping to make a quick getaway.
The Assamites run around the fallen doors and make a mad dash for 1 of the large vehicles parked out near the front of the warehouse. The Zionists see this and immediately begin to fire at the Assamites, their rounds pelting the ground and sending small pebbles flying everywhere.
Some of the bullets hit, but the vampires either slash or keep pushing forward to the vehicles.
Lt. Klein notices the surge of bloodsuckers headed her way. She makes quick tactical hand signals and orders a few flamethrower units to advance and light up the oncoming and blurry wave of speed and violence tobogganing straight towards them.
A young Assamite in a niqab is the first to reach the vehicle and pulls the driver's side door open. She looks around and hisses at her allies, "YALLA! YALLA!"
Since there are quite a few vampires still remaining, fitting into this big van is not gonna cut it. John whooshes to a nearby SUV, deflects some bullets with his katana, and yanks the door open.
Lt. Klein quickly pulls out her pistol and takes a few shots at the vampires trying to make a vehicular getaway. John asks Samir to drive while he quickly dashes off in a blur and slashes the tires of the other vehicles.
Smart.
Samir clambers into the driver's seat and turns the ignition. The engine rumbles to life while Svetlana, Zeina, Abdullah, and a few other Judges dodge volleys of gunfire and potshots from the Zionist Inquisitors.
John blinks back in hollers, "DRIVE! GO! GO! JUST GO, SAMIR!"
The window is bulletproof (heh), so Samir puts his foot all the way down on the accelerator and floors the gas. The van peels out and takes off with a burst of speed and a squealing noise, as does the SUV containing the other batch of surviving Assassins.
Samir steers the wheel and manages to get them out onto the rocky night road, where he picks up some speed and drives straight ahead, not bothering to look back.
John sharply exhales and takes a moment to sit back and gather his composure. He looks around the van's interior and notices some hi-tech and advanced-looking equipment lying around.
He shakes his head and remarks, "We can't use any of this shit. They've got trackers on everything." Then, he realizes something.
"Oh, shit," he peeks out the window and sees a fleet of small, buzzing drones hot on their tail, "They've got fucking drones up above! NO!"
Samir nods, grips the steering wheel tighter, and presses his foot against the gas pedal a little harder.
Abdullah groans and slices his arm with his claw. He shuts his eyes, gently twists his hand in a certain direction, and a bright red mist floats out of his wounds. He chants under his breath.
A few of the drones explode in mid-air and come crashing down. John, Svetlana, Zeina, and Abdullah gasp in surprise as some drone debris hits the car's roof.
Lt. Klein hollers at Commander Gallant back in the Command Center, "Those animals took 2 vehicles and disabled the rest! WE NEED wheels ASAP!"
Commander Gallant responds, "Yes...we--we just lost them. Our drone feeds are all gone. Luckily, we have tracking devices on all our vehicles. Replacement vehicles arriving shortly. ETA: 2 minutes."
Lt. Klein scoffs, spittle flying out her mouth, "2 minutes?! I need them here in 30 seconds!"
Commander Gallant sternly reprimands his Lieutenant, "Hilda, do not raise your voice at me! These are your orders. Obey them! WAIT for the vehicles to arrive and continue your pursuit. We're tracking them now."
Lt. Klein frowns and her shoulders slump, "Yes, Commander Gallant. Apologies." She and the remaining Inquisitors continue their sweep while their replacement vehicles take their sweet time to show up.
The other Assamites in the van continue driving along, having for the time being, lost their foes. They all look so tired, broken, and defeated.
In the SUV, Zeina, who is sitting right behind John, reaches over and grabs his shoulder and looks him straight in the eye, "John...WHAT happened there?!"
John shrugs her hand off his shoulder, "I--I dunno, Zeina. Like I said, I bit into that bastard, drained 'em, and the next thing I--I know, I'm losing myself."
Zeina frowns, "Why? Why did you do such a thing?"
John doesn't answer that, and he merely replies, "I...I was hungry, Zeina. I thought it'd be safe, y'know, biting from our enemies, but that doesn't seem to be the case, huh?" he forces a laugh to ease the tension.
He leans forward, places his head in his hands, and tries to make some sense of this mess. He rubs the sides of his head with his stained fingers and winces as he still feels some of that whatever linger in his vampiric body.
"I taste...all kinds of stuff. Drugs, like...a whole lot. What are these fuckin' Israeli maniacs having for dinner? Steroid pancakes?! Ugh, it tastes so...metallic."
Abdullah's eyes have a faraway gaze in them as he mulls over what he has witnessed. He shakes his head and says, "It is indeed possible that the Zionists have done something to their blood, what exactly it is eludes me, however. Maybe someone with more knowledge of the Blood would be capable of enlightening us on this disturbing matter."
John turns to his Childe and says, "That Irish Tremere buddy of yours, maybe? Right?"
Svetlana plainly nods, "Da. Maybe Saoirse can help. But I would not be so certain- she is busy with her work."
Abdullah sighs, "I am sure this Usurper you speak of can help, Svetlana. There are many who know the secrets of the Blood, yes, but the Usurpers...their knowledge, walla, is unmatched and unparalleled."
Zeina grunts and scoffs, "So, what?! We cannot drink from our foes, then?! How are we supposed to--?"
Samir keeps his hands on the steering wheel and interjects, "That doesn't matter, Zeina! We simply have to rely on our strength and power. We'll have to keep our usage of Disciplines to a minimum, if such a thing were possible."
He swerves when he sees a fancy car zoom past him at a speed way beyond the prescribed speed limit (even on an empty stretch of road). He slams the brakes the car comes to a screeching halt.
Another fancy car zooms past in a blur, the tires on that one burning rubber.
Samir curses under his breath and continues, "The most important thing right now is not to panic. We have to find a way out of this, and we have to do it now. What was--what was--"
Another car whooshes past.
John's face scrunches in confusion and he looks outside to see even more cars approaching them. They don't look like they're for urban warfare, though. No, they look like they're meant for...
Street racing, of the questionably legal kind.
A pitch-black, shiny IRCO-Z with a matte-gray underbelly is in the lead, the other cars trailing not so far behind. John recognizes that IROC-Z. He jumps out of the hijacked vehicle and waves his arms frantically, yelling, "Stop! STOP! That's us! STOP!"
N0S4A2, the helmeted Caitiff racecar driver, hits the brakes and comes to a stop right at the side of the road. The other cars behind them zoom past, leaving them in last place. Yikes. They've got a rep to uphold and keep up.
N0S4A2 throws open the car door and hops out, a black and red jumpsuit on them. Their helmet remains on their head. They walk around the back and raise their chin, "What?"
John's eyes narrow, and he desperately says, "We need your help."
"No help," the Freestyler responds, their voice muffled and distorted.
John gets angry and hollers, "We're desperate here, OK?! There are some real bad people after us and we need someone good with wheels, someone who knows this city, and someone who can get us out of this! So, can you help us or not?!?!"
The Freestyler tilts their head and replies, "Why me?"
John gestures to his tattered and bloody demeanor, "Because you know this turf better than anyone else, because you're a damn good driver, and because I've seen you behind that wheel before."
N0S4A2 shrugs and looks at the others in the 2 vehicles, "What do you need?"
John explains, "We've got bad people after us. Second Inquisition. You know what that is, right?"
"Don't care for that."
"Hmph, whatever. We need you to--to uh...get us to a place. You know the westside sewer entrance. Some um...large tunnels. It's supposed to be somewhere near here."
"I know."
John exhales sharply and the hairs on his arm slowly stand on end, "Yeah, you know that. Good, good. Can you--can you help us? Please?"
N0S4A2 thinks it over, then replies, "I'll take you NEAR to the westside sewer entrance. I cannot do more than that--"
Zeina cuts off the Caitiff by hissing, "WHY will you not help us, Clanless??! Who even are you?"
N0S4A2 ignores her and gets back in their car. They gun their engine, pull off a quick and skilled U-turn, and peel off down the road. The Assamites and their 2 vehicles follow suit, albeit much more nervously.
Samir and John look at each other and shrug. Samir grips the steering wheel tight and focuses on keeping up with the skilled race driver in front of him. The other Assamite driving that other vehicle also keeps up, although it's clear she's having trouble keeping up with N0S4A2's speed.
N0S4A2's driving is measured, skilled, and controlled. No wild moves, no sudden turns, no reckless speeding. Just precise, calculated maneuvers and driving.
This is a professional who's likely been at it for YEARS.
It's not long before a fleet of dark and bulky SUVs roll up to the side of the road, their engines growling and their headlights bright as hell. A few Inquisitors emerge out of the lead vehicle and aim their guns at the Assamites and their 2 vehicles.
The Judges see this and panic, trying their best to speed up.
John orders Samir, "Get close to that Caitiff! We need to warn 'em!!"
Samir screams and rams an enemy SUV off the road. It swerves and hits a large rock, its tires smoking and squealing. The Inquisitor riding shotgun flies out the window and falls to the ground.
John shouts, "PUNCH it!"
Samir rolls aside the IROC-Z and John motions for the Caitiff to roll down their window. The window rolls down, N0S4A2 keeps their eyes locked on the road ahead- this one's quite bumpy, but they're doing fine.

N0S4A2 merely nods as way of response, closes their window, and picks up the speed, their headlights glaring brightly.
Samir is about to say something when he notices that the other Assamite driving the other car is getting boxed in by 2 large vans. He looks around, his eyes widening in fear, and then he notices 2 more large vans closing in from behind.
He slams his foot on the brakes and the SUV's tires screech. The vans speed ahead and 1 of them smashes into an electric pole. Samir floors the gas pedal and rams the other van from behind, causing it to lose control and tumble, but whoever's driving it rams the side of the SUV, causing it to drift off a bit.
Samir groans and tries to get the van off him, but it's too strong. He slams on the brakes, and the van comes to a screeching halt.
John hollers and dashes out of the car, "Samir, go--"
Before John can bolt off to be a roadside hero, Abdullah grasps his arm and says, "Wait, wait!" The Blood Sorcerer then conjures up some trustworthy sanguine spell of his and directs it to everyone in that van.
The sounds of bursting heads and bodies are heard from inside the van. All the occupants are dead, and the van lazily swerves off the road and hits a tree with a gentle thud.
John's eyes widen and he gawks in awe, "Dude...you're amazing! Holy shit! Thanks, Abdullah. Really, we--we don't know what we'd do without you, kid."
The Blood Sorcerer gives him an appreciative nod, and he sits back and winces as the cuts on his arms begin to close themselves.
Abdullah smiles tightly, "It was nothing, habibi, really."
It isn't long before N0S4A2 escorts the 2 vehicles to the intended location. Once there, the Unbound doesn't bother with any goodbyes or whatever. They take a turn and zoom off into the night, leaving a trail of dust in their speedy wake.
John shakes his head at this, "Pfft, well at least they came through at our hour of need. Ah, well..."
He gets out of the SUV and the other Assamites quickly jump out of their van and start to look around. There's a large, gaping tunnel in front of them. The concrete walls around are covered in graffiti, flyers for events long past, and other random bits of urban street art.
Zeina gets out of the vehicle and starts sniffing the air. She grimaces and gags at the pungent odor of the nearby sewer system. Samir hops off, rolls his shoulders, and pops his neck with a tight pop.
Svetlana steps out and looks behind her. She gulps deeply as she notices a vague shimmer in the distance. A vague, ghostly shimmer. Muffled giggling sounds follow soon after. Little Chloe's Wraith is swooshing nearby, laughing and chortling.
John senses something is off his eyes widen. He looks up and around and then his face scrunches up in concern. His brow furrows, and he says, "I can feel something..."
Abdullah steps out of the car and leans against it, a look of tiredness and exhaustion on his face. He closes his eyes and mutters under his breath, "I can feel it, too, habibi. It--It feels as if a thousand eyes are staring right at--at all of us."
A high-pitched cooing sound, like that from a dove (!), immediately catches the attention of the gathered Assassins. They swerve their heads around and 1 of them points up to the sky.
Svetlana shakily follows the pointed finger, "Look--look up!"
Everyone looks up and their jaws drop when they see a dove flying around and making cooing sounds. It coos and coos and flies figure eights around the entrance to the nearby tunnel.
John tilts his head and asks, "What the hell is going on here? A dove, the last time we saw--"
Realization dawns on Svetlana, "Dove. P--Prince Angela..." Her eyes glimmer with something resembling hope.
Apparently, the now-slain Prince of Dubai turned nearly every dove in her Domain into a Famulus (animal Blood-Bound to a Kindred). As a Gangrel, she had access to the Animalism Discipline, so that made things considerably easy to pull off.
It's only been mere weeks since her destruction. It's likely that most of the doves have either died or, somehow, managed to find their way all the way here.
The dove continues its (almost) clueless flight pattern, and it does eventually fall to the ground with a thud. Blood leaks from its hollow and beady eyes.
Svetlana kneels down and inspects the dead animal. With bloody tears rolling down her cheeks, she strokes it and swallows the lump of pain in her throat.
John puts his hand on her shoulder, "It was Prince Angela's trademark, wasn't it? The doves?"
Svetlana sniffles, "The Dove Prince...gone."
John comforts his Childe, "I know, Svetlana. I know. Now, c'mon, let's get outta here before--"
Too late, a fleet of vehicles, both SUVs and the like, come barreling towards the Assamites from the right. They park on the road, and the occupants pour out, weaponry at the ready.
Lt. Klein hops out of a passenger side and unholsters her pistol, "Blank bodies! There! Engage! Engage!"
The Assamites immediately bolt towards the dark and dingy maw of the sewer entrance. Abdullah, the last one to enter, casts a quick spell to delay the pursuers.
The Zionist forces open fire, and a hail of bullets come raining down on the fleeing Assamites. Garth the Nosferatu hurries over to the Assamites with a look of shock in his sickly eyes. His face is covered and his thawb looks like it's been stitched back up for the 100th time, which it likely has been.
"What the hell have you lot done?! You were supposed to kill them and bring us--"
John cuts off the Nossie, "We--we couldn't! We just couldn't. Look, we need help, man. They followed us here. We...we had no other choice; we don't know this damn city that well. And--and we were outta options."
Garth scoffs, "This is bloody mental! You've brought these maniacs straight to us! Couldn't you have at least shaken them off?"
John shakes his head and bends over. He has his hands cupped around his knees and he still looks a bit rattled from all the nasty sloshing in his bloodstream. He forces a few deep breaths out of his lungs.
He shakes his head and says, "We had to take their cars, and they track all their shit, so...yeah."
Garth grunts and hits a nearby wall in anger. Some bits of concrete and mortar fly off and land on the floor with a clatter. He lets out a growl and looks at the Assamites standing in front of him, huddled together, furtive, and vulnerable.
The Crawler clicks his tongue and looks at the approaching thugs, "Thomas is going to shank me for this..."
Zeina asks, "What do you intend to do with us, Crawler?"
Garth avoids making eye contact with any of his fellow Kindred, his gaze entirely focused on the hard and rough ground beneath his feet. He lets out a grunt, and he doesn't really answer her, so she speaks up again, "Answer me, please! They are coming and Abdullah's Blood Magic can only hold them off for so long!"
A few yells of pain echo throughout the tunnels as the SI thugs fall prey to whatever surprise the tired Blood Sorcerer left for them at the entrance.
Garth groans and declares, "You're coming with me, down into the sewers, our Domain. All of you. It's not like we 'ave much of a bloody choice, eh? Thomas is not going to be too pleased, I sure am not, but we've gotta do it, so let's bloody do it, right?"
John's eyes are still darting about, and his fingers are twitching, "The sewers, eh? I guess beggars can't be choosers. So, we stick close to you, correct?"
Garth firmly answers, "Yes, unless you WANT to get lost in the forks, nooks, and crannies of dark, smelly, and slimy tunnels that are only known to us Nosferatu like the backs of our oft-times twisted hands. Stay fucking close, don't wander, don't stray, and try to keep up."
A few SMG bullets whiz past and come in contact with the walls and the floor. They ricochet, and a few of the bullets lodge themselves in the bodies of some of the other Kindred. They grunt and curse their luck.
Garth sneers, "Shit. Tommy won't like me leading those arseholes down into our spaces. Someone must stay behind--"
John explodes and objects, "Fuck that! Either we all go or we all stay, but we are not splitting up! We stick together! If the plan is to run, then we do that together. If we're gonna fight, then we all do that together!"
Garth counters, "You don't understand, Assamite! If these Inquisitors even get an inkling of what's down in our sewers, there won't BE a Kindred Society in this bloody city anymore! This is bigger than all of us! It will be a shattering of the Masquerade!"
John scoffs, "Well, too fucking bad, cuz this is how it's gonna go, Garth. Either we all come with you or--"
Abdullah steps forward and gently pushes John aside, "I will stay and hold them off, habibi. Promise me that you will get them all to safety." There's grim determination on the young Blood Sorcerer's hollow face.
Garth is genuinely taken aback by this proposition, "What?! You? You--you're just a kid, mate! Why can't John or 1 of the others hang back--"
Abdullah lifts his chin, and a sense of resolve fills his dead eyes, "No. I am a Blood Sorcerer amongst my Clan. I...am the only one who can do this, who is--who is capable of holding these Zionists back long enough for you to escort my--my friends to safety."
John shakes his head vigorously, "NO! NO! Abdullah, no! They'll fucking overwhelm you and--"
Abdullah softly smiles, "I have made my peace with whatever comes my way, habibi. Do not fret. Now, go. Quickly. I will make sure you are all safe and sound. They will not follow you into your Domain, Crawler. Your secrets, precious as they are, will remain safe."
This is Abdullah Rachman's final stand. He knows it. Tears of blood drip down his face, and he holds out his hand to Garth, "It was a pleasure making your acquaintance, Mr. Garth. I wish we could've gotten to know each other a little more."
Garth shakes his head and even his eyes well up with blood, "You can--can't do this, mate. Let someone else stay back and hold 'em off."
Abdullah plainly says, "The others have fought and struggled enough, habibi. I am the only one who is capable of this, and I will not allow more of my fellow Judges to meet Final Death on this night. Now, go. Quickly!"
John grabs Abdullah and tries to pull him away, but the young Blood Sorcerer stands firm.
John stops and cups the kid's cheeks with his hands, "You--you don't have to this, Abdullah! You still have SO MUCH to live for, so much to see, to experience--"
The Syrian kid points out, "For all my life- and Unlife- I have known only injustice. The Zionists destroyed my village, turned the rest of my family into refugees. Most of my extended family...they are all dead. Even before I came of age, I have borne witness to so much loss and trauma..."
He looks over his shoulder at the approaching thugs, who have been somewhat delayed by Abdullah's sanguine and sorcerous delaying tactics.
He looks back at the vampires in front of him, "When I turned 19, I made the choice to join the Blade of Haqim, to be Embraced into the Banu Haqim Clan. I did so, so that 1 night I might be able to Judge my enemies and bring about a better and more dignified world for all, Kindred or mortal--"
Svetlana pulls him in for a tight hug, red tears rolling down her face, "Abdullah! Please!"
John, Zeina, and a few of the others gather around the brave and selfless Blood Sorcerer from the Golan Heights. Abdullah's hands are outstretched and he's chanting under his breath.
John pulls him into a tight hug, the 2 embracing in a firm and cordial embrace, "You are an amazing, amazing person, Abdullah. Not just the best damn Blood Sorcerer I've ever met, but a--a friend, too. And--and I know the others here will tell you the same thing. So...thank you. Thank you."
Abdullah gives John his phone and wallet. John silently takes it and lowers his head.
Svetlana wipes her sanguine tears away and hugs him tightly, "Thank you, for saving me that evening...when John Embraced me."
"At first, I was not sure who John was Embracing, but you, Svetlana...you have proven to be 1 of us. The Judges, the Blade...they need someone like you, Svetlana. Someone who sees things with such clarity, someone who speaks her mind and does not abide injustice where it festers."
The scum are closing in, sending a few pot shots and rounds into the air, their bullets falling like horizontal rain.
Abdullah continues, "It has been an honor serving alongside you, and I wish--I wish I could have 'lived' long enough to see Syria again, but on nights such as these, I know not whether there will even be a Syria, let alone a better world..." he trails off.
The others have sanguine tears of sadness running down their faces as they all give the young Kindred a proper send-off. They hug and embrace him, telling him how much they appreciate him, how much they'll miss him, and how much he means to them.
"As-salamu alaykum, habibi."
"Wa alaykumu s-salam," Abdullah responds with a tight smile.
Garth's face is tear-streaked as well, "Mate...you don't 'ave to do this--"
Abdullah looks up at the other Assamites, then he turns towards Garth, "Please, habibi. Make sure they all get to safety. Guide them, watch over them, they have suffered through a lot- we all have."
A bullet grazes Garth's shin, and he grimaces at the painful impact. He looks down at the wound, then back up at the Sorcerer. He nods and begins ushering the remainder of the Assamites deeper into the tunnel, "If--If you're certain, mate."
John turns around and calls out, "I'll come back for you!!"
Abdullah faintly chuckles and shakes his head, "No, habibi. But...avenge me and the others. Judge all of these wretched Zionists. May your blades be coated in their blood from here to Damascus. Take that fury, that hunger and thirst for justice, throughout all the world, my friends!"
John turns around and gets 1 last look at his best buddy, his eyes filled with so much pain, grief, and heartache. He wants to scream, to shout, to slash and speed around, but he forces himself to stay calm, to not cry any more than he already has.
Abdullah Rachman, 19-years-old at the time of his Embrace, of the Blade of Haqim of the Banu Haqim Clan, originally from the Golan Heights in Syria, is truly 1 of the kindest, bravest, most noble, and selfless people John Suarez has had the pleasure of knowing.
And he will be dearly missed by all those whose Unlives he touched and/or saved.
Abdullah has effectively given up his Unlife to buy time, to make sure that his fellow Blade members flee to safety and get another chance to fight another night.
This is their moment to leave, to run, to get outta here and figure out what is to be done from here on out, because this just can't go on. There are simply not enough Blade members to keep fighting against the Unit 8211 threat.
No, something's gotta change, something's gotta give. Other Kindred need to get involved in this battle.
John keeps looking behind him as he and the others run further into the tunnels, until Abdullah's figure disappears from sight. Then, he turns around and looks at Garth, his eyes still wet and full of tears, "WE HAVE TO GO BACK FOR HIM!"
Garth marches forward and puts a hand on John's shoulder, "Listen, you can't. You--you can't."
The Assamite's eyes widen, and he growls, "What are you saying, Garth?! WHY the fuck not?! What kind of secrets are you people protecting down there, huh?!"
Garth growls, "THAT, Assamite, is not any of your concern. Right now, you're going to shut up and follow me- stay close and DO NOT stray off. You do not wish to find yourself lost in these kinds of places."
John looks up at Garth, his eyes wild and uncomprehending, but he concedes to the Sewer Rat's firm instructions with a grunt and a nod.
The rest of the Assamites follow suit, their wounds slowly stitching together. They make sure to stay close to each other down in these manky sewers.
Abdullah gathers his composure and raises his chin high up. He brings to recollection every single aspect of Banu Haqim Blood Sorcery that was taught to him since his nights as a mere Fledgling, the memories from his time learning at the foot of his Sire, also a talented Blood Magician.
He recalls his training under the greats of The Clan of the Hunt. His hands shake, but not from fear, but from a deep sense of purpose and commitment.
He crouches down and draws a sigil of some kind with his dripping Blood. He smears a bit of it with his finger and a sharp, electric sensation rushes through his hand, all the way up his arm and into his very chest.
The Zionist thugs continue their approach, but they are hesitant to go deeper. Lt. Klein orders them to push forward, regardless, and the other Inquisitors, some of them wounded from the Sorcerer's spellcasting, reluctantly comply.
"No fucking night vision equipment. Grrrgfht!"
Garth leads the Assamites through a series of dark tunnels that branch out into many other tunnels, and it's difficult for the Assamites to keep track of their way, but Garth adeptly navigates this winding space like it's second nature to him.
He looks over his shoulder to make sure that everyone's following and that no one lags behind or strays off course.
They eventually come to a stop when the tunnels come to an abrupt end. To the left is a set of metal stairs, a ladder, both leading upwards. To the right is a large, steel door, which Garth immediately grabs the handle to.
He explains, "It looks a wee bit out of place, I know. We had it changed a month back- the other one was coming off its bloody hinges. Come along, now. Hurry along, you lot! No time for delays! Stay close!"
The Assamites look at each other, some of them confused, but they're desperate and eager to get the fuck outta here, so they follow the Sewer Rat deeper into this maze-like sewer system.
They come to a halt a bunch of old, dimly lit lightbulbs begin to flicker. The smell is awful, but vampires don't have working respiratory systems, so that's a huge plus when down in a nasty place like this.
The walls are patchy and grimy and all kinds of unmentionables float in the stagnant water on the ground. A huge rat scurries about, and John watches as it crawls across the floor and burrows into the nearby wall. It struggles to fit its huge body through the tiny crack, and it ultimately fails.
Samir takes a whiff, and he grimaces at the horrid smell, "Eugh!"
Garth snickers, "Mate, don't do that. Believe me, it's not worth it."
Abdullah seeks cover, crouches down, and casts another spell, the sanguine magic flowing freely from the wounds on his palms. He murmurs a few words in his native tongue.
The Zionist operatives are right around the corner, but they're trying their best to be silent. They immediately feel their weapons smoke and sizzle, and they immediately know something's not right.
A few Inquisitors cautiously round the corner and their weapons immediately explode, sending them flying with shards and other bits lodged into their faces.
"YAAAAAAA!" someone cries out as their face boils and sizzles after a shotgun goes BOOM! and burns their face clean off.

Abdullah conjures up some of that trusty red mist, albeit in a less "potent" form. He directs it towards the Inquisitors and, as soon as it comes into contact with their feet, it stops them dead in their tracks.
They're stuck in a horrible nightmare that manifests as an illusion. The ground under them opens up and hands, so many grasping hands, reach up and grab the operatives' ankles, yanking them down into the ground.
Some of them are dragged down to their knees, and a few are hoisted all the way down to their chests. They begin to shoot, some of their shots hitting their teammates and turning them into a bloodied mess.
Heh, friendly fire.

"She's down! She's down! MEDEVAC! I need a MEDEVAC!"

"THEY'RE ALL FUCKING DEAD! I--I REPEAT! THEY'RE ALL FUCKING DEAD!"

The Nossie pushes the door open and leads the others through. They follow him further into the sewer system. The air here is thick and smells of what it smells like. It's pretty dark, too, so their eyes have a hard time adjusting.
Abdullah draws more bloody sigils and signs on the ground. He can feel his Beast rousing within him, demanding to be sated, but he groans and ignores it. He can't afford to give in just yet.
He tries to conjure up some sharp Vitae projectiles, but they only solidify for a few seconds before going back to their usual gelatinous state. He growls under his breath and tries to force the blood to solidify into tiny throwing knives, but he fails.

Abdullah conjures more red mist, but its power and effect weaken with every casting, and the Zionists begin to get closer.

The shape grows brighter and disintegrates into nothingness with a fizzing sound.
Abdullah tries, with all his fleeting might, to conjure up a lethal spell that might be able to kill the Lieutenant, but he keeps coming up short.

"I will find you! I will hunt you down and make you pay! I will do the same to your friends, you worthless blank body terrorist."
Abdullah has his back pressed against a wall. He gulps deeply and shuts his eyes, trying not to cry blood or get too scared by Lt. Hilda's threats.
Lt. Klein hollers, "I have killed many of your kind in Ramallah before. I wear their rotten teeth- their fangs- as a trophy! I look forward to adding yours to my collection."

Lt. Klein turns around and orders her squad, "Fan out! Look for them! They can't have gone too far! GO, GO, GO!"
Abdullah needs to hold them back just a little longer, so he shuts his eyes, slits his palm, and lets a few drops of his fleeting Blood hit the ground. He then chants an incantation and focuses all his willpower on a spell he's been working on for the past few nights.
He can feel himself getting weaker by the second. His eyelids grow heavy, and he sways from side to side. He struggles to maintain concentration, and he can feel his Vitae draining rapidly.
"Ugh..." Abdullah groans as he falls to his knees, his entire body shaking, his skin pale as a sheet.
The Blood on the floor begins to boil and bubble and fizzle and a loud shriek fills the tunnels. A moment later, a blood-curdling screech sends shivers down the spines of everyone in the tunnels.
Lt. Klein jumps back, startled by the sound. Her gun is held tight and ready to shoot whatever comes next. The others stand in a defensive formation, their guns aimed at the darkness.
They can see movement in the darkness ahead, but it's difficult to make out what (or who) it is exactly. Some of them think it's just the shadows playing tricks on them. Others think they see something, but they can't be sure.
An Inquisitor blinks rapidly and licks his dry lips. He turns his head and sees a...man, an ordinary man with dark and rugged skin. His clothes are fairly ordinary as well, but his face is hollow. He is surrounded by a thick crimson mist, and he looks directly at the Inquisitor.
The Inquisitor is taken aback by this. He recognizes this man- just another innocent Palestinian man who was murdered by said Inquisitor during a routine stop-and-search in the West Bank.

Apparently, Abdullah conjured up some sort of powerful illusion spell that causes these fascist thugs to see the ghosts of their victims in lieu of their allies, causing them to kill each other in a mad frenzy.
An operative screams and backs away, falling to the ground, before firing wildly at her fellow goons. Gunfire is exchanged, wildly, between these worthless specks of human dust, and Lt. Klein has to duck for cover behind a large rock. For whatever reason, she's not affected by the spell.
All she knows is that her troops are dying all around her, and it's only a matter of time before she gets caught in this mad crossfire. She grunts and squeezes the trigger on her pistol, firing blindly into the darkness ahead.
A few terrible screams and shrieks are heard from the darkness, followed by the sound of bodies hitting the ground. The gunfire ceases, and Lt. Klein cautiously rises to her feet, her gun aimed ahead. Her eyes scan the darkness, but she sees nothing. She lowers her weapon and turns around.

Abdullah into the light, claws and fangs at the ready.

The tired and battered Assamites enter and gasp as they catch sight of the Nossies- The Clan of the Hidden. Some of them look like they could pass for "quite normal", actually, but some look like they got run over by a train. A few are missing eyes, limbs, noses, ears, you name it.

The group is led down another corridor, and they arrive at a large room with the messiest and shoddiest, albeit functional, computer setup that anyone has ever seen. Laptops, likely stolen, are hooked up to wall-mounted monitors. Old computers from a decade ago run some complex programs that are way beyond anything these Assamites have ever seen before.
The whole set-up is quite loud, and the whirring of these old machines fills the room. It's cold, too, with thick bundles of cables all over the place, running along the walls and ceiling. It's very well-lit, though.
The Air-Con units, however, seem to be leaking a bit. It's clear that a lot of this stuff here in this wee room would've ended up as e-waste or in a landfill- better that it was put to good use, one might argue.
Tommy is hunched over in front of a big screen, looking through some files that appear to be the date collected from the SD cards. He stops what he's doing when he hears footsteps, and he looks behind him. He's wearing his trademark mask, that means he knew topside guests would be showing up.
He glares at Garth and growls when he asks, "What happened??"
Garth does his best to explain everything that transpired. He's good with minute details and leaves nothing out.
The interrogation room is cold and damp. Abdullah has been stripped to his underwear. Yishai has also shaven all of the poor kid's hair off. Abdullah is bound to a chair with tight chains that have been fastened to the arms and legs of the chair. His head droops, his body is limp, and his skin is cold, clammy, and pale as can be.
The stake still remains lodged in his body.
Yishai, standing tall and proud and looking down at this helpless vampire, sneers in contempt, "Fucking Arab. I should've known. Let's hope you start singing when the Commander shows up."
He leans closer and whispers, "You better tell us what we want to hear, or else..." he reaches for his knife and runs its tip across Abdullah's cold cheek. There's a wound, but no blood comes out.
"Hm. Strange bodies indeed."
Commander Gallant arrives soon after. Lt. Hilda Klein accompanies him; her back is ramrod straight and her head is lifted high. The Commander nods at her and motions towards Abdullah.
His eyes narrow as he gazes upon the poor Kindred. He looks over his shoulder and orders Yishai to pull the stake out.
The interrogator violently rips the wooden stake out of Abdullah's sternum, and the young man immediately springs to life. His eyes are wide as he gasps and wheezes. His chest is stinging, and he feels dizzy. He struggles against his binds, but it's no use.
The soldiers around have their guns trained on the awakened Blood Sorcerer.
Abdullah snarls in contempt, "Zionist dogs!" He wiggles and struggles against his chains. His fangs are borne, his claws are out, and he's ready to fight his way out if he has to, but he can't.
Yishai smirks and punches Abdullah in the gut, then grabs him by his head and yanks it up violently. Abdullah grunts, but he doesn't make much of a noise. The interrogator is holding the bloody stake up for all to see.
"A simple piece of wood is all it took. At least we know you speak English. Good. I didn't want to bother getting a translator in here. I can't stand Arabic- it's a nauseating language."
Commander Gallant concurs with the interrogator and slowly approaches the vampire, looking down on him with nothing but sheer disgust and malice, "You are vermin- lower than even the lowest scum. People like us are the exterminators of such vermin. You understand, yes?"
He pauses and circles around Abdullah before continuing, "This is...war. A war that was declared a long time ago. You parasites started it. You can try to fight it, but it is a losing battle, hmm?"
Lt. Klein, her arms crossed over her chest, stands next to her Commander and states, "We'll be doing the world a favor by wiping you parasites off the face of the planet."
Abdullah shakes his head and spits some Blood on the ground below, "Ayreh Feek (AR: Fuck you)!"
Commander Obed backhands the Assamite and growls, "Don't you dare speak to me like that! Your filthy tongue will not save you, understood?!"
He points at Yishai, "He has more than enough ways of making an animal like you to talk. So, tell me, who is this John Suarez? Hmm? What do you know about him? What is your association with him?"
Abdullah snarls and hisses, "I will NEVER tell you anything! NEVER!"
The Commander quietly says, "Yisha..." and nods his head towards the Assamite.
Yishai chuckles and cracks his knuckles, "I was expecting as much." He picks up a sharp and thin knife from his belt and jams it into Abdullah's abdomen. Abdullah gasps, coughs, and gurgles as the knife is twisted and turned. He clenches his teeth, but he still refuses to talk.
Yishai screams into Abdullah's ears, "WHAT IS YOUR ASSOCIATION WITH THE BLANK BODY NAMED JOHN SUAREZ!" He repeats this question over and over again while Abdullah cries out in pain as the knife is twisted round and round and round.
Commander Obed and Lt. Hilda Klein look on with stoic and indifferent expressions on their faces. The interrogator keeps twisting and turning the knife in Abdullah's gut, and he demands that Abdullah shut up and answer the question.
