Yishai then asks, "WHAT IS YOUR ASSOCIATION WITH THE BLANK BODY SYMPATHIZER NAMED AARON HART?! ANSWER ME!!! GRRRRAGH!"
Abdullah desperately cries out, tears of blood flowing from his eyes, "I won't talk! Walla, I won't! You can hurt me over and over again, I won't talk! I won't tell you scum anything!"
The Commander shrugs and orders the interrogator, "Yishai, stop."
Lt. Hilda Klein looks on with a blank stare on her face, but there is a sense of excitement in her eyes as she watches the Assamite writhe and squirm, trying ever so desperately, to break free of his binds.
Her Commander then tells Yishai to stop what he's doing, and the interrogator begrudgingly complies. He removes the knife from Abdullah's abdomen and steps back to watch what happens next.
Commander Obed glowers at Abdullah, "You know, it's funny. We've been getting reports about your kind who have been attacking our patrols and stealing our SD cards. It would seem that you are a lot smarter than we had initially imagined. Hm."
Lt. Hilda goes over to where Yishai's nasty tools are laid out. She inspects them and picks up a pair of pliers. She approaches Abdullah and grabs his chin with her hand, "I am going to rip these fangs out 1 by 1, starting with the bottom ones. Then we move onto the top ones. Bite me, go on, I dare you."
She roughly shoves Abdullah's head up and forces his mouth open. Abdullah struggles against her and tries to bite her hand, but Yishai circles around and holds his head back while another operator presses down on his shoulders.
Another operator picks up the knife and shoves it into Abdullah's shoulder. He screams out in pain while Commander Gallant folds his arms and looks on with total indifference.
With a determined smirk on her face, Lt. Hilda Klein grips Abdullah's bottom left fang with her pliers and violently pulls it out. Abdullah screams out in agony. The Lieutenant does the same to his upper left fang and then proceeds to do the same to his bottom right fang.
Yishai holds Abdullah's head back with the palm of his hand. Lt. Klein finally struggles to yank out the upper right fang. Blood flows from Abdullah's mouth and his screams become muffled as Yishai lets go and flicks him on the back of the head.
Lt. Hilda Klein chuckles as she tosses the bloodied fangs aside, "You think we haven't prepared for you animals? These fangs, ah a fine addition to my collection. I've had longer ones, however. We have studied you and have come up with several ways of hurting you. Killing you is too simple--"
Abdullah growls and shrieks at her, blood continuously flowing out of his mouth as he cries out in absolute agony and despair, "YOU WON'T WIN! You will never win! Palestine will be free!"
Everyone in the room bursts out in laughter while the Assamite continues to cry and squirm. Lt. Hilda Klein slaps Abdullah across the face and growls, "You're the one who lost, you filthy animal! Your kind is scum- worse than even some of the terrorists we have in our jail cells. You should've stayed in your useless terrorist countries!"
Commander Obed glowers down at Abdullah with disdain, "She's right. So, tell us, then...what's your name? How old are you, really? You can't be that old, hmm?"
"Ibn al Kalb (AR: Son of a dog)! Yakhsaf allah bih al’ard (AR: May God Swallow the Earth beneath you)!"
Commander Gallant lightly scoffs at that, "Ah, so a teenager, then. Hmm, very well. And when did you become a vampire? Where? How? Who made you into 1? Ah, well."
Yishai punches Abdullah in the stomach, knocking the wind out of him. He then punches the Assamite in the face over and over again. Blood flies from his mouth as the interrogator punches and punches and punches, then grabs hold of Abdullah's head and yanks it all the way back.
He hisses into Abdullah's face, "Tell us what we want to hear, you worthless fucking beast. Tell us and I'll make sure to give you the easy way out- I'll douse you in kerosene and light a small fire. It will be instantaneous for your kind. We know how the fire makes you afraid, so very afraid."
Abdullah spits some of his Vitae into Yishai's face and tries his hardest to work some of his Blood Magic, but his Vitae is so low, and his Beast is trembling with primal fear.
He grunts as Yishai slaps him. The interrogator spits on him and growls, "You should think, long and hard, about what you've done, hm? But first..." he grabs a large and serrated knife and mockingly brandishes it before Abdullah's wide eyes.
"You know, I think it's time we start cutting things off, eh? You only need 1 ear..."
Abdullah shakes his head and pleads, "No, please, no! NOOOOO!"
Yishai chuckles. The Assamite struggles against his chains as much as he can, but it's no use. The interrogator shoves the knife into Abdullah's chest, and the poor Kindred screams out in gut-wrenching agony.
Lt. Hilda Klein watches on with a smile on her face as Yishai proceeds to slowly and methodically saw through the vampire's right ear. Abdullah cries out in pain, screaming like a helpless child as the interrogator does his dirty and vile work.
Yishai finally manages to sever the ear, and he holds it up for everyone to see. After a minute, the ear begins to crumble to ash, and it falls through the air in slow motion before landing on the floor with a soft thud.
Commander Obed then orders the interrogator, "Give him a taste of what we do to terrorists, Yishai--"
Abdullah is panting and is in pain unlike anything he has experienced before, but he defiantly says, "I will never--never tell you a thing. You can cut me, hurt me, burn me, destroy my body, but you cannot break my will! You will never win! We WILL find you and we WILL Judge you...all of you."
The Commander lifts his chin and narrows his eyes, "Judge us, hmm? Interesting. We know enough of you blank bodies to know that you...organize yourself into Clans."
Abdullah faintly gasps and his face tics for just a second, but that was all the Commander needed. He smiles, "Ah, I see. It's quite clear now, isn't it? Well, then. Yishai?"
The interrogator smirks and looks over at the Commander, who then says, "He is already talking, isn't he?"
Yishai walks over to a corner and readies a blowtorch, "Yes, sir, he is. We'll get what we want out of you, 1 way or another. We have time."
Back in Nossie territory, Tommy is visibly distraught at the latest turn of events. Garth reassured him that no SI can or will be following them here, but the Nosferatu's paranoia is on full display.
He frantically paces back and forth, muttering to himself. The Assamites are confused as they're unsure how to react to this sudden turn of events. They look around the room and keep their distance from the many computers in the room.
Svetlana, however, walks up to Tommy and asks, "What do we do now?"
Tommy sighs deeply and grunts, his shoulders slumped in defeat, "I don't know. What can we do, hen? I mean, look at me- look at us! We're not meant for combat- we're the fucking information gatherers; we're no meant tae go oot there and fight! The deal was for yous tae go and do that shite! No us!"
Garth puts a hand on Tommy's shoulder and whispers, "I agree, but we have to do something. You know this can't go on. This is getting bad. Why not summon an Archon or a Justicar? They'd have this fucking mess wrapped up in under a week. We have their contact--"
The Nossie Primogen cuts him off, "Naw, naw, cannae be doing that, pal. That bawbag Seth doesnae want them here. Fuckin' bampot he can be sometimes. And we're already too deep in this shit. We cannae call them in."
Garth sighs and takes a step back while John folds his arms and glares at Tommy, "So, what are we supposed to do? Keep the same shit up? We barely scraped by for our last fights, man! We need HELP. The other Clans here won't be offering anything tangible- you know that. Even our own Clan is held back by that stupid Vizier--"
Tommy tsks and shakes his head, "What are suggesting? No be complaining, John. Either suggest a solution or keep yer mouth shut."
John sighs and scratches his chin before saying, "Well, the way I see it, we need help..." he trails off for a moment before finishing his thought, "...more people out there, fighting alongside us. That's the only way we're gonna win this fight against the SI."
Garth shakes his head, "John's right. 100%. But--but, who? We're not up to the task, the Ventrue and the Toreador aren't, either. The Malkavians have expressed no interest in working alongside you lot. Even the Ministry isn't really interested in more direct forms of support. And the other Banu Haqim, well...like he said."
John softly mutters to himself, "If only--if only someone could go around our Primogen...then maybe we could..."
Tommy's ears perk up, and he quickly turns on his heel and faces John, "Oi, oi, that's it! Say that again!"
Abdullah is writhing in his seat and he's struggling to keep his eyes open. His earing has obviously been affected and there's a high-pitched ringing noise in his other ear. He weakly grunts as Yishai pours some hot water over his head.
The interrogator smirks and looks up at the Commander, "Well, sir?"
Commander Obed shrugs and folds his arms, feeling a bit tired from standing in the same spot for more than an hour, "He is a persistent little shit, isn't he?"
Lt. Klein is walking around and inspecting her pistol. She cocks it, aims it around, and keeps her finger off the trigger. She looks at her tactical watch and points out, "We can't keep this up forever. He's just like that American, Yishai- uncooperative and stubborn. Tch."
Abdullah weakly tries to lift his head up, but he doesn't have the strength to do so. He weakly mumbles something or the other to himself, but even that is a struggle. His vision is blurry, and he can barely think straight.
Yishai looks down at his prisoner and sneers, "This is what happens when you do not cooperate, hm?"
He looks at his Commander and says, "Well, we barely got anything of use from him. We already know most of it anyway. Still, we'll take whatever we can get."
He slaps Abdullah around and asks him over and over again, "How many of you are there? How many? How many?! HOW MANY?! FUCKING TELL ME! TELL ME RIGHT NOW!"
Lt. Klein looks at her watch again and tells the Commander, "It's getting late, sir. This has to end. It's exhausting."
Commander Obed shakes his head, "It must end, yes, but he still has not told us anything. Even after Yishai used his blowtorch on his body."
The Assamite whimpers and quietly sobs while Yishai punches him over and over again. The interrogator finally stops and takes a step back to give himself a moment to calm down.
Abdullah struggles to keep his head up. He groggily mumbles something, but nothing is audible enough for the Israelis to hear. Yishai shoves his head back and demands that he speak up.
He angrily grunts and gets his blowtorch. He turns it on and jams it near Abdullah's thighs, burning him and causing him to howl out in pain.
Lt. Klein rolls her eyes and says, "I'm going to go and meditate."
She leaves the room and Commander Obed sighs, "Yes, you go and do that, Hilda. But we need answers. We need to know how many more like him are out there. We need intel."
30 or so minutes later...
Lt. Klein returns from her meditation. The screaming and sobbing, apparently, did little to disrupt her focus. She was able to successfully calm her mind and prepare herself for anything that could come her way.
She finds Commander Obed leaning against a wall with his arms folded. His leg is bouncing up and down, and his face is stern. The Lieutenant greets him with a nod of the head, and the Commander returns the professional gesture.
She asks, "How is he? All I could hear was him crying and screaming like a damn child."
Commander Obed sighs, "He has yet to give us anything useful, Hilda. We are no wiser than when we started. Yishai is taking a break- I ordered him to. At this rate, I'm going to miss my morning prayers."
Lt. Liora Raz arrives, holding a tablet in her hands. Her eyes are somewhat baggy, but she still seems rather focused on the tasks at hand. She looks around the room and sighs, "Where's Yishai?"
Commander Obed replies, "Taking a break. We'll let him cool off for a bit. You have anything of interest, Liora?" There's some frustration in the Commander's voice. Clearly, missing his prayer time is getting to him.
Liora holds up the tablet, "Well, we have run a few traces, but nothing solid. Same with the camera footage around the city. Our patrol units have nothing to report. Anyway, our techs were able to confirm that the worms are slowly being installed deep in the enemies' devices, sir. Lt. Davidai has sent you a detailed report."
She hands the tablet over to the Commander, "Here is what we have so far."
The Commander sharply exhales, "Ah, good. It was his idea- installing small and untraceable worms on the SD cards. A sort of, as he called it, 'insurance policy'."
Commander Obed's eyes dart over the data, and he nods his head as he reads through everything. He pauses, and his eyes widen ever so slightly. He points at something and mutters, "Hmm, very good. This will be useful, yes. It will take time, but I'm confident Unit 8211's abilities."
Lt. Liora nods, "I agree, sir. We are after all, the best of the best of the best. Has this thing said anything yet?" she lazily gestures to Abdullah.
The Commander lightly smirks and hands the tablet back to her, "Very well, then. No, this...thing is like a silent protest. Look at him, look at how he...stares at us with those hollow and dead eyes of his. Disgusting creature."
Abdullah snarls and glowers at the Israelis, but they're not intimidated by him. The Commander waves his hand and sighs, "Hilda, give me a suggestion on what to do with him. Stake him again?"
Lt. Raz interjects, "Sir, if I may?"
"Hmm?"
Abdullah can barely hear much as the Lieutenant and the Commander walk off to speak. Lt. Klein proceeds to discard 3 of his fangs while keeping 1 for her macabre collection.
The Blood Sorcerer struggles on his seat, and his single good ear picks up something that Lt. Raz is saying, "...Sunrise isn't far off..."
He gasps and swallows hard. He looks around the room and sees that the Commander is nodding his head and rubbing his chin. Lt. Klein is looking at her watch again. Abdullah's eyes widen as he sees a few operatives approaching.
Commander Gallant calls out to a few nearby soldiers, "Set up the equipment, quickly!"
They dutifully do as they are ordered and aid Lt. Raz in whatever it is she is planning on doing. Lt. Klein walks over to the Commander and whispers something into his ear. He nods and folds his arms, "Yes, yes, that is also a good idea, Hilda."
The Commander shoots a dirty look at Abdullah and stands in front of him, arms folded, "We have no more use for you. Very well, then. Keep your secrets, wretched terrorist. If we cannot get anything out of you, then we will make sure that your friends watch you suffer."
He turns to face Lt. Raz, "Liora, you have the honor of finishing this. We'll leave you to it." The Commander leaves the room, followed by Lt. Klein.
Lt. Raz smirks smugly and glares at the young vampire, "It is your loss, blank body. You! You! You! Help me take him to the surface! Quickly!" she points and gestures at 3 random subordinates. They rush over and help her lift Abdullah off his seat. His wrists are still bound, and he can barely stand. His ankles are shackled together.
He's too tired to speak, too broken to fight back in any meaningful way. He is carried out of the room and brought to the surface. The sun is just about to rear its head. He squints and tries to turn away from the light.
It's been so long since he's seen that great and terrible ball of fire in the sky.
It isn't long before day-sleeping arrangements have been made for the worn and beaten Assamites. Svetlana gets a corner and a surprisingly decent mattress (no bedsheet, however). Zeina takes the top of a bunkbed whilst Samir takes the bottom part of it.
John huddles against a wall and looks at Abdullah's wallet and phone. A few droplets of bloody tears hit the items as he silently cries. He's never felt so helpless. He wants to do something, but a part of him also feels that it's too late.
Tommy tosses John a small comforter, "Get some wee shuteye, awright? What you suggested is...I don't even have the word for it. But we'll look into it tomorrow night. You and the rest best get settled in, we'll do our best tae take care of yous, OK?"
The other Assamites (more or less) find a decent day-sleeping spot and prepare to be taken in by the cold and uneasy clutches of the day-sleep. They can feel their bodies getting sluggish (the fighting certainly hasn't helped). What wounds haven't mended till now will mend themselves over the long and dreamless day-sleep.
Svetlana lies down on her mattress and shuts her eyes. She wraps the given blanket around her cold body and goes still in a matter of moments. John dozes off a little later. Samir, Zeina, and the rest eventually go off as well.
The Nossies in this large room nod off as well, some hold each other closely while others sleep with their hands crossed over their chest like some kind of mummy. Tommy looks at the Assamites and sighs deeply. He shakes his head and leaves the room.
The sun rises. Abdullah struggles and screams out in pain as he is dragged towards a clearing in the middle of nowhere. He can feel his skin burning, and he can smell his flesh sizzling. He can feel his muscles melting and his bones starting to crack.
A lone camera on a tripod records his agonizing cries for help. His eyes widen at the sight of the emerging sun. It's been...so long. The hard ground below him is bathed in an ethereal, photogenic golden light. He can feel the rays of the sun burning his face.
It isn't long before the rays of the sun have their way with his body. His last moments on this planet are that of intense and searing agony. His skin begins to bubble and melt off. His body begin to catch fire. His scalp starts to burn off. His inner Beast howls and begs for a shade from this horrible star, but the shackles prevent any escape, any chance at survival.
Eventually, his body crumbles to ash and dust. The warm and arid desert wind scatters those ashes and blows them away. Lt. Raz and her subordinates leave the scene, satisfied with their work. They return to their main base and prepare themselves for whatever comes next.
Abdullah's ashes are blown away by the indifferent and uncaring desert breeze.
Lt. Raz gets in an SUV and watches the sky with a smirk on her face. She has her arms folded, and she is sitting next to the Commander and Lt. Klein. She puts on her sunglasses and pulls out a tablet to read some intel reports and finalize a few things.
It isn't long before that beautiful and terrible star of fire begins its unceremonious retreat into the horizon. The sky turns dark once more. The air cools down. The city of Al-Kushraf chugs along, none the wiser about the many dark secrets lurking beneath its very surface.
Svetlana is pulled awake by some shuffling and clanging sounds coming from outside the room. She rubs her eyes and sits up, still groggy and disoriented from the day-sleep. She yawns and stretches her arms, but she winces in pain as she feels a sharp twinge of pain in her gut.
John is (surprisingly) already awake and doing sit-ups. He has a hard and bitter look on his face, and he appears to be pushing himself to do as many sit-ups as he possibly can within this rather cramped space. He grunts and growls under his breath, and his movements are quick and jerky.
Zeina pulls the cover over her head and silently mumbles something to herself. Samir is up, a small netbook on his lap illuminating his face with a soft glow. He types away and keeps his head down, not wanting to draw attention to himself.
After a minute of 2, Tommy steps in. He's wearing matching PJs, his usual mask, and mismatched socks. There's some apprehension in his eyes as he approaches the Assamites.
John springs up in an unnatural flash and stands to his full height. He glares at Tommy and asks, "What happened? Where's Abdullah? Have--have you heard anything??" There's a glimmer of hope in John's voice.
Tommy looks at the floor and sighs, "You're gonnae want to see this. All of yous. Follow me." He's quick, curt, and to the point. The Nossie Primogen leads the Assamites out of the room and into the one with all the computers.
Garth is wearing what he was wearing last night, but a different shemagh covers his face this time. He's busy typing on a keyboard and doesn't make eye contact with any of the approaching Assamites.
John pushes to the front and demands an answer, "Tommy, what the hell is wrong? Don't hold out on us like this--"
Tommy points a remote at a very large TV mounted on a wall. Before he can press the button, he turns to face the Assamites and says, "I'm sorry, friends. Truly, I am."
He presses the button, and the TV turns on. It's a video recording of Abdullah's last moments under the sun. John gasps and takes a step back. Zeina covers her mouth and looks away. Samir mutters something under his breath and shakes his head.
Svetlana whimpers and sanguine tears flow down her cheeks. She sobs and side-hugs the nearest Assamite tightly. She shakes her head and looks at the floor, "No...no, no, no...no, no, no..." she trails off and sniffles.
Tommy keeps his head down, as does Garth and the few Crawlers lurking about.
"AAAAAAAAAAAAHGGRRRRGHHH!" Abdullah's blood-curdling screams come in clear through the surround-sound speakers. The video footage is crystal clear.
It's over in a minute or so, and a few words flash on the screen: "AM YISRAEL CHAI" The grim video ends there and the screen goes black.
John stumbles back and leans against a wall for support. He covers his face with both hands and slides down to the floor. He quietly sobs to himself and softly mumbles something or the other.
Tommy sighs deeply, "I'm so sorry. We...we found that video in our systems an hour ago. Those bastards are in our fucking systems. Somehow, those cunts managed to get in. I don't know how, but I am going to find out."
Zeina shakes her head and asks, "W--why would they do this? Why!?"
Garth answers, "To send a message to the rest of us, that's why. They know that sunlight is the end of us. They know a lot more than that, too. I've spent the past few minutes trying to find out how they've managed to get in. It's a long process, and I'm getting nowhere."
Chapter 18: Sumud
It's the Arabic word for "Steadfastness". There's history behind that word, a long and tragic history. Right now, the Blade of Haqim needs to remain steadfast in the face of such monstrous adversity.
Some time later...
The Assamites are given some watered-down blood from bags and bottles that look like they've been sitting around in a freezer for a long time. It's enough to keep them "alive" and going, but it isn't enough to wholly satiate their Hunger.
Some of the Nossies around curiously stare and point at the (seemingly) regular-looking Assamites around the place. John is pacing back and forth in the room with all the computers.
Tommy and he have come up with a bold (perhaps outlandish) plan to get more help in this fight. They're planning on getting Paul involved since he knows the most about political dynamics of the Court of Al-Kushraf city's Kindred.
John is running his fingers through his hair and mumbling. He's thinking of ways in which this plan could go wrong or spectacularly backfire. The video of Abdullah being reduced to ashes, however, continues to haunt his mind, as it does the minds of everyone else who saw it.
(Lt. Raz's specialty, after all, is PSYOPS and the like. She was the one who suggested not just destroying Abdullah but doing so in the most painful and agonizing way possible- leaving him out in the open for the rising sun to do its thing.)
Svetlana is sitting on a chair and staring at the floor. She's still reeling from what she saw. She's never seen anything like that before. The sun's a cruel bastard to the Unliving, that much is for sure.
Zeina is also staring at the floor and trying to figure out what to do next. She's deep in thought and hasn't said a word in quite some time.
With his background as a coder (4 different programming languages), Samir has decided to stay back and help the Nosferatu. A recent fire destroyed a few of the Clan's "in-house" coders. Tragic.
As such, he's helping the Sewer Rats streamline a few things, reinforce some firewalls, plug any holes, address any vulnerabilities, and ensure that the SchreckNet won't be as easily compromised by hostile forces. He's a bit rusty in a few spots, but he's making do with what he is given.
The other Assamites prepare to leave for their Havens or places of work (if they have any). Garth and a few others agree to escort them back to the surface. SI or no SI, there are bills to pay, shitty jobs to work at, and appearances to keep up.
That's all part and parcel of the Masquerade, after all.
Svetlana stands up and walks over to John. She gently taps him on the shoulder and asks, "What do we do now, John?"
John sighs and his shoulders slump, "I wanna swing by Abdullah's Haven."
He pulls out a simple housekey from Abdullah's wallet and inspects it, "I have the key to his place. I just...wanna take a look around. Maybe um...pack a few of his things away and um..."
He stops and a defeated look of sadness and despair crosses his face. He looks at his shoes and shakes his head, "I'm sorry. I'm...I'm just still reeling from all of this, y'know?"
Svetlana sympathetically looks at her Sire and nods her head, "Da. I understand. It was...overwhelming, no?"
Zeina approaches the duo and looks at them with a wide-eyed and semi-blank stare, "So, what now? Do we...do we go back to our Havens and pretend nothing happened?"
John shakes his head, "No. No, we can't do that. I can't. I'm gonna go to Abdullah's place and--and--"
Zeina folds her arms and interjects, "Clear it out? Put his things in little boxes and then what, hmm?"
John sighs and looks at Zeina, "Look, I know you're upset. I am, too. I even have his phone with me. I can't bring myself to turn it on. He was my friend, Zeina. Like a lil brother, y'know and--and these fucking Israeli bastards didn't just take him from us, they made HIM SUFFER!"
Zeina's expression softens a bit, "Yes, yes, I know! I know! I'm not stupid, John! I saw that video also! I want to Judge them as much as you do, but we need a plan. So far, we have been rushing into battle against these dogs without any support, any help, any sort of PLAN!"
Svetlana nods her head and says, "She is right, John. We are...we are not many. We are barely surviving these fights night after night. Our only Blood Sorcerer is gone and the others are...they are scared. We need to do something. We cannot keep doing like this."
John's plainly nods and mutters, "I'm working on something. Something bold...or dumb, but I don't know what else to do. All I know is that I want every last one of these maniacs dead. Every single fucking one of them." There's a certain dread in his tone.
Zeina sighs and pinches the bridge of her nose, "I fully agree, but we need a plan, and we need people- competent and good people. Our recent losses are not a laughing matter. We cannot just rush in there and kill everything we see with our fleeting numbers."
"I know, I know. Svetlana, you gonna do your babysitting stuff tonight?"
"Nyet. Not like this. I am...scared. I will come to Abdullah's Haven with you. I know I will be missing out on opportunities by not working tonight, but...Abdullah was my friend also. My...habibi."
John nods, "OK. Zeina, you coming with us?"
Zeina shakes her head, "No. I must work, John. I cannot keep taking off like this. I am sorry, but it is simply the way of things. I wish it was not as such, but I must work. I have bills to pay and roof to maintain over my head."
John sighs and looks at Zeina, "OK. Just...be careful out there, OK? I don't want to lose anyone else."
"I pray it will not come to that. Already, too many Judges- good people- have been lost. I must go now. Take care, John. Take care, Svetlana. Samir."
Samir nods in her general direction and goes back to typing away.
"You too, Zeina."
"Da. Do Svidaniya (RU: Goodbye)."
With that, Zeina leaves and heads with the others for the surface. Samir says he'll go and retrieve some of his personal belongings later. For now, he is absolutely laser-focused on familiarizing himself with the Nosferatu computer setup and infrastructure they've got all the way down here.
John, Svetlana, and a few Nossies head out in a separate direction, with a different group of guides. The long trek back up to the surface is silent and solemn. No one has much to say.
John's steps are a bit sluggish; he's deep in grim and contemplative thought about the maddening Frenzy he went through during last night's fight. He still feels that nasty drug cocktail (or whatever it is) in his system.
He still can't believe that he was able to survive it while so many others didn't and were destroyed. He shakes his head and sighs, "Fuck...fuck..." he mutters to himself.
The other Banu Haqim would soon realize that they are up against a foe that has no qualms about turning THEIR OWN troops into walking, breathing hazards just to spite the enemies (blank bodies). Even other SI don't go this low.
Well, the SI here happen to be Israelis. And for all their chest thumping declarations and droning on about being the "most moral" warfighters in the world, the truth is those scum never fight honorably or according to any set laws.
Juiced-up fascist maniacs; whatever's being injected into their bloodstreams has an adverse and nasty reaction when ingested by Kindred. The fights ahead were gonna be tough, that much is definitely certain!
Anyway, John, Svetlana, Zeina, and a few others stay close to their knowledgeable guides. The path back up to the surface is just as long and confusing as the ones going down to the sewers. Memorizing each nook and cranny must be a full-time job in itself!
On the way up, Svetlana makes small talk with the guides. She finds out that 1 of them is from an Oblast that isn't too far off from where she herself grew up. His name is Alexi and he's about her mortal age, deformed face, smooth pale skin, pointy elf ears.
His eyes are an unsettling shade of poison-ivy green, and his head is totally bald. He's a tall and lanky fellow, a bit gangly. He's dressed in a worn-out white dress shirt and slacks.
He speaks to her in Ukrainian, and they have a rather good-natured chat, talking about their pasts and whatnot. Both of them have undoubtedly come a long way from where they were before, and there's no telling where they will go in the future.
It isn't long before Alexi and his fellow Crawlers have guided the Assamites back up to what counts as civilization. Alexi pokes his head out and gives the hand signal saying that everything's clear. Soon enough, the door is opened, and John and company are outside.
It's just past 7 PM and the sky is dark and clear. John inhales some fresh air and sighs, "So, then. This is...um, where, exactly is this??"
Alexi answers, "Metro station north. Walk and you will find it. Here's some dirhams." He hands out some cash and coins to everyone.
Zeina bows her head and pockets the money, "Thank you, Crawler. This is...much appreciated."
The guide plainly smiles, "No problem. I go now. Mr. Thomas, he say he will meet with you at Elysium later. Tak (UA: Yes). Do pobachennya (UA: Goodbye)."
With that, Alexi and his fellow Nosferatu shuffle back into their hidey holes and close the door. John and his group of Assamites walk away from this disused building and head out into the busy streets.
He takes a few glances and looks around, still on high alert, but there's no sign of the dreaded SI. A few surveillance cams swivel and look around, but it doesn't seem to have the Assamite group in its limited line of sight. John breathes a sigh of relief and relaxes a bit.
They split up and go on their ways. Svetlana and John stick together while Zeina heads off to work. She catches the bus and sits all the way at the back, head lowered but eyes flicking around. She's still on edge, as are the rest of her fellow Judges.
John and Svetlana walk towards the large and well-lit metro station, get on a train (separately), and head towards the district where Abdullah used to live. The train ride is long but uneventful. Most people (mortals, mainly) are slumped against their seats as the city passes by in a blur.
Everyone from young office professionals in corporate attire to tourist-looking types are getting off the train as it nears its stop. Svetlana and John remain seated. A few minutes later, the train stops and the doors open. John and Svetlana are the first ones off.
They reconvene at the exit and walk a few blocks to Abdullah's Haven. This area looks somewhat deprived. The streets aren't that clean, the walls are grimy, and there's a dumpster that looks like it hasn't been cleared in a week.
A few mid-rises dot the cityscape, and the overall architecture has a distinctly cheap look to it. It's like someone constructed it just for the sake of doing so, not putting much thought or effort into the whole endeavor. There are a few visible cracks on some buildings, and cars are parked all over the place.
After a minute or so, John and Svetlana are standing outside of Abdullah's apartment building; it goes up for about 16 floors. Its brown color is fading away, and some of the windows are dirty and cracked.
The Assamites stare up at the building and the apartment on the 2nd floor. The single elevator is out of order, so they both take the steps up to Abdullah's Haven. The interior isn't too great-looking, either.
Spider webs and layers of dust cover the stairwell. A few of the lights are out, and the railings are old and rusted.
John shakes his head, going up the steps 2 at a time, "Jesus. He--Abdullah deserved so much better than this."
Svetlana nods, "Da. We all do, John. This place...even my building not dirty like this." She grimaces in disgust as she sees a family of mice scurrying around, going about their yucky business.
John grimaces as well, "Aw, fuck, that's disgusting. Just fucking disgusting. He didn't deserve this, Svetlana. This place is all kinds of OSHA violations!"
"OSHA?"
John faintly chuckles and walks over to Apartment number 206. He pulls out the key from his friend's wallet, "An American thing. Never mind. C'mon, let's--"
The key is in the doorknob, but John furrows his brows and looks at the door, "I--I just can't believe it, Svetlana. He's...gone."
Svetlana steps closer to John and puts her hand on his shoulder, "I am sorry, John. It--it is not fair."
He looks down at her hand, "No. It isn't fair. It isn't fair at all. I should've--should've gotten stayed back with him and held those bastards off."
"He did not want for that to happen, John."
John turns the key and pushes the door open, "Hmm. Yeah. He really gave it all so we could have another chance. Let's make sure that his sacrifice won't be in vain."
He flicks on the lights and takes a look around the small and cramped space. Grimy tiled flooring, thin walls, typical 1 BHK-style apartment. The Blood Sorcerer didn't have a lot, but he always did his best with what he had.
Sparse furnishings are scattered about. The thick curtains are pulled shut, the sofa looks like it was saved from angry cats with sharp claws, and there's an odd stack of books near the TV cabinet.
There are a few other pieces of furniture in the bedroom, a wardrobe, a single bed, a few shelves. A large beanbag chair and a side-table with a lamp are the only things in the small space.
John approaches the pile of books and spots quite a mix: there's an Arabic translation of Vladamir Lenin's "Imperialism, the Highest Stage of Capitalism", an anthology of translated writings by HG Wells, and some random scribblings on Kindred Blood Sorcery, mostly written in some really old and barely used dialects.
John picks up a book at random and flips through it, "Wow, he uh...really kept himself, busy, huh? Kid was always curious. I liked that about him."
All these books are timeworn and show signs of having been read through- multiple times, it seems.
There aren't a lot of personal belongings, but Abdullah did his best to keep himself outfitted with decent clothing and shoes for someone his perceived mortal age- shell jackets, dark denims, dark hoodies, sneakers, and the like.
Another cupboard is opened, and Svetlana sees some of Abdullah's other outfits, including a few robes. John takes a look and sighs deeply and sadly, "I never did see him wear these before."
Svetlana shrugs and picks up a bottle of perfume from off his messy table. She inspects the oud and sniffs it. The scent is quite strong- woody and leathery, like it's been crushed by the bare foot or something. She frowns and puts it down.
John runs his hands through the clothes, "Goddamn. What are we gonna do with all this stuff, Svetlana?"
"Put it in box and then...? I do not have any space in my Haven. I am sorry, John."
John nods in understanding and paces around this small space, "I got some space in my place. I just uh...need to find a few boxes." He goes around to do just that.
Svetlana opens a cabinet and finds Abdullah's stuff from work- his Palm Springs Mall employee ID card, a lanyard, some instruction manuals on how to sell stuff to potential customers, tech specs for gaming laptops, and more.
Jonh comes over and grabs the Blood Sorcerer's ID card. His eyes glaze over and he recalls, "Damn, it wasn't even that long ago when we were at that mall, fighting those 2 amateurs. Now, well, now...we're up against anything but."
Svetlana solemnly nods, "Da. Those 2. Who...were they, John? They were not with SI, but they did know what we are."
John sucks some air through his teeth and shrugs, "That's a mystery for another night--"
Svetlana narrows her eyes and reaches deep into the cabinet, "There is something under here...a notebook, it looks like."
She pulls out a worn-out red notebook, it's small and the cover has seen better nights, but the contents are still intact. It's all written in Arabic, which neither one of them can read. There are tiny splotches of blood on every other page and a few cryptic diagrams.
"Hmm, this is...uh, yeah, it's written in Arabic. Not sure what this is. Could be a diary or something. Can you read it?"
Svetlana frowns and shakes her head, "I cannot. I only know to speak a little bit."
She looks at the book again, eyes thoughtfully narrowed as she turns the pages over, "It...looks like something to do with Blood Magic, no? See, how this is all written and see this spot of blood here on page?"
John sighs, "It seems that way, but even if we could get past the language barrier, I'm not sure that we'd be able to decipher it."
"I know someone who might be able to help."
"Oh, who?"
"Saoirse. That Tremere. She is also knowing much about this Blood Magic and maybe she can understand this book, but I do not know if she is still busy with her work. We could go ask her tonight."
"Do you know how to reach her?"
Svetlana replies, "Da. She works from her Haven, doing customer service."
John lifts an eyebrow, "She does that from her home? Really? Wow. Anyway, yeah, if she's not too busy, we'll give her Abdullah's notes on Blood Sorcery. I'm not, like, super crazy about the Tremere but if you trust this Saoirse, then I trust her too. I trust your judgment here, Svetlana."
Svetlana remarks, "Saoirse is good woman, John. She can be trusted with...this. It is...what Abdullah would want."
John sighs and shakes his head, "Yeah, well, I hope so, Svetlana. I...hope...so." He still sounds so weak and distant. He continues through the Blood Sorcerer's Haven, respectfully moving things around and looking at them longingly and wistfully.
Svetlana makes the bed, does some light dusting, and clears out a little space. John quickly does the same and then the duo begin to pack things up in a slightly torn duffel bag.
In a matter of mere minutes, they've got a good amount of stuff packed away (mostly the important things like IDs, those writings on matters of the Blood, and a few other miscellany).
John decides to come back for the other stuff, on another night. Right now, he and his Childe have to go Elysium and see if this plan of his might actually work or if they're just gonna make things even worse than they already are.
As the Assamite duo are preparing to leave, a woman accosts them. She's slender and in her 30s, dressed in a pencil skirt, blazer, and heels. Her dark hair is tied in a ponytail, and her face is angular and quite pale.
John and Svetlana have their backs to her and are locking the door.
She calls out, her accent distinctly British and distinctly posh, "You there!"
The 2 Assamites almost jump out of their skin, and John swiftly turns around. The woman walks closer, "What do you think you're doing here? You're not the tenant of this particular apartment building. IDs, now."
John stiffens up and nods, "Uh...we're just grabbing something from our--our friend's place."
The woman folds her arms and taps her foot, "And what is your friend's name, hmm? I need to see your IDs."
Svetlana gulps and approaches the woman, "Abdullah Rachman."
The woman is satisfied with that answer, but her expression still reflects her suspicion, "Yes this is indeed Mr. Rachman's Ha--dwelling place, but I still need to see your IDs. If not, I shall have no other choice but to call the police and report you 2 for trespassing."
John grimaces, "Look, lady, we're not trespassing! We're--we're good friends of Abdullah's. We've known him for years and he's uh, well..."
The lady lifts her chin, "Yes, where is your good friend, then, hmm? He owes me money. Rent was due last night. He said he would have the money for me by tonight."
Svetlana hesitantly replies, "He...he cannot pay you."
"Why not?"
John takes a deep breath and kicks the duffel bag behind him, "Look, um...he didn't pay his rent because he uh..."
"Out. With. It."
Jonh feels his head spinning. Her voice, those 3 words particularly, echo in his head and thump like a headache, "Well, you see, he uh...um..."
The landlady puts her cold (!) hands on the 2 Assamites and reiterates her command, her voice stern and authoritative, "Out. With. It. Now. This is my building, and you will obey my orders. Now, out with it!"
The words pour out of John's mouth before he even has a chance to think, "He--he was destroyed this morning!" He gasps and catches himself while Svetlana's jaw is agape and her eyes are wide with surprise.
The landlady's eyes narrow and she tilts her head a little, "Destroyed? You...you're both Kindred, aren't you?"
Svetlana's claws pop out and she's ready to attack, but the landlady takes a step back and forces a sharp exhale out of her mouth, "Ah, of course you are. I didn't hear a heartbeat, and you seemed resistive to my...powers."
John's face scrunches in confusion, "Who the fuck are you?"
The landlady introduces herself, chin held up high, "Margot. Clan Ventrue. Your Assamite friend still owes me money--"
John speaks his mind and gestures around, "This place is a fucking dump. I thought you Ventrue had some kind of aesthetic sense!"
Svetlana nudges John and shakes her head, "Nyet, John. Please, do not."
Margot's laugh is shrill, and she lazily waves her hand in dismissal, "Hahahaha! You confuse us for the Toreador, then. This place is what it is. Most of the pitiful people who rent don't even spend that much time in their homes. In fact, some of them barely even set foot here at all- work and the like."
John shakes his head in disgust, "That's not an excuse to put people up in shitholes!"
Svetlana sheepishly nods, "Da. Is not nice place, Margot. Can you not fix it, maybe put new--"
The Blue Blood lifts her finger and shushes Svetlana, "Tch, you, quiet. Your friend still owes me rent. As sorry as I am for his undoubtedly untimely demise, he signed an agreement with me and is obligated to uphold his end of the bargain. I do not negotiate with the downtrodden, and I am not a charity. This is business. It is a simple equation."
John's lip curls, and he's trying to resist the urge to attack Margot right here and now, "You're a fucking monster! DO YOU EVEN KNOW HOW ABDULLAH--"
Svetlana grips his arm tightly, "No, John. No."
Margot snidely asks, "What Clan do you 2 come from, anyway? Let me guess, Caitiff?"
Svetlana responds, "We are Banu Haqim, of the Blade of Haqim."
Margot shrugs indifferently, "I have no idea what that last part is and I don't care. Regardless, your fellow Assamite owes me money. And, how in the blazes did you 2 even get in there?!"
John sarcastically replies, "We transformed into rats and snuck in. It was easy."
Margot lifts her chin and scoffs, "Pfft. Poppycock."
The Assamites glare at Margot and she glares back at them with greater intensity, "Like I said: this building and the other ones I own are not charities or welfare institutions for the great unwashed to take shelter in. This is a business, and I make a good profit out of it."
"What a surprise. You do have that Ventrue Blood in you, after all. Arrogant--"
Svetlana tugs at her Sire's arm again while keeping her eyes locked on Margot, "John, stop. We have much more important things to do tonight."
Margot's expression is almost blank, but there's a glint in her eyes, "Listen to this Russian prostitute--"
Whoa, whoa!
Svetlana's face hardens and she practically screams, "You dare say such things about me?! You would insult me and then you would insult my Sire as well?"
John shoves Svetlana, "Wait, Svetlana, let's just--"
Svetlana grits her teeth, her fangs fully visible. Her claws are out and she's about to take a swipe when John yanks her back, "Svetlana, NO! NO!"
Margot softly chuckles and folds her arms. She watches on, cool as a corpse cucumber. She looks amused by this.
Svetlana is flustered, "John, we should just leave! Let us go, da?"
John concurs and glowers at the Power Monger, "Yeah, let's go."
Margot casually states, "I have spare keys. I'll empty everything out and see that it's disposed of accordingly. But I still want my money."
John and Svetlana ignore her and walk away, the former seething with rage and the latter fearing for his safety. Svetlana carries the duffel bag over her shoulder, and they make their way to Saoirse's Haven for a quick chat.
The Tremere has a few minutes off her demanding shift, so she invites Svetlana and her Sire in. Upon entering, John is hit with that uncanny valley effect. Everything in this Usurper's Haven is meticulously arranged, nothing is out of place, all the lamps are in deliberate angles, and everything is squared up and spaced out.
Even the living room is organized to perfection: the surfaces are dusted, the trinkets are evenly spaced from each other, and everything looks brand new. John's gaze glazes over and he almost falls over.
The Tremere introduces herself to John, "Saoirse Ramachandran. Clan Tremere. Irish. Indian, too. By the way, nice katana you got in that wee guitar case of yours."
John is taken aback, "How did you know--"
Saoirse chuckles, "Auspex, macushla (IE: darling). I saw it while you were waiting at the door. So, Svetlana, how are you? How's the...y'know?"
(She's talking about the whole Wraith thing. Svetlana still hasn't told her Sire about that yet).
Svetlana nods and smiles a small smile, "Da. Is under control now."
John is clueless and he asks, "What thing? Anyway, my name's John Suarez. I'm Svetlana's Sire. Um...Mexican-American, I guess. This place, it feels so...weird. It's like it feels bigger than it--it actually is. Like I'm in a dream. I'm still kinda buzzed from the fight last night and uh...I'm still reeling from Abdullah's uh...from what happened."
Saoirse looks at her watch, her brows creasing, "My shift is starting soon. Yeah, I made some wee 'adjustments', you could call it, to this place."
Svetlana unzips the duffel bag and hands over all of Abdullah's Blood Sorcery-related writings and notes, "Saoirse, we need your help. We have...something here. Our close a--and dear friend, Abdullah, was researching Blood Sorcery and--"
John interjects, "He was destroyed earlier today. The SI put him out for the sun and recorded the whole fucking thing- fucking shitbags."
Saoirse blinks a few times, her expression solemn and somewhat tired, "Oh, I--I'm so sorry to hear that." She takes the writings and goes over them. She mumbles a few things under her breath, "Hmm, yes, yes...hmm, these are all in Arabic..."
She furrows her brows and gets lost in her own head for a moment. She reads through the various notes and looks over the drawings a few times before she finally closes the notebook and sighs, "Well, it's Blood Sorcery alright. I know a few of those wee diagrams. It's similar, in some ways, to the ones back in the Abu Dhabi Chantry."
John pushes his luck and asks, "You're a Blood Sorcerer, too, right? Can't you uh...help us? Abdullah was our best; you should've seen the way he worked, like, like magic--"
Saoirse shakes her head, a pained expression forming on her face, "I'm sorry, macushla. I just can't. I wish I could, really, but work's being a right pain in the arse these past few nights."
John presses his lips into a thin line and nods, "Well, it was worth a try. You think you could learn something valuable from that stuff? Abdullah was my best friend, and I'd like someone to carry on his legacy and honor his memory. He was, simply put, the best damn Blood Sorcerer you'd have ever met."
He quickly adds, "I mean, I'm sure you Tremere are great at it and all, but Abdullah was...on another level." He turns his head aside and sighs, "Damn, this is depressing."
Saoirse nods, "I see. Well, if I have the time, I'll give this some serious thought. I can't make any commitments, but I'll see what I can do. I know that Banu Haqim Blood Sorcery is vastly different from Tremere Blood Sorcery. I don't read Arabic, but I could learn to do so I put me mind to it."
Svetlana incredulously asks, "You can learn to read Arabic so fast? Even after all my time in UAE, I know only few words and phrases. I cannot read it, but I can speak very little of it."
Saoirse smiles and looks into Svetlana's eyes, "I'm a Tremere, love. Once I put my dead heart to something, I do it, and I see it through to its end. It's going to be a challenge, but I'm ready, all the same, to give it a lash."
Some kind of ringing sound comes from Saoirse's open laptop, and she clicks on an icon.
She looks up at the 2 Assamites, feeling a bit disappointed, "That's work. If I don't check in, those dryshites will cut my fockin' pay. I'm sorry. I'll look into this when I get time. Feel free to see yourselves out and...yeah, stay safe out there. You both look like shite."
John waves goodbye and leaves. Svetlana waits till he's out of earshot and says, "Thank you, Saoirse. For helping me with Wraith. She is still...near to me, but I cannot always reach out to her. It is...hard for me, sometimes. If you do learn something from Abdullah's notes, please let us know."
Saoirse smiles and puts on her bulky headphones. She snuggles up on her sofa, "I will. Take care now, Svetlana, and take care of your Sire, too. He seems like a decent fella. I'll see you soon, and we'll...well, I'm not sure when we'll meet again, but I hope it's under better circumstances. And my condolences to your friend."
"Da. Thank you."
Svetlana steps out of the Usurper's Haven and feels the gentle nighttime breeze on her cold skin. John is milling about and stroking his chin, wondering how this place actually fits together. His face is scrunched up in confusion, but he doesn't voice any of his thoughts out loud.
Svetlana shuffles over to him and asks, "Are you ready to go to Elysium?"
John tiredly says, "As ready as I'll ever be. C'mon, let's grab a taxi. I'll pay, don't worry."
Svetlana walks with her Sire along a footpath and asks, "What is this plan of yours? You did not tell me. You must tell me, John, so I can support you."
John picks up the pace, "It's gonna be a plan, Svetlana. I dunno how this is all gonna pan out. Look, if you don't wanna come with me, then that's fine--"
"Nyet. I am coming with you. You are my Sire, and I am your Childe. I...almost lost you last night. I was so scared when--when you were--"
"I know, Svetlana. I know. I still feel the effects lingering in my body, like some kind of sticky, slimy residue that I can't seem to get out of my system. I don't think it's gonna go away anytime soon. I--I hope this plan works out. It's the only thing I can think of that might help us out, at the moment."
"This plan, it will turn the tide?"
"I genuinely hope so. I genuinely hope so, Svetlana."
The taxi ride to The Grand Alhambra is quick. The driver knows plenty of nifty shortcuts through the city. He's a good guy. John pays him and the 2 Assamites are inside The Grand Alhambra's grander lobby.
Ms. Kawasaki is idly lolling about near the bar area, and if she's there, that means Vizier Mohammed is here, too. Miss K scowls at her fellow Assamites and then looks around, as if expecting someone else to come barging through those doors.
John shakes his head and steps into the elevator, "She's got issues."
Svetlana faintly chuckles, "Da."
Elevators are switched where needed, and it isn't long before the 2 are all the way up at the 140th floor, where Elysium resides. The elevator doors open, and the duo step out.
There's a different goon standing by the door to the lounge, his bored expression showing a keen desire to not be here right now, but he's just doing his job. His suit is tidy, and his sunglasses are on.
He lifts his head, his eyes barely registering the presence of the 2 approaching Assamites.
He holds out his hand, palm facing out, "Please surrender any and all weapons on your...err...person." He gestures to the man behind the counter. John recognizes him from the last time he and his Childe came here.
John unslings his guitar case and hands it over to the guy, explaining, "My katana's in there. Keep it safe for me."
Svetlana surrenders her ceramic and obsidian daggers and curtly nods. She sees some of the really gnarly weapons on display- shiny pistols, maces, battle axes from centuries prior, and even a fucking claymore sword. That last one is bolted to the wall it looks old and worn-down, anyway.
She shrugs and heads inside the lounge proper with her Sire. Inside, Vizier Mohammed is jovially talking and wildly gesticulating about something to some other Kindred, Setites most likely. They're all wearing suits, and they mildly bored out of their minds.
It's likely the Vizier is, once again, talking (at great length) about his favorite subject in the entire world- Alamut.
Seth sees the approaching Assamite duo and he briskly walks towards Svetlana. He ignores John and puts his hands on Svetlana's shoulders, "Svetlana! How are you? Tommy told me you took quite a beating last night. He even said a lot of you were destroyed last night. I--I was worried, I thought you--"
Svetlana uncomfortably wiggles out of the High Priest's grip and backs up a little, "Nyet, nyet. I...am fine."
John lifts an eyebrow and looks askance at Seth, "Hey, I'm fine, too, y'know..."
Seth clasps his hands together and looks at the 2 Assamites, but it's obvious his eyes keep going towards Svetlana, "So, how can I help you tonight? Tommy said you...wanted to talk about something. He was pretty vague about the whole thing."
John nods, "Yup. Now, where's that spineless asshole? Hey, Mohammed!!"
The Banu Haqim Primogen turns towards the direction of the shouting, his face turning into a scowl upon seeing those 2, "You 2. What do you want?" His Setite entourage are all giving John the stink eye.
The Vizier is dressed in a fancy and embroidered thawb along with brown sandals that look new. He slowly approaches John, chin raised, and face contorted in disdain, "Ah, Mr. Suarez. Ms. Bobrov. My...condolences on your recent losses."
John scoffs, "Keep 'em, you spineless, sniveling little fucking weasel." He steps closer to Vizier Mohammed and glowers, "You have a lot of fucking nerve showing yourself around these parts. You have no idea, NO IDEA AT ALL, how many we've lost over these past few nights."
Tommy casually joins in, "Aye, you came. So, you ready for this, John?"
Seth side-eyes the Nosferatu Primogen, "Ready for what? What the hell is going on here?"
Svetlana tenses up as John has that determined and intense look in his eyes.
The other Kindred in the lounge have all stopped what they're doing and are also watching intently.
John looks around and gulps. Paul, the Toreador Harpy, inserts himself into this tense situation in a very casual manner, "Alright, let's get this show on the road. Thomas--err--Tommy told me everything. Uh, yeah."
Seth gets a little annoyed, "Nobody told me anything. What is going on here??!"
Tommy nods over to John, who clears his throat and loudly announces, "I'm here to challenge Vizier Mohammed Khan for the position of Primogen."
Silence. Dead silence. Svetlana lets out a small gasp but doesn't say much else.
Vizier Mohammed lifts his chin higher and folds his arms, "Pfft. Nonsense. You have no right to do such a thing. It has not even been that long since your arrival to this Domain. Why would you assume you could just take my position? That is highly presumptuous and utterly absurd."
John shakes his head and smiles, "It's nothing of the sort. Truth is, it's YOU who's been holding us back. YOU refuse to let any of our fellow Assamites join us in this fight against the SI. As a result, we've been losing too many good people over these past few nights, and you keep sending out these bullshit excuses."
He grunts and adds, "I'm done with it. Whatever they are, I'm done with it. This ends now. Once again, I challenge you for the position of Banu Haqim Primogen for the Domain of Al-Kushraf city. I don't care if it's the proper way or not. We have bigger fish to fry, and you're just...in the way."
Vizier Mohammed scoffs, "Tch. You dare march in here and make such demands! If this were not Elysium, I WOULD CUT YOU DOWN!" Bluster, judging by his tone and whatnot.
Tommy points out the obvious, "Aye, John's right. You've no exactly been the most helpful. The Blade of Haqim IS from yer own Clan, yet yous refuse tae be supporting them because you no agree with their teachings or some shite."
Seth's expression darkens, "Well, Vizier Mohammed, what say you?"
Paul softly chuckles and adjusts his cufflinks, "Yup, what say you, indeed? Truth be told, it was a long time coming. All you ever do is talk peoples' heads off about Alamut. It's like you're so 1-dimensional and superficial. Is there literally nothing else that you...y'know, like to talk about. It's always Alamut this, Alamut that--"
The Vizier balefully glowers at the Harpy, "I would rather talk about the great and might Alamut than listen to you Degenerates prattle on about whatever you wish to talk about."
Paul smiles a toothy smile, "Yeah, OK, that's fair. Y'know, you're actually more interesting when you're angry."
Seth takes a step back, "This has nothing to do with me or the Ministry. Sort this out among yourselves. Just don't make a mess. This is Elysium, after all. Now, you see why it's important to surrender your weapons at the front, heh."
He steps back, but not before giving Svetlana a cheeky smile. She winces a little and looks down at her feet.
John puts his hands on his hips and gets all up in the Vizier's bidness, "So, what's it gonna be? You gonna step down or do I have to make you?" he cracks his knuckles and then his neck.
Mohammed snarls, his fangs visible, "You DARE threaten me? Here?? You think you can just march in here and take MY position as Primogen??"
John reiterates his demand, plainly and equably, "Yup. So, what's it gonna be, Mr. Mohammed Khan?"
The Vizier takes a step back, but he still manages to maintain his composure. His brows furrow and he looks away from John, his mind racing over the possibilities.
The Nossie Primogen sniffs, "Aye, just accept it, ya fud. After this all blows over, John, Paul, and I agreed that we'd give it back to yous. Unless you are willing to let your fellow Judges join this wee fight--"
With a defeated expression on his face, Vizier Mohammed begrudgingly accepts the terms, "I--I accept. I step down, temporarily, as Primogen for the Banu Haqim Clan in the Domain of Al-Kushraf." His shoulders are slumped, and he refuses to make eye contact with anyone present.
John is taken aback by how easy that was. He was kinda preparing for some kind of 5D rhetorical mind games politicking bullshit. He's still tense and on edge, but his mind slowly starts to relax.
Vizier Mohammed shakes his head and leaves the lounge, the doors slamming shut behind him. An awkward and tense silence hangs in the air.
Paul claps John on the back and approvingly says, "WOW! HOLY! You did it! You actually did it! This is unprecedented but...I dunno, I kinda like this? Heh heh."
He turns his head towards Seth and softly smiles, "Well, uh...I guess this makes John Suarez the Primogen of the Banu Haqim Clan in the Domain of Al-Kushraf, UAE!"
Seth blandly shrugs, "I guess it does. What now, John?"
Indeed, what now?
Svetlana tugs on her Sire's arm and whispers, "Da. What now, John? You--you are now Primogen, but how will that help us?"
John outlines his plan, "As Primogen, I'll meet with those of our Clan who aren't of the Blade. I'll coordinate with them and see how they can help us out in the fight against the SI. I'm hoping they can bring something to the table that'll give us an edge in this fight. It's a longshot, but I've really got nothing else up my sleeve."
Tommy reassures the new Assamite Primogen, "Aye, nae bother. I'm here tae help yous out."
Seth smirks and inquires, "Thomas, Thomas, Thomas. If I had to guess, I'd say this was your plan?"
The Nossie Primogen shakes his head, "Naw, not at all. It was John who initially said something and that got me thinking. I had a wee chat with Paul over here and...we decided tae go for it. I hope it works out, but I'm confident it will."
Seth nods, "I see. Well, this should make things interesting, don't you think so, Svetlana?"
Svetlana nervously replies, "I--I do not know. We are not here to make things interesting. We are here to get support in the fight against the Second Inquisition and remove them from these lands."
John looks at his Childe and sees the worry in her eyes, "It's OK, Svetlana. I'm sure it'll work out. I can't promise anything right now. I'm only doing this temporarily. Once every last one of those Israeli bastards have been Judged, I'm steeping down and handing the reins back to the Vizier."
Seth comments, "That's awfully...altruistic of you, John. Most Kindred would stop at nothing to hold on to such power and influence. I see that you're...not like most Kindred. At least, not like the ones I've met before. Maybe it's because you're a part of the Blade of Haqim and all that."
John notices something in Seth's tone, but can't quite put his finger on it, "Uhm...OK. I'm glad we've got that settled- I thought it was gonna be a lot harder, heh. Tommy, Paul, do you mind helping me out? You 2 know more about our Clan around here than I do."
Paul smiles widely, "It would be our pleasure."
"Aye!"
After a minute, Ms. Kawasaki comes storming through the doors, her tantō in hand, and murderous intent in her eyes. She points her knife at John, "YOU!"
Vizier Mohammed trails behind her, a look of anguish on his face. He wrestles the blade from her cold hand and chides his charge, "Calm yourself! You cannot do this! It has already been settled! Please, Miss Kawasaki."
Seth rolls his eyes, "Great, just great."
Ms. Kawasaki scoffs, "HOW DARE YOU! You can't just--just fucking come in here and take his place!" Her claws pop out and she lunges towards Svetlana, but she leaps away just in time.
Tommy growls, holds his hands up, and shakes his head, "Naw, naw, naw! Nae violence in Elysium, hen. Don't make us do something we'll regret."
Paul picks Svetlana up and sets her down in a safe place.
John cracks his knuckles and smirks at the pissed off Miss K, "Yeah? Who's gonna stop me? You? I'm Primogen now. If Mohammed had any spine, any sort of conviction at all, this wouldn't have happened. I challenged him, fair and square, and he gave it up without even so much as a fight."
He shrugs and looks at the Vizier, "No offense, man, but...you truly are as spineless as they come."
Miss Kawasaki screeches and flashes her claws at the new Assamite Primogen, but John steps out of the way and dodges it.
He grabs her by the arm, twists her around, and slams her to the ground. Seth winces at this, as do the other Setites gathered here. Some of them mumble and walk off without saying anything.
Svetlana watches in horror as her Sire keeps Miss K pinned to the ground. She hisses and struggles to break free, but John makes sure to keep her subdued. His Kenpo training comes in handy here.
She looks up at him with utter contempt and growls, "You can't do this. He is--was our Primogen. You have no right, you--you fucking outsider!"
John snarls at her, "Outsider?! I AM A BANU HAQIM, just like you are! Join us, we need capable people like you on our side. Help us take the fight to these fuckin' Israelis!"
Miss Kawasaki hisses in disgust, "I--I will never help you or that stupid Blade nonsense cause of yours. Now, unhand me you fu--"
John grabs her by the hair and lifts her head up. He bares his fangs and leans in close, "I am your Primogen now. This is happening whether you like it or not. The Blade of Haqim IS a part of our Clan."
Ms. Kawasaki screams and tries to claw at John's face, but he easily dodges her feeble attempt.
Svetlana shouts, "NYET! NO FIGHTING IN ELYSIUM!"
Seth shakes his head and sighs, "Enough, enough! John, please, let her go."
Vizier Mohammed comes over and pats Ms. K's back, "Miss Kawasaki, it's OK. It's OK. It's not forever. Once this is all done and over with, Mr. Suarez has agreed to hand the position of Primogen back to me."
Ms. Kawasaki sneers, "Like hell he will. He'll hold on to it and make us do his bidding. I'd sooner end him on the spot than accept anything he says."
John snickers, "You can try. You can try. Besides, I'm not gonna do what she said. If anything, everything I do from here on out is gonna prove her wrong."
Vizier Mohammed lets Ms. Kawasaki go and backs off. She brushes herself off and adjusts her top. She turns around and gives John a sour look.
The Vizier clears his throat and looks at John, "So you say, Mr. Suarez. I pray that you are an honorable man of your word. For now, I can focus myself on educating Miss Kawasaki."
John scowls, "Educating her on what?"
Vizier Mohammed looks a little embarrassed. He looks at his charge with some pity and then at John, "She does not know how to read."
Paul is taken aback, "What?! Did I--did I hear you right? You're telling me she doesn't know how to...read? Like, what books or...?"
Svetlana looks at Miss K with sympathy in her eyes.
Ms. Kawasaki shakes her head and lowers it in shame, but her permanent angry scowl somehow makes her look less sad and more annoyed.
Vizier Mohammed explains, "I am afraid so. She was born into the Web of Knives. From a very young age, her sole purpose was to be trained in assassination. I fear that reading and writing was not part of her...education."
He looks at his charge with pity and says, "I am sorry, Miss Kawasaki. Our Clan has failed you, now I see to it that such mistakes are rectified."
He then turns towards John, "The Web of Knives, like the Blade of Haqim, is a mistake and a stain upon the venerable image of our great and mighty Clan, Mr. Suarez. I hope you understand this."
John counters, "Bullshit. Look, I'm sorry about her being illiterate, but the Blade is absolutely nothing like the Web. The Web are assassins-for-hire, selling their services to the highest bidder. The Blade is about fighting for a free Palestine. We are NOT the same thing, not even by a longshot!"
Vizier Mohammed sighs and looks at his charge, "Miss Kawasaki, I think it is time we take our leave. Please, retrieve your weapon and come with me. Do not say anything or cause more problems. I want no violence in Elysium."
She complies by grunting and snatching her tantō. She growl-hisses at John and stomps off, leaving the lounge with a heavy air of tension behind her.
Ms. K waits by the elevator while the Vizier returns, head lowered, "Tomorrow night, I will put you in contact with someone who will help you in your...cause."
John blandly responds, "That's much appreciated."
The Vizier bows, turns on his heel, and leaves.
Svetlana slowly walks up to John and says, "You--you did good, John. I did not think it would be so...easy."
John sighs and rubs his face, "Yeah, well, I'm just glad it's over with. Thomas, Paul, what are our next steps?"
Tommy's chuckle comes out as a muffled growl, "It's in your hands now, pal. The Nosferatu will continue to monitor the digital spaces. Hopefully, they cannae find out about our plans tae keep fighting them. I suggest that you focus on bringing our Clan together and making them see things from your perspective. It'll take a lot of convincing, but we all believe in you."
Paul firmly nods and cracks a reassuring smile, "Yep. What he said, basically. I'm sure the other Assamites around here...um...sympathize with the Palestinian cause. They've been keeping themselves away from the Court and the Primogen Council all this time because of Mohammed and his stupid Alamut-centric rhetoric and--and obsessions."
He turns to Svetlana and looks at her, "Well, between me and you, I won't be missing those hours-long conversations about Alamut, haha!"
Svetlana chuckles along and nods, "Haha. Da. It was too much."
Seth notices Paul and Svetlana chuckling along and clears his throat, "Ahem! So, what are your next steps, John? You may be the new Banu Haqim Primogen, but...there are still hurdles."
John asks, "Like?"
The Typhonist points out, "Have you considered how you'll deal with the other Clans in the Domain? How will THEY react to you being the new kid on the established block? Have you considered that, hmm?"
John shakes his head, "No, no I haven't. I already have Tommy's support. Mark and Sebastian can go fuck themselves for all I care. Absalom is creepy, so let him do his own thing. All I need is to rally the other Assamites in this city, get 'em to see reason, and then we can finally get rid of the SI, like you always wanted."
Seth merely nods, his eyes shifting about, "I don't know, John. I have a bad feeling about this. I know we do things differently here in Al-Kushraf, but this, whoa, this is quite new. Even for me. I've presided over the Primogen Council for decades now. This is unprecedented. Truly."
Paul tries to reassure the Setite, "I'm sure it'll be fine. Don't worry, John's got this under control. We'll make sure of it. We have his back."
Seth turns to Paul and remarks, "You're burning a lotta bridges with your own Clan by throwing your lot in with the Banu Haqim. What do you get out of all this, anyway?"
The Toreador Harpy shrugs and states, "The satisfaction of not having the forces of the Second Inquisition drag us out of our beds during the day or blow our Havens to smithereens with high explosives. Isn't that, like, enough?"
Seth raises an eyebrow and scoffs, "Tch. Oh, please! As if! There's more to it than that. I know there is. You're a Harpy, you trade in gossip, secrets, and info. So, what's the deal? What's the angle you're trying to play here, hmm?"
Paul rolls his eyes and turns away from the Setite. He pulls out his vape pen and takes a puff, "Not everyone's got an angle they're trying to play or some super-evil plot they're cooking up in their heads. Some of us are actually capable of acting selflessly for once, y'know?"
He puffs again and lets the strawberry-scented vapor out of his mouth, "Look, I know you Setites have a Clan Compulsion to lead everyone you see down a path of Transgression or whatever, but c'mon, man. It's not always like that, OK?"
Seth narrows his eyes at him and turns towards Svetlana, "That's your opinion, Mr. Devers. What about you, huh? What do you think of your Sire seizing the position of Primogen? I'm sure you have something to say on the matter, Svetlana."
Svetlana avoids looking into Seth's serpentine eyes. The way he looks at her and talks to her reeks of an unhealthy obsession. She feels kinda uncomfortable and uneasy just by standing near him.
She says nothing and keeps her eyes locked onto John.
Her Sire reassures her, "It's OK, Svetlana. It's all gonna be OK. I'll have you by my side, right?"
Svetlana faintly smiles, "Da. Always, John. Always." She looks at Seth and forces a smile, not wanting to be rude to the man who bought her and her Sire new phones all those nights ago.
John clears his throat and says, "So...that's it for now, I guess. Tomorrow night, I meet up with whoever the Vizier puts me in contact with. Maybe they can help me out? I certainly hope so. I hope he's not trying to pull a fast one on us."
Seth shrugs, "Possibly. You never know. Who knows what connections Vizier Mohammed has?"
Svetlana tugs on John's sleeve and whispers into his ear, "We--we need to go now."
John calms her down, "In a minute, in a minute. I just need to go over some things with Tommy and Paul over here. After that, I'll drop you back."
Svetlana can feel Seth's obsessive eyes boring into the back of her head. She winces and turns away from him, her heart acting up in her chest. She doesn't know what he's thinking or doing behind her back. She wishes she did.
Oh, if only she knew...
A few Setites still lingering around take this opportunity to say that the Blade of Haqim are nothing but dangerous extremists who should not be put in any place or position of power. John glowers at them, shakes his head, and ignores them.
They then ask Seth how he could allow such an outsider to infiltrate their "halls" and usurp the seat of the Banu Haqim Primogen.
The High Priest tells his fellow Serpents, "It's a Banu Haqim thing. There's nothing I can or will do about it. If it is the will of Typhon, then so be it."
A few other Sand-Snakes inquire about the Caitiff problem in the city.
Seth stifles a chuckle and retorts, "What Caitiff problem? A lot of them were destroyed in the Marjan Tower explosion, the rest fled, the few who do lurk about here and there are hardly a threat to us. They are well-behaved. No worries."
He adds, "I'm told that N0S4A2 is still out there, racing their cars and what have you. As long as they stay in their lane, it shouldn't be too much trouble for us or for our many interests in this Domain."
Seth is quite good at using his silver (one might say forked) tongue to put his fellow Serpents at ease during these times. He also seems to be pretty adept at deflecting attention away from himself and his own schemes.
John pays this no mind. His focus is elsewhere. He feels the weight of his new position. He needs to get with the non-Blade Assamites, talk to them, and come up with a plan to take the fight to the SI menace, and drive them from these lands once and for all.
Svetlana and Paul make some small talk, much to Seth's chagrin, with Paul humbly showing off what bits of Ukrainian he's been learning over these past few months.
Svetlana lightly giggles and replies, "Good! Very good! It needs some work, though. But is very good for beginner like you."
Paul smirks and nods, "I know, I know. It's still a work in progress."
Seth inserts himself, his snake cane firmly planted on the ground, "So, how are things with you, Svetlana?"
Svetlana avoids looking at him, instead focusing on Paul, "Da, fine, is fine. We are doing fine, thank you."
Seth looks at her and sees her fidgeting. He asks, "You OK? You seem a little more...distressed than usual. Is it the pressure of combat? I heard you lost some people close to you."
A few tears of blood well up in Svetlana's eyes. She brushes them away before they have a chance to fall. She looks at Seth with a mixture of anger and sadness, "You--you know?"
Seth equably answers, "Of course I do. Were you close to any of them in particular?"
"Da. Abdullah Rachman. He comes from Syria. He was, at time of his Embrace, 19-years-old."
Paul's eyebrows shoot up in surprise, "Whoa, that's young."
Svetlana continues, "Da. He was...good person. Very talented Blood Sorcerer. He stayed back and fought while rest of us all fled down to Nosferatu Warrens."
Seth tilts his head to the side, "Oh, so you've been down there, huh? How was it?"
"I cannot complain. I should not. The Nosferatu were kind to us, they gave us place to rest, new clothes, little money, and some blood to drink. Then, after that, we leave them."
The Setite nods and hums, "I see. Interesting."
Paul doesn't put his hand on Svetlana's shoulder when he reassuringly says, "It'll be OK. Once you've got the rest of your fellow Assassins by your side, you're gonna kick these fucking goons out of here for good. Just you wait and see." He's got that kindness in his eyes that Svetlana greatly appreciates.
Svetlana nods in agreement, "Da. Da, we will. We must. They must be Judged. They must be punished, not only for what they did to Abdullah but also for what they did to the others. Especially to the others who could not fight back."
John comes over and pats his Childe on the back, "We'll get 'em all. Don't you worry."
She smiles at her Sire and says, "I know we will. We must." There is a steely resolve in her eyes that John hasn't seen before.
He's impressed by this. He's proud of her.
Seth turns towards him and comments, "She has fire in those eyes of hers, doesn't she?"
"Mm-hmm."
After going over a few more things with Thomas, Paul, and Seth, the new Banu Haqim Primogen leaves this place, his Childe following closely behind.
There's a new Primogen in town and let's hope that he has the ear of all the non-Blade Assamites in this Domain. Their support in the upcoming struggles could mean the difference between Unlife and Final Death.
Several minutes later, at Vizier Mohammed's Haven...
Edwin, Seth's Ghoul, pulls up at the entrance of this grand and gaudy mansion in the heart of Al-Kushraf city.
The mansion is a massive, 2-storey structure. It's made entirely of white marble and has a grandiose air about it. The entrance is adorned with a series of columns and intricate carvings. There's a large fountain in the courtyard, spraying water into the air.
The gardens around the mansion are well-kept and immaculate, with lush greenery and hedges that are perfectly trimmed.
Someone in traditional livery bows her head and escorts the High Priest inside. Vizier Mohammed is pacing about and speaking to his Ghouls, who are similarly dressed, about something or the other. He looks quite distraught.
As the Typhonist approaches, snake head cane in hand, the Assamite waves them off and dismisses them. They file out simultaneously, 1 after the other. That kind of unquestioning devotion impresses Seth very much.
