Edwin has been acting rather strange these past few nights, so Seth makes sure to keep a close eye on him. He can't let Edwin know that he suspects him of anything, either.
Regardless, Seth approaches the Vizier and opines, "A grand Haven, Mr. Khan. Every time I step in here, I see something new. Quite the regal aura. Your Ghouls are also quite...dutiful. That's good. My Edwin could learn a thing or 2 from them."
Vizier Mohammed chuckles and waves the Serpent away, "Oh, please, Mr. Steale! How you flatter me with your words. You were right...last night when we spoke at that decommissioned power plant- John would try something, however I did not expect it to be so...b--brazen!"
Seth softly smirks and plants his butt on the white fainting couch, "Yes, I was right, wasn't I? Of course I was. And you followed my advice: give him whatever he wants."
The Vizier sits opposite him on a smaller couch and grumbles, "I know, I know. However, I am afraid of what will come next."
Seth remains composed, "I'm not. It was only a matter of time before push came to shove. You see as Setites, we believe, to a certain extent, in giving people whatever it is they want, whatever it is their heart desires. We do all of this in the hopes of liberating them from the very same."
Vizier Mohammed dryly nods, "And if what they want is not...proper?"
Seth lets out a terse chuckle, "Well, we still give it to them all the same. Of course, I myself deviate from Ministry orthodoxy on this matter. These...people, they're already drowning in modernity and I'm the one in the big boat on the stormy seas, with the life preservers."
The Vizier growls, "I know. I know. It is just that--that I feel like I am betraying my Clan by doing this, by granting the Blade a 'small' concession, I am effectively giving them the whole tent!" he sighs and rubs his forehead, "How did things end up this way?" he mutters under his breath.
Seth replies, "Oh, it's not all your fault, Mr. Khan. All we can do now is sit back and let them do the dirty work of getting rid of the SI. I have no doubt that many will perish along the way."
The Assamite ex-Primogen's expression darkens, "As long as those who perish are those of the Blade."
"That's the idea, yes."
The High Priest looks down at the shiny marble flooring and sees a faint reflection of himself in it. He smiles a little and continues, "John Suarez is an...interesting person, wouldn't you say?"
Vizier Mohammed shrugs, "He is a Banu Haqim, like us, yes, but he and his Childe are so unlike us as well. I know I should not have such impure and improper thoughts, but I pray that he and his Childe meet a swift Final Death."
Yikes.
Seth hisses and his eyes turn into slits, he menacingly fixes his gaze on the Vizier, "Mr. Khan, I couldn't give less of a shit about what happens to John Suarez, but if you ever say that about Svetlana, so help me Typhon, I will have you dragged out into the sun." He keeps his tone of voice neutral throughout all of this.
There isn't a hint of rage in his threat. He just says it as a matter of fact.
The Vizier surreptitiously apologizes, "F--Forgive me, oh great High Priest. I spoke out of line. My most humble and sincere apologies. I--I--" he stammers, trying to find the right words to say.
Seth's eyes return to the way they were, and he lazily waves his hand, "I understand how...zealous you Banu Haqim can get. Yes, John is an obstacle that's better dealt with sooner rather than later, but Svetlana...oh, she--she's something else." A wide smile stretches across his face. The thought of her makes him very happy indeed.
He leans forward, "So, here's the deal: you do as you said and put John in touch with whoever it is you're planning on putting him in touch with. Play along, you're not fighting the SI, so it's no big deal. Give him whatever he wants, whoever he wants. Are we clear on that?"
The Banu Haqim quickly nods, "Yes, yes." He looks up at the large crystal chandelier hanging above them and wonders how he let it all come to this. He wonders many things, mostly pertaining to himself and his interests.
He knows, deep down, that his guest is pulling the strings from behind the curtains.
The Viper strokes the emerald eyes on his snake head cane and compliments the aesthetic of the Vizier's Haven, "You've made quite a name for yourself, Mohammed."
Vizier Mohammed puffs his chest out and boasts, "Indeed! I built this Haven with my very own hands. Allah has been gracious to me." He nods at his guest, "As have you, oh great High Priest of Set."
Seth raises an eyebrow, "Oh? Well, heh, I'm glad you think that way. Don't you worry, Mr. Khan. When the time comes, when the Blade has outlived its usefulness to us, we'll be sure to make their end as...quick as possible. You'll see." He gives the Vizier a sinisterly reassuring smile.
The Vizier lets out a relieved sigh, "Thank you, oh great High Priest. As long as you are able to distinguish those who are of the Blade from those who are not. As Primogen for the Banu Haqim in this Domain, my loyalty has and will always be to you. I hope and pray that you remember this. Always."
Seth blandly says, "Don't worry. Those Assamites whose minds haven't been...infected by the Blade's fanatical teachings will be spared, but I can't make any guarantees. You know that the Blade's teachings are...contentious and attractive to certain kinds of people. So, don't blame me if I'm forced to take some drastic measures." His tone of voice is rather cold throughout all of this.
The Vizier lowers his head, "I know, I know. It is not that I disagree with all of the Blade's teachings- I myself am an advocate for the 2-State Solution- however, I must also concede that their zeal and devotion to their cause is...somewhat worrying." He's got that worried look about him.
Seth shrugs and snidely remarks, "I don't give a damn what's happening miles and miles away from us- it has no effect on us in any way, shape, or form. I don't concern myself with all that...political crap. It's not of great interest to me."
Of course he'd say something like that.
The High Priest goes on, "There was a time when I was being groomed to take on the mantle of political leadership in the town of my birth, but Typhon, it would seem, had other plans in store for me."
Vizier Mohammed queries, "Was it worth it?"
Seth lifts his chin and smugly says, "Oh, definitely."
He looks around and admires the finery of the Vizier's Haven, "Besides, if I were to be honest, I think I've done way better as High Priest of Set than I would've done as Mayor of a small town or patriarch of a political dynasty. Either way, Plaintry is in capable hands right now, or so I hear."
Vizier Mohammed stands up and clasps his hands together. He offers, "I have recently had some renovations done. Would you like to see them, Mr. Steale?"
Seth also gets up. He twirls his cane, "It would be my pleasure. Lead the way, Mr. Khan."
The Vizier does just that and boasts about how he remodeled and refurbished parts of the place. His pride and joy are the new rooms he had built that houses some of his antiques, "I've been collecting them for quite some time now, you see."
The Assamite Vizier has a very successful and lucrative business in antique trading. He deals mostly with relics from the MENA region. He's got everything from pottery and jars to furniture and jewelry.
He gestures to an impressionist painting on the wall and declares, "This was a piece I had commissioned a few months ago. A Toreador artist's rendition of the great and mighty Alamut!"
Seth is mildly impressed, "Alamut? Somewhere in Afghanistan, right?" he doesn't know (or care) much about the subject matter at hand, but he'll play along, anyway.
The Vizier pensively lowers his head, "I pray that I shall see Alamut. Even this painting and others like it cannot come close to the majesty of Alamut!"
He gets all dreamy and starts gesticulating wildly, "Imagine! The high towers, the winding stairs, the ancient books and tomes, the secret passageways, the sacred chambers, the--"
Seth nods along, staving off yawns, "Mm-hmm."
"--the power, the prestige, the glory!" the Banu Haqim Vizier excitedly finishes.
Seth has to hold his laughter in, "Well, I can imagine that it's very pretty and impressive. For now, however, let's stay focused on the task at hand. The squeaky wheel gets the grease: we use the Blade to get rid of the SI, after that we swiftly and quietly deal with whoever remains by ourselves. How's that sound?" he has a smirk on his face throughout all of this.
Vizier Mohammed snaps back to reality and clears his throat, "Yes. Th--This is a necessary plan. As long as you assure me that my fellow Assamites, those who have not been seduced and led astray by the Blade's teachings, remain unharmed and untouched by our machinations."
Seth steps into the Vizier's personal bubble, "As High Priest of the Ministry, as Typhon is my witness, I assure you that not a single hair on their head will be harmed." He puts his hand on the Vizier's shoulder and gives it a firm squeeze.
Almost too firm. Seth's expression conceals sinister intent that not even Mr. Khan can detect. He's playing a very dangerous game, and he has no idea how fucked he and his Clan are. He has essentially signed all their Final Death warrants.
Including his own, most likely. And that of Miss Kawasaki's.
Seth reminds the Assamite, "Whatever you do, you do not go near Svetlana. She's mine. Do you understand that?"
Vizier Mohammed gulps, "Forgive me if I overstep a boundary, Mr. Steale, but why the fixation on her?"
Seth chuckles, "I think I'm in love with her, Mr. Khan. It's a...wonderful a--and strange feeling. It's been a while since I've fe--felt this way." His tone of speaking is somewhat dreamy throughout all of this, but there's a hint of obsession to it as well.
The Vizier gently nods, "I see. Have you told her how you feel?"
"I've...hinted at it. She's a...a woman who's wrapped herself in this shroud of secrecy. And I want, more than anything in the world, to--to rip it off her and take a peek at what's inside. I'm sure it's beautiful, whatever it is. Her trauma, her past, her pain, or some secret she lugs around with her."
Nasty. Vile. Sickening!
Seth runs his hand along his cane, "I know that she's in my Unlife for a reason. I just can't put my finger on it just yet. I--I think I must be going mad because, you see, the closer I get to her, the more she...closes herself off from me, and the more I want to get closer to her..."
A sort of angry look overtakes his features. His eyes turn into slits once more, "It's that damn Sire of hers holding her back, holding her away from me. Even Paul is trying to have her to himself. I wouldn't even be surprised if that Scottish son of a bitch Tommy has tried to put his Repulsive hands all over my--my sweet Svetlana!"
He's getting worked up over things he's inventing in his head! This is madness! Paul is simply being friendly with Svetlana, as is Tommy. Neither man has any intention of laying with her!
He tries to calm himself down by taking some deep breaths through his lifeless lungs and forcing them out. He takes a moment to compose himself. He needs to focus on his grand plan.
Seth resumes his speech, "She's so shy, so timid, so bashful and reserved. I guess women from her part of the world are just naturally like that, y'know? Like helpless little angelic dolls. Damsels truly in distress."
Vizier Mohammed doesn't know what to say to any of this. He's completely taken aback by every word. He stands there in silence, waiting for his guest to finish. Spineless as he may be, he's not an obsessive sociopathic creep.
He offers some generic advice, "Why don't you...talk to her? Take her to a place that is nice. She may just need time. Understand her on her terms."
Seth lightly scoffs at this, "I tried asking her out- for a drive through the city- but all of this started happening and now I don't even know when she'll be free for that. Still, the last thing I want is for her to get hurt."
Vizier Mohammed gives the Viper a look, "In my most humble opinion, it is not quite healthy or wise for a man to be so...fixated on a woman. Especially if she does not express any interest in you."
The Serpent blithely replies, "It's not a matter of whether she's interested or not. When has that ever stopped anyone before?"
The Assamite is deeply disturbed by that. Sensing this is going nowhere, he bows his head and says, "Farewell, oh great High Priest of Apep the Serpent."
Seth gets the hint, strokes his cane, and follows him to the exit, "Ah, of course. It's usually me who's the one giving advice and hearing people come to me with their so-called 'problems'. I won't apologize for anything I said, Mr. Khan. I love Svetlana Bobrov, and I will make her mine...1 way or another."
The Banu Haqim Vizier hastily nods and quickens his pace, "Yes, yes, of course. If--if that is what you wish, then so be it. I, of course, will continue to support you and find common ground with the Ministry."
Seth smiles and says goodbye to the Assamite, "We'll speak again, very soon, Mr. Khan. Don't worry, we'll have this whole thing dealt with in no time. Just keep playing along. Be the grumpy ex-Primogen everyone now expects you to be, but remember, always and forevermore, you are my ally in this grand plan of ours. Remember that."
Vizier Mohammed lowers his head and repeats those words to himself.
Idiot.
At most, he's just another pawn who's gonna meet a very terrible end in the coming nights. Seth's not gonna stop his inevitable purge once the last Blade member has been destroyed. No, he wants EVERY single Assamite (save for Svetlana) turned to ash and blown into the wind, to be forgotten by the sands of time.
Literally every single Banu Haqim.
As Seth gets in his luxurious cream-colored sedan, that Malkavian's unhinged voice echoes in his head, "THE ASSAMITE! THE ASSAMITE! THE ASSAMITE WILL BE YOUR DOWNFALL!"
That particular Lunatic had walked in on Seth and his Sire, Rafael, in the middle of a ritual being conducted. Or, that's what it looked like, at least. In truth, Rafael had given his Childe his final test of his faith in Typhon.
Yes, that old crypt was the place where Seth Steale Diablerized Sybil. Seth rolls down the window and thinks back to that fateful night. It was decades ago...
Rafael's voice was as smooth and charming as ever, "My son, my Childe. We have worked so long and hard to wear her down and send her into this Torpid state."
Seth responded, "Y--Yes. We have, but you still haven't told me why, Rafael. Why do all this? What do we hope to gain from an Elder, especially one as powerful as her, in Torpor?"
Rafael chuckled, "You still have not pieced it together, Seth?"
"Pieced what together? We both agreed to wear her down, night after night, but you refuse to tell me what the endgame is! I--I'm sick of being in the dark! I'm sick of being led on like this!"
"Patience, my Childe. Patience. You will soon see what Typhon has in store for you...now, tell me, what are your thoughts on Amaranth, hmm?" a sinister smirk flashed across Rafael's face.

Rafael stroked his chin and chuckled, "You have finally figured it out! I'm surprised it took you this long. Tsk, tsk, tsk, I thought you were sharper than this, Seth."
The Viper glared at his Sire, "So you want to do it, then? You...you wanna D--Diablerize her? Is that why we wore her down and filled her head with all kinds of doubts about the future of our Clan and Kindred Society as a whole??"
Rafael sighed deeply and shook his head, "Oh, Seth. Even now, you fail to grasp and understand what is in front of you."
Seth gasped and his eyes widened in shock, "You--you want ME to Diablerize her?! She's an Elder and I'm still a Neonate; she'll take over my body and my mind! Are--are you crazy? Have you gone mad, Rafael? This plan is doomed to failure!"
Rafael gave him a very condescending look and a patronizing smile, "Oh, Seth. Why do you think we spent all those nights wearing her down and sowing the seeds of doubt into her heart and mind? Hmm? Do you think we broke her will for fun?"
Seth pieced some of it together, "Oh, so...so she won't be able to take over my heart or--or mind if I do go through with this. That's why we did what we did, to give me an advantage against her."
His Sire smiled, "Correct! Very good, Seth! Very good!"
He stepped forward and put his hands on his Childe's tense shoulders, "That's why I'm giving her to you. Consider this the final test of your faith in Typhon. If you can successfully Diablerize an Elder as powerful as Sybil, then you can do absolutely anything. Any. Thing."
Seth is snapped back to the present by some honking. A fast car zooms past him and some of the drivers behind start honking like maniacs. He curses under his breath and asks his Ghoul, "What was that?"
Edwin replies, "A street race of some kind, sir."
"Hmph. Great. Let's just get back home, Edwin."
The Ghoul faintly smiles, "As you wish, sir."
Back at the Vizier's grand mansion...
He's pacing about, hands behind his back, contemplating what he's gotten himself into. He prays that everything goes according to plan.
Whose plan, though?
Vizier Mohammed sits down on a nearby couch and dusts some lint off his garments. He sniffs and takes a moment to admire the beauty of his Haven.
He wistfully remarks, "Even the works of my hands cannot compare to the majesty of Alamut."
The Assamite walks to a room and finds Ms. Kawasaki sitting at a desk, writing out basic words that she has only recently learned how to spell. Things like "cat", "hat", "apple" and so on. Mr. Khan has taken it upon himself to teach his charge how to read and write in English.
He clears his throat and gently asks, "How goes the studies, Ms. Kawasaki?"

Vizier Mohammed covers his mouth with his hand, "Oh my! You were just a child!"
Ms. Kawasaki looks down and starts writing out more simple words. She repeats these words out loud, but there's a struggle, "CAT. HAT. APP-LE. Uh...what's this one?"
"Car."
"CAR."
Damn, just damn.
The Vizier sticks around to help his fellow Assamite with some more exercises and lessons. He offers her some advice on how to speak English better. He'll do whatever it takes to rectify the mistakes of the Web of Knives.
That's what he tells himself, at least.
After a while, he takes his leave and goes for a stroll around his mansion. He wants to be alone with his thoughts. As he walks along a row trimmed hedges and topiary, he feels a cold chill run down his spine.
He knows that the very foundation of his large Haven is the body of his Sire, Aamir. After Mohammed Diablerized Aamir, he expected the latter's corpse to break down and fade away into nothingness, leaving nothing but ashes behind.
It didn't happen.
Instead, Aamir's corpse remains, stubborn as ever. Even after all these decades, his corpse is in some kind of Torpid/Not-Torpid state. Usually, when vamps are destroyed, they crumble and turn to ash, no exceptions.
But Aamir's corpse has remained and doesn't break down at all. This has left Mohammed quite disturbed. Of course, Banu Haqim have a thing for Diablerie, but if anyone found out what Mr. Khan had done, it would be his head rolling down the steps.
Aamir had quite a strong sense of right and wrong and wasn't a fan of his Childe's spinelessness and bootlicking tendencies. So, Mohammed and his Ghouls staked Aamir.
After the Diablerie had concluded, they had all hoped that the body would turn to ash. Instead, it lay there, completely still, and didn't rot or break down. Even though it's been decades since the sordid deed was done, it's almost as if Aamir is "alive" and well, merely deep in his Torpor.
So, Vizier Mohammed decided to bury the old and heavyset guy deep in the foundations of the place that'd become his grand mansion. After that, he began to remodel and redecorate the mansion over the years.
He thought that Aamir's corpse would've turned to dust by now. But alas, here they both are. So long as no nosy Auspex user comes poking around, everything should be as peachy and fine as can be.
The Vizier sighs deeply and returns to his mansion. He walks up some stairs to 1 of his many studies and sits down at his desk. He looks out the window at the moon and asks himself, "What have I gotten myself into? I do hope that the High Priest is a man of his word."
The Assamite will soon find out that such is not the case with somebody like Seth Steale.
The Vizier gets a sinking feeling in his chest and spends the rest of his night reading some old tomes about Alamut and its many ancient artifacts. He wants to be prepared for whatever may come his way.
(He got that particular book he's reading from an Awakened Mage in a bookstore in Bahrain).
Seth eventually returns to his Haven. Edwin parks the car and follows his Domitor inside. They both enter a room, and Edwin flips the light switches. The lights come on, very dimly (as they should be).
Seth plops down on his couch and exhales sharply. That Malkavian and his words keep echoing in his mind, but he dismisses it all as the meaningless ramblings of an unhinged Seer who probably didn't even know what he was talking about.
Is Svetlana that Assamite? Is she the one who's gonna be the High Priest's downfall?
The Typhonist dismisses this lingering thought with extreme prejudice, "NO! She--she's not the one. It has to be John. Yeah, it has to be him. So, that's why I gotta get rid of him. Then, Svetlana will need someone to comfort her- a shoulder to cry on, a rock to lean on. She'll need someone to take her in and keep her safe..."

Edwin has been standing in silence for several minutes now.

Seth is hit with some light from the screen and blinks rapidly. He then logs in to his Hunter-net.org account.

Seth's limerence towards Svetlana is growing and growing by the unsettling second. He's starting to act in ways he never would've thought possible. He's going to do whatever it takes to have her and make her his own.
There's no turning back now.
Oh, dear.
John goes back to Abdullah's Haven with some cardboard boxes he got from a nearby convenience store. It's a bit chilly outside, but the inside of Abdullah's Haven does feel quite a bit musty and dry.
He puts all of the departed Blood Sorcerer's stuff away in those boxes, tapes them up, and then carries them outside, where he puts them into a vehicle that he spent extra money to rent for the night.
Margot accosts the Assamite and sternly demands, "Your friend owes me money, and we need to settle this."
John looks at her and his shoulders slump, "Fine, fine, OK, but you get the deposit back, right?"
The Ventrue landlady evasively replies, "Not necessarily." She goes on some legalese tangent and uses some confusing terms. It's obvious that she's trying to screw him over, but he's got no other choice but to play along.
By the end of it all, he rolls his eyes and says, "Hmph. Fine. Gimme...a couple of nights and you'll have your fucking money."
Satisfied, she raises her chin and walks off to shakedown someone else.
John picks up a box and faintly mutters, "Bitch."
"I heard that."
"Hmph," John scoffs and loads the last of his friend's things in the trunk of the car. He gets it and tells the driver to get going. They head off and John checks the time on his phone.
At this time of night, the city is still crawling with life and people (of the mortal variety, but you never know). The neon lights of the buildings are bright, palm trees sway in the wind, and the sounds of music and traffic can be heard in the distance.
Throngs of mortals go about, totally unaware of the bloodsuckers (and other supernatural beings) that "live" amongst them. John watches the city go by, the new position of Primogen for his Clan already weighing heavily on his mind.
However, he now has the ear of all the Assamites who are not affiliated with the Blade of Haqim. If he can get them onboard in this fight, then they'd all have a better chance at succeeding.
The speedy Assamite whispers to himself, "Fingers crossed."
Once back in his industrial-style loft apartment, Mr. Suarez begins to take the boxes (1 by 1) up to his Haven. The taxi driver, a kind Sri Lankan man, offers to help, but John insists that he can do it.
The Assamite puts the boxes in his living room and goes back downstairs to pay the taxi driver. He gives the driver his money and tips him a few dirhams, which is sincerely appreciated.
The taxi driver bows his head, smiles widely, and waves as he drives off. John, satisfied with the outcome, sighs, "I know money's tight right now, but I couldn't let Abdullah's stuff get thrown away."
His phone vibrates and he checks to see a text message from his boss, Praveen: "Hello, john. Hope all is well. U free 2moro 2 do private Kenpo training for someone. Real bloody VIP here, bhai! A Sheikh's son!!!"
John's clenches his jaw and winces slightly. He goes over a few messages to send as way of response, but he erases them as quickly as he had typed them out.
Finally, he sends the reply: "Unfortunately, I can't. I have a very important appointment tomorrow. Im sorry, Master-P."
Praveen responds with some angry face emojis and asks: "Cant u reschedule whatever it is? arey, john, this is once in bloody lifetime opportunity. You wont get like this again."
John tenses his facial muscles and types back: "You think I don't know that?? But this is important, OK? You have others, send them."
Master-P texts back after a few moments: "YOLO, John. You Only Live Once. You are throwing your life away on all kinds of bloody nonsense, yaar. When u come back, we have 2 have srs discussion abt ur future here @ the dojo- it is NOT looking too brite."
John can't help but chuckle, considering that he's older (in total cumulative years) to his boss and his boss's parents, most likely.
He shakes his head and his fingers glide across the touchscreen keyboard: "I am not throwing my life away, OK? You're not getting rid of me that easily. I just need time 2 sort out some stuff. Once done, I'll be back at the dojo. Truth is, I love Kenpo, I love teaching it, I love doing it."
"OK, fine. But this is the last time. I cannot keep doing like this with you. U should not waste ur life like this, yaar. You're almost 40 now, no? u r not getting any younger, habibi."
John snickers, knowing full well that he'll always remain forever in his 30s while Praveen will all grow old and wither away as time steadily marches on.
As smug as he might've once felt, that thought is now a sobering reminder of the downsides of Unlife- others around you WILL fade away while the Kindred essentially remain "frozen in time".
After a few seconds, John texts back: "I know that. Im sorry for this, Praveen, but it's just the way things are right now. PLS try 2 understand."
"Even my patience has its limits, Mr. suarez. Do not expect me 2 be soooo understanding the next time, bhai. I am worried abt you, John."
John sighs deeply and looks off into the distance and says, "Yeah, I'm worried, too."
His fingers go across the virtual keyboard: "I promise to make it up 2 you, Master-P. And I will come back to the dojo soon. No more excuses, no more delays. Until then, pls try to manage w/o me."
Praveen's response comes in swiftly: "U have a few days to get your things sorted out. if u fail to return by then, I will hv no choice but to let you go."
The Assamite Primogen clicks his tongue and lowers his head. Being out of a job in a city such as Al-Kushraf isn't exactly ideal, but he'll just have to deal with it.
He taps out a response: "Understood. Im sorry."
"OK. Goodnight, Mr. suarez."
John puts his phone back and proceeds to arrange the boxes of Abdullah's things into neat piles in a sparsely furnished corner of his Haven.
He's still in the process of decorating the place, but the industrial-loft style does suit him. It's good enough for his needs. Rent's a bit high (reasons), but what else is new?
After a while, John sits back on his bed. His head is thrown against the pillows, and his eyes are closed. His earphones are plugged deep into his ears, blasting the velvety voice of Kristin Mainhart straight into his ears.
He lazily moves his head and hums. As he's doing so, he recalls a conversation he had with Abdullah when he was just new to Dubai. John had decided he'd had enough of the reactionary cesspool that was (and still is) America.
He had a myriad of reasons for wanting to leave the US of A.
(To be fair, it was the 1990s. And that decade was fucking awful. Terrible, even!)
He smuggled himself onto whatever flight was heading towards the United Arab Emirates. It wasn't easy, but he managed. Security was quite lax back then and John was quite fast.
John was expecting Banu Haqim, but he wasn't expecting many of them to be of the Blade, like himself. Abdullah and he soon became good friends.
1 night, as the 2 vampires were walking alongside a pier near the beach, they'd talked about the future and what it held. They also talked about the role of the Kindred in bringing about a better world for all.
Abdullah did a wide gesture to the dark sky above, "I dream of a better world, John. A better world for all, Kindred and mortal alike. As Banu Haqim, we are capable of bringing it about through our deeds and actions, are we not, habibi?"
John had his hands in his pockets and stopped in his tracks, "I uh...I guess so, yeah. They um...don't call us 'Judges' and 'Mediators' for nothing, I suppose. We should be able to change the world, Abdullah, and we will. We could, it's just a matter of..."
"Yes?"
"Getting things done. Bringing it about, if you will. I want the world to be a better place, too. Hell, I'm sure almost everyone around us wants the same thing, too. Well, I hope that's what they dream about as well."
Abdullah softly chuckled, "Yes, then it is a matter of...perspective, is it not? The mortals might not necessarily see the way things we Kindred do, so someone must guide them. Gently and kindly, of course."
John looked over at his friend, "Is it our job to show them the way? We might be great at fighting, but teaching, leading, nurturing, and guiding? I feel that's someone else's job, Abdullah. I'm not entirely sure our Clan is cut out for that sorta thing, y'know?"
"Hm. Perhaps you are correct, my friend. Perhaps there is someone else who will enlighten the mortals and show them where they err. Somebody, maybe, who's willing to sacrifice themselves for a greater good."
John's eyebrows shot up, "Well, when you put it like that, sure. I wanna see that future come true, Abdullah. It's better than whatever we're currently staring at now, lemme tell you that much. Anyway, let's go."
The Blood Sorcerer nodded and the 2 walked along the pier, enjoying the somewhat pleasant breeze of the cold night. That was years ago, prior to Svetlana's Embrace.
Back to the Vizier...
Mr. Khan is relaxing on his lavish bed. His bedroom is large and spacious. The bed is big and very soft. His dresser is said to be made of a type of wood that no mortal has ever seen before.
He's going through an old photo album that he keeps under his pillows. He sees his Sire, Aamir, surrounded by so many orphaned children. They look so happy as this dark-skinned heavyset old man with a long gray beard brings some cheer to the lives of these poor kids.
For a vampire, he always had quite a cheery disposition, sorta like an Arabian Santa Claus. A kid even called him that once, and he chortled and went along with it.
Vizier Mohammed feels guilt-stricken for what he did to his own Sire- he didn't just Diablerize the poor guy, he erased the little joy he brought to these poor orphans by demolishing the orphanage (through forged papers citing non-existent safety hazards) and getting the place torn down.
Soon after, the Vizier began to build his mansion (the very one he's extravagantly living in right now) on the rubble of that place. That's how it all started.
Aamir caught wind of his Childe's inhuman treachery, so Mohammed had no other choice but to silence the old man and make the body disappear.
He closes the photo album and shoves it under the pillows. He lays down on his back and lets out a long, low exhale, "I--I'm so sorry, Aamir. I do not know why your body refuses to decompose, even after all these years. Is it Allah's way of punishing me for Diablerizing you?"
The Assamite stares up at the ceiling, "For what I did to your beloved orphanage? Those children were hopeless, Aamir. You only made them feel happy for a few moments. The rest of their days were miserable, so what was the point in any of it, hmm?"
The Vizier gets off the bed and walks over to the window. He cracks the curtains slightly, looks out, and then closes them again. He makes sure that they're all locked and double-checked. Can't have a single ray of the approaching sun coming through!
He says to himself, "I should not regret my actions. Allah has blessed me and brought great prosperity and wealth...if only you could see me now, Aamir. It is unfortunate that you will never live to see what Alamut will become very soon. So many new discoveries will be made, and the Banu Haqim will be its heroes and pioneers."
The Assamite sits back down on the bed and clasps his hands together. His lips quiver, "You would've been so proud if--if only you weren't so short-sighted and stubborn. Tch."
He lies back down, but his body is tense, and he can't get himself to relax. He doesn't deserve relaxation. Most of those orphans wound up slipping through the cracks and some of them even starved to death, and for what? A big-ass mansion?
It's not enough, though. It's never enough for these kinds of people.
"Allah is kind, Aamir. He forgives, I know he does. He will forgive me, too, yes, I know he will. I--I should not feel ashamed for--for what I did. In a way, it also benefits our Clan."
He refuses to elaborate on how his fancy Haven benefits anyone except himself and maybe Miss Kawasaki, who is given her own room in another wing of the mansion. It's quite small.
The Vizier's eyes are droopy and he yawns, "I--I will rest now. There was no other option. I had to make Aamir disappear, otherwise the others would start to get suspicious. At least they have stopped asking about him now. Good."
Moments later, the sun begins its grand ascent over the horizon. As the rising sun begins to hit the windowsill, the Vizier is fast asleep. And yet, his nightmares continue nagging away at him.
He remembers that gray thawb that his Sire was wearing when he was buried deep in the foundations of his mansion. Aamir frequently wore that along with his checkered ghutrah, which was wrapped around his head.
Once the sun has risen, the Kindred in this corner of the globe fully succumb to the lulling pull of the day-sleep. Some "sleep" easier than others in this gilded cage of a city.
Chapter 19: Slasher- Part 1
The sun mercilessly beams down on the city below. People in this city are still reeling from the chaotic and violent events of the past few nights (as far they're aware of it). The destruction of the Marjan Tower is still heavy on the minds of many, as are a few other events.
But no one can (or should) be permitted to draw connections between these events, and if they were to, vampires certainly cannot be suspected.
It's a really hot day outside. The news has moved on from the tragedy (they weren't too interested in it to begin with). Some people have moved on as well. Others continue to mourn the many losses.
A comprehensive body count is yet to be provided by the Emirati authorities, but one shouldn't hold one's breath.
Vehicles roll on the paved roads, traffic builds up as the clock ticks closer and closer to afternoon, and a few people sit on their balconies, basking in the light of the sun.
A warm and sultry wind blows over the city. The sounds of the busy streets can be heard all around- honking horns, screeching tires, a cacophony of conversations, vendors hawking their wares to tourists, and the like.
Just another day in Ersatz Dubai. The tall towers of glass and steel pierce the sky above and reflect the bright rays of the sun. Afternoon eventually gives way to evening and the sun begins its slow and steady descent.
As soon as that great ball of fire has set, the Kindred begin to stir awake from their day-sleep. Their Beasts, rife with insatiable Hunger, rouse them from their day-long slumbering.
Svetlana wakes up in her room. Her eyes pop wide open and she springs up from her bed. Her room feels very dry and stuffy, the fan above spins but does not provide any relief. It's quite hot inside. She forces some deep breaths.
Despite being asleep for many hours on end, her back is sore, and she feels like she's been tossing, twitching, and turning all day. A few horrid memories haunt her mind- particularly of that time she was raped when she was just 18.
She feels those strong and hairy hands holding her down and removing her clothing. She doesn't want to think about it, but she can't stop herself. The pain and humiliation are overwhelming.
The Assamite shakes her head a few times and puts her hands over her face, "No! No! No! Is in the past. I--I am safe here. They cannot hurt me, he--he cannot hurt me."
After a while, she stops trembling, takes a quick shower, and gets dressed. Tonight, she dresses for work and not combat. She puts on a knee-length bodycon dress, white flats, and a brown-colored scarf. The scarf is loosely draped around her neck, and the ends are wrapped around her left arm.
She brushes her hair a bit and makes sure that it's well-combed and neat. She needs the work more than anything else right now- John can meet with whoever to discuss the next steps to be taken against the Second Inquisition menace. Until then, she's gotta work and keep her head down.
After all the rather brutal fighting over these past few nights, babysitting some lil kids, Svetlana could use that time away to bring her Humanity back up a little. That's not a bad idea, all things considered.
Even if she is stabbing the shit out of fascists who absolutely deserve it, she's gotta remember that she's still a human being. Of course, one could endlessly debate on whether killing such cretin diminishes one's Humanity, but that's beside the point.
The Assamite Neonate leaves her Haven, but as soon as she steps out, she hears some rustling noises in the living room. Little Chloe's Wraith giggles and flickers in and out. It's as if it's teasing her Fetter, trying to get her attention.
Svetlana sighs deeply, "Chloe. Chloe, I am busy, OK?"
"Setlana! Setlana! Come play with me! You don't want to play with meeeeee! Weeee, come see! Come help find me Barbie!"
Svetlana feels a little drained. Her body hurts and her mind aches. She feels so horrible seeing this long-gone child float and whoosh around like nothing had ever happened.
The Assamite's lips quiver and she says, "Go and hide. I will...find you later." That usually seems to work with the kid.
The ghostly little girl vanishes from sight, her giggling growing fainter and fainter. Svetlana is left alone. She breathes out through her nostrils and decides to look for a suitable neck to chomp down on.
She's gotta keep her Beast at bay. Her thoughts are far too muddled and grim to focus on anything EXCEPT for satiation of the bloodiest variety. Once she exits her apartment building, she spots a few potential candidates.
Her Hunger incessantly gnaws at her as she scans the crowd for an early(ish) dinner. After a while, she spies a young woman who is wearing a green hijab, a black blouse, and some baggy pants. Her brown skin is flushed pink and sweaty, and her clothes are stained with a bit of perspiration.
She turns to a corner and, with trembling hands, brings a lit-up cigarette to her mouth. She takes a long drag and exhales. The woman then takes another drag and coughs. The smoke swirls around her head.
Svetlana approaches, keeping her head low. She ducks behind a dumpster and looks over her shoulder to make sure that no one is looking. The Assamite draws near, and the young woman looks around in a panic.
Svetlana tiptoes towards her and lunges forward, fangs already out. She yanks that chick's sweaty neck to the side and sinks her sharp fangs into her skin. The young woman lets out a muffled whimper, and her limbs flail as the Assamite feeds on her.
Blood fills the Neonate's hungry mouth. The eternal Beast within compels her to finish this poor mortal off, but Svetlana resists the inhuman urge and pulls away once she's taken what is required.
She drinks in the warmth of her victim's blood. It's been a while since she's last drank, and the feeling is rather comforting. This woman's blood is rather thick and has a tangy, salty taste.
Once done, the woman's eyes glaze over and her body goes limp. Svetlana licks the wound shut, checks for a pulse (faint but there), and leaves her near the dumpster. She props the woman's back against it and looks at her with a pained expression.
The Neonate softly whispers, "I am so sorry." She shakes her head and quickly leaves the woman behind.
The Assassin has got her 1st client for tonight- a working mother of 1. She's a young woman, probably in her 30s. She works as a HR manager for a large firm, but even then, her pay is rather meager.
So, she moonlights as a freelance photographer. Her child is a 7-year-old who talks with a slight lisp. The mortal and Svetlana already agreed on the payment for this evening's work.
The woman says she'll be back after about 3 hours, so Svetlana makes herself "at home" and watches this little boy. After about an hour, she goes to the kitchen and makes him some chicken nuggets from a packet.
When the stove's flames come on, her Rötschreck momentarily triggers. She quickly shakes her head and returns to her senses. She sprinkles the chicken nuggets with some seasoning, waits for the oil to get hot, and fries them up.
The boy is sitting at the table and coloring a picture. He has his tongue poking out as he's intently focusing on his work. Svetlana looks over his shoulder and sees that he's drawing a bunch of smiling faces.
After a few minutes, she plates the nuggies and gives it to the kid, who is now standing up and waiting with a big smile. He takes a bite, and his eyes light up. That says everything.
The Assamite sits across from him and smiles warmly. He devours all of those nuggets, and all she can think about is how she herself can no longer partake in mortal food and drink- even something as simple and mundane as fried chicken nuggets.
Svetlana can only imagine what that might taste like, or even what a freshly made cup of coffee would taste like. Vanilla ice cream, mayhaps? No, it's blood and nothing but blood for all eternity.
After the kid's done, Svetlana takes him to the bathroom to wash his hands. She cleans his mouth with a towel and pats him on the head. He's not much of a talker. The boy goes back to his activities, and the vampire returns to the kitchen.
Svetlana washes her hands and puts the dishes in the dishwasher. As she's doing so, the little boy comes back out, and he holds a toy truck.
The Assamite looks down at him and asks, "Yes, malen'kiy?"
The small child makes "vroom vroom brah brah" noises at her and scoots off without saying a word. Svetlana just smiles, amused.
She checks her phone and sees that a few messages have come in from her other clients for the night. Her eyes narrow, and she looks over to see what's being said.
They remind her to be on time and give her last-minute instructions about any peculiarities that they (or their kids) might have. These clients have no clue what Svetlana is, and it is best that it's kept that way.
Svetlana shakes her head and replies that she'll be there soon.
Eventually, the little boy's mum returns. She looks really flustered and a thin sheen of sweat is visible on her forehead. The woman goes and checks on the boy, and she gives him a big hug.
She gives her child a big kiss on the cheek and says, "I'm so sorry I'm late, bunny."
Svetlana smiles and remarks, "He was good. No issue. I made for him food, like you said."
"You're an angel. Gimme a moment and I'll be with you shortly, yes?"
Svetlana bows her head slightly and picks up her purse, "Da. I will wait outside."
After a minute, the mortal returns with the agreed-upon amount of dirhams. It's quite pitiful, all things considered, but it's better than nothing. She herself understands this and says, "It's all I can afford at the moment, Svetlana."
Svetlana forces a smile and puts the money in her purse, and the 2 women exchange pleasantries. Svetlana goes to the bus stop and silently waits, sitting on a bench. She looks up at the moon and sighs softly.
She's gotta meet a few more clients, watch their kids, and earn some more cash for tonight. The more dirhams, the better. Even though the pay is rather shitty, the work itself is actually kinda enjoyable.
And that's how the Banu Haqim Neonate's night goes- going from house to house (usually middle-class types) and looking after a bunch of children. Some kids are boisterous whilst others doze off before 10 PM.
A mixed bag, all in all. The pay's not so great and the reasons of the parents usually vary from reasonable (not having much) to petty and absurd (you're a foreigner).
The Assamite does her babysitting work diligently and efficiently. She makes sure that the kids are fed and watched over. She does so with a kind hand, gentle heart, and empathetic eyes.
She does the absolute best that she can, and most of the parents appreciate it. Some remain ambivalent and feel "off" around her, and others simply don't give a fuck. They just need someone, literally anyone it would seem, to watch their many kids while they're out partaying or whatever.
Meanwhile...
John has already gotten the contact info for this person he's supposed to be meeting with tonight. Her name is Mnar and she lives a few kilometers away from John's Haven.
It's already 9 PM, and the Assamite is getting ready to leave. He takes a hot shower and changes into some proper clothes (he was out for a jog). He's wearing a dark jacket, denims, and loafers.
The man fixes his hair and heads off. He checks the route on his phone and heads out, walking briskly down the busy streets. The city is alive at this time of night. Streetlights bathe the streets in their orange glow.
Gaggles of warm bodies rush past him. He walks with his eyes forward. There are all kinds of people on these streets. A few performers sing some Arabic pop songs whilst others clap and dance to the beats.
There are a few street vendors selling a variety of different food items. They have a whole range of cuisine, from Indian to Chinese to Vietnamese. A few food trucks dot the streets, offering up tasty scran to the nightlife crowds.
John keeps his eyes peeled. He's aware that his enemies know his name and how he looks. He keeps his head low and walks fast, but not too fast, of course.
As he's walking, he passes by a group of baggy-eyed immigrant workers wearing hi-vis vests. They're going about their business, doing whatever they can to survive in this unforgiving city.
These workers are some of the most vulnerable people in this city, and the Emirati authorities (amongst others) are very good at taking advantage of them. John can't help but feel pity for them.
After a while of brisk walking, the Assamite spots a woman sitting by the curb and she's playing with a small child. She coos to the child and speaks to him in Arabic.
The child sees John and gasps softly. He points his trembling finger at the vampire and starts crying. The woman, surprised, stands up and clutches her child.
John, startled, asks, "Whoa, hey...you OK?"
She says in a shaky voice, "Yes--yes."
The child cries loudly and kicks and screams as his mother takes him away from the Assamite. John sighs and shakes his head.
He continues walking. The hustle and bustle of the city fill his ears, and the hot wind gently blows across his face.
His thoughts go back to Abdullah. That video of the Blood Sorcerer being obliterated by the shining sun still haunts his mind. He's reminded of his own past and his many regrets, but he can't afford to wallow in those emotions now.
The Assamite keeps on going until he reaches a residential area. Apartment buildings climb the sky, and they look rather cozy and inviting. He sees a lot of families around here, pushing strollers, sitting on the astroturf and chilling, or chatting as they're enjoying their evening meal.
It's a seemingly nice atmosphere, all in all.
Eventually, he finds himself in front of a 4-story service apartment building. It's a nice place. Cars are parked on the ground floor, there's a humming generator nearby, and some of the windows are well-lit.
A watchman is sitting on a scuffed plastic chair. He looks at John from head to toe and asks, "Name?"
The Assamite nods and takes a good look around, "Mnar? Is she here?"
"Name?"
"John."
The watchman vaguely gestures, "4th floor. Apartment A40. Elevator not working, use stairs."
John curtly nods, "Thanks."
"Hmm."
As John is climbing up the stairs, he takes a look around the place- beige walls, white tiled flooring, and about a dozen potted plants scattered here and there. No wear and tear, no marks or any kinds of graffiti.
A few couples sit on the benches, enjoying each other's company. A few kids are playing a card game. John's legs quickly carry him up the flights of stairs. He's eager to meet with this Mnar person, but he's also somewhat afraid of what she might be like.
He reaches the 4th floor and spots apartment A40. It's near the end of the bright hallway. John checks his clothes and squares his shoulders. He takes a deep breath, and walks to the door labeled "A40" in golden letters.
He hears some faint, hurried footsteps and a muffled voice from another apartment. He rings the doorbell and waits.
No answer.
The Assamite bites his lower lip and nervously looks around. He rings the doorbell again, but no answer. John waits a few seconds, rings it again, and then waits.
He then knocks on the door. Nothing.
The Assamite taps his foot and grunts faintly, "What the hell is going on? Where is she?"
He knocks and calls out, "I'm here to see a Mnar!"
The door slowly opens, and someone peeks out. She's wearing a dress and a headscarf. The woman's skin is pale, and her chocolate brown eyes are darting back and forth.
She asks, "Yes?"
"Mnar? We have a lot to talk about."
Mnar unchains the door, and she ushers John in. He walks into her Haven.
John gets a good look at his fellow Assamite. She's in her late-30s and very pale. Her face is round and full. She's got a faint scar on her chin and a beauty spot near her right cheek.
She's wearing some lip gloss and some mascara. She's got some bags under her eyes.
Mnar's Haven is a rather nice place. It's a bit stuffy, and the air is a bit musty, but it's comfortable and looks to be well-furnished. There are a TON of books scattered about, piled on top of each other. Some incense sticks are burning.
The lighting is dim and there's a haze in the air.
Mnar regards her fellow Banu Haqim with narrowed eyes. She sees him looking all around her Haven.
John presses his lips into a thin line and remarks, "It's a nice place you got here, Mnar."
"Yes," Mnar says as she continues to watch John like a hawk, studying and gauging his every move.
"We should talk," John says with a slight nod.
The woman raises a brow, "Indeed. We must. This way," she ushers him to a room in the back.
She goes in, and John follows after her. It's her bedroom. She has a queen-size bed, a desk, an office chair, a radio, and some books on the floor. Some tomes are scattered on her giant oak desk as well.
There are pens and other writing implements on the table. The air smells of dust and mustiness. It's clear that this room is where Mnar spends a majority of her time.
John glances around, and Mnar watches him take it all in. He sees that she's in the middle of...translating (by hand) an old-looking book into Arabic. She was in the middle of doing so when he popped in.
She goes over and closes the book, placing a piece of cloth over the pages. John clears his throat and tries to find a seat amidst all this scholarly clutter. Mnar's expression is blank, and her eyes are emotionless as she watches John nervously look around for somewhere to sit.
She dryly gestures to the bed while she sits in her desk chair.
The Assamite smiles and thanks her. He plops himself down on her bed and winces at how hard the mattress feels against his ass. He crosses his legs, and Mnar watches him do that.
"So," John begins, "you um...already know why I'm here and who I am, right?"
Mnar blandly says, "Tell me in your own words." She folds her hands on her lap and cocks her head just a tad.
"I'm your new Primogen."
Mnar has no exaggerated reaction to that information; she keeps her composure and stares blankly at John.
John sighs softly and continues, "Last night, I uh...took 'power' from Vizier Mohammed Khan. I challenged him for this position, and he easily gave it up without so much as a fuss. I wasn't expecting him to go down that...easily, I guess."
Mnar's expression remains passive and she's quiet.
John takes this as his cue to continue, "He's a real piece of work, y'know. Yeah."
Mnar queries, "Why did you do what you did, Mr. Suarez?"
John's face tics and he forces a mild chuckle, "Ah, you know my name, huh? Well, I did it because we need people, we need help, to get rid of the SI in this Domain. Our current numbers just weren't enough, and we've already lost quite a few."
"I have heard. I am sorry for your losses. They were of our Blood as well."
"Mm-hmm. They sure were. With the Vizier out of the way, I can now take on his duties and hopefully rally the rest of our Clan to come to our cause. I mean, I'm not asking any of you to take a pledge to the Blade of Haqim or anything like that, but you can at least try to make yourself more useful to us in this fight- we can't do it by ourselves."
Mnar's eyes are sharp, and they're focused on John.
John licks his lips and continues, "I--I mean, we tried doing it with who we had, but these Zionist thugs have a helluva lot more firepower and technological prowess than we expected. If we can't bring about a change, then what IS the point in doing any of this? What's the point in any of this, right, Mnar?"
John's expression grows dark, "I wanna Judge them and I wanna Judge them all. I take it you're aware of the Blade of Haqim. I don't know if we have time for a history--"
Mnar holds up her hand and plainly says, "I am aware of the Blade of Haqim, Mr. Suarez. I know much about their teachings, their founding members, their deeds, and their intentions. I have been researching their history for a long time now."
John blinks and incredulously asks, "Whoa, really? How do you know about all of that?"
Mnar gets up and goes to retrieve a book from a large cupboard. It's an old-looking book, quite thick. It's a yellowish-mustard color and it's bound with a faded brown leather.
She wordlessly hands the book to John and motions for him to open it. He warily does so, feeling the roughness of the thick pages as he turns them. The book's cover is in English and reads: "THE BOOK OF THE BLADE".
The Assamite looks at Mnar and asks, "What--what is this?"
Mnar answers, "Something I have been working on for decades now. I believe to be a comprehensive and objective history of the Blade of Haqim, from its founding shortly after the 1948 Nakba. It is the story of their struggles against the Hebrew state amongst other things."
John nods along, "OK, wow. That's something, I guess? You said you've been on this for decades? The Blade, from my understanding, doesn't write stuff down or give interviews, so how'd you manage to write all this stuff, huh?"
"I am very good at what I do, Mr. Suarez. I have my ways."
"Hmm, I see. And you don't think that writing this stuff down is a breach of the Masquerade? If anyone were to get ahold of this, it'd be the end of not just the Blade but all of Kindred Society."
Mnar faintly chuckles, "Such hyperbole remarks do not suit you, John. I have done my research and made sure that none of my writings will ever fall into the hands of the uninitiated or unenlightened. I am very thorough and quite meticulous; you have nothing to worry about."
John's eyebrows shoot up momentarily, and he goes through the book some more. He notices a list of names of some of the founders of the Blade of Haqim- there's Fatima Ibn Rashid (his Sire), the Mubarak brothers (Salim and Malik), and Dr. George Fateh (John's mentor and friend).
There are a few other names, some of which have a huge red X right next to them, and others have question marks and illegible scribbling.
John points to some of the names and asks, "Do you know who these people are?"
"Of course I do. They are the founders of the Blade of Haqim. Why?"
John offers, "Fatima, she's my Sire. I know Dr. George as well. He mentored me."
Mnar nods and purses her lips, "I see." She gets up and produces what looks like written correspondence between herself and Dr. George. John gasps in surprise, and Mnar motions for him to read the letter out loud.
It was sent a few nights back and the postal code indicates that it came from Magnolia City, USA! The old man's still back there, huh?
John looks over the letter, clears his throat, and reads it, "My dear, esteemed Mnar. Our correspondence has been quite pleasurable. Your questions regarding the nature of the Blade are most thoughtful and insightful. However, the answer to your last query is that the Blade's existence is an extension of the Banu Haqim's mission and purpose."
John pauses and reads on: "What greater injustice is there in the contemporary world than the injustice faced by the Palestinian people? For decades, my people have suffered under the boot of Zionist depravity- shameless, cowardly, and heinous atrocities against the poor, the displaced, the orphaned, the weak. The very concept of Humanity itself is being destroyed and eroded by these evildoers. The world should be appalled!"
John nods along and sniffs, getting emotional when reading the words of the man who taught him so much, "We will not rest until we have Judged the unjust- that is the mandate of the Blade. Of course, there is also the issue of the False Assamites- the Bnei HaShem- but we have already discussed that in our other letters."
John sighs and keeps reading, "Please, continue to study the subject, and the answers will reveal themselves, I assure you. I also look forward to your next letter. Until then, I will be unavailable for a while. I have something urgent that I have to see to. It concerns our mandate. I look forward to hearing from you again. Yours truly, Doctor George Fateh."
John folds the letter and sharply exhales, eyes slightly wide. Mnar has a calm and composed expression as she watches the man before her.
John shakes his head and cracks a small smile, "Ah, so the old man's still in Magnolia City, huh? Well, good for him. He liked that place a lot, y'know."
Mnar nods a little, "Yes, he speaks highly of that city. Not as high as he speaks of you, though, Mr. Suarez."
The Assamite's lips part slightly and he replies, "Oh, really? What did he have to uh...uh...say about me?"
Mnar hands him a thick stack of folded letters, "I have already made the necessary copies. Take it and read through them in your own time. Some things about you are not flattering, but he says that you changed since your misdeeds. He hopes that such is the case."
John's expression tightens and he lowers his head while he's thumbing through the letters, "I--I see."
He then asks, "In your next letter, you think you could say 'hi' on my behalf, y'know let the old man know that I'm doing well, fighting the good fight, all of that?"
Mnar stolidly says, "I will see what I can do."
John politely thanks her, "Thanks. So, you seem to know a bit about me. If we're gonna be working together, I'd like to know a bit about you. I mean, it's only fair, right?"
Mnar nods, "You are right, Mr. Suarez. It is fair. Very well, then...I hail from what is now known as the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. I was initially Embraced by an Antitribu, do not ask when. My contact with my Sire is limited and scholarly in nature."
She stops to let him take it all in, and John remarks, "Oof. Antitribu, huh? That's Sabbat, right--"
Mnar holds up her hand and states, "Whatever you might think of the Sabbat, Mr. Suarez, they are not necessarily the monsters that the Camarilla paints them as. Yes, there are some who are given over to their Beasts, but that is true of all the Sects."
"I see. But you're like...totally 'in' with the Camarilla, right?"
Mnar replies, "My allegiance is to knowledge and the dissemination of it to our people. The Eternal Struggle of the Sects means very little to me or my extensive research. I have no stake or interest in it, unless it pertains to my scholarly endeavors."
John blinks and scratches his head, "OK, OK. So, you're not with the Sabbat or the Camarilla. What about the Anarchs?"
Mnar scoffs lightly, "Tch. Their presence in these lands is insignificant. I know that they view the Blade of Haqim with hostility...as does the Ashirra."
She turns her head aside and her lips part, but no words come out. She shakes her head and dismisses whatever she was about to say. John raises a brow but doesn't press her on it.
John inquires, his tone steady, delicate, and calm, "So, why'd you move to the UAE, then?"
"Because there was simply no other choice. The Ashirra controls all of Saudi Arabia with a fist of iron. They were paranoid and fearful that some of the younger Kindred were straying away from their teachings, so they began a purge. I--we had no choice but to flee."
John nods along, "That's terrible. I'm sorry to hear that." He then beckons for her to go on.
So, the Sultan (Ashirra equivalent of Camarilla Prince or Sabbat Archbishop or Anarch Baron) gave the orders to purge certain Kindred from the KSA. The Ashirra have been routinely doing this for centuries now- any Kindred who don't follow their strict laws are considered apostates and are hunted down without mercy.
Through no fault of her own (she didn't even know what she did!), Mnar was caught up in some power plays and political maneuvering between the Sultan and his hangers-on. Those in her intellectual circle were accused of being spies and heretics.
A purge was initiated, and she caught wind of it, having no other choice but to flee the country. She was stuffed in a coffin bound for the UAE and could only take a few of her things with her.
As she's narrating all of this, not a single tear of blood comes out of her eyes. Her voice is steady and monotone. It's clear that she's gone through a lot.
John feels some pity for her, "Damn, I'm so sorry."
"You have nothing to be sorry for. In time, I was able to reestablish things here in the UAE. Others, I am told, fled to America or Ireland or France. Some stayed behind and went into hiding."
John sighs and shakes his head, "Wow. You keep in touch with any of 'em?"
"It is risky to do so. The Sultan is not a forgiving man- he is a Tzimisce- and they do not forget so easily. I have tried to make contact with some of my friends and associates, but it is difficult. I do not wish to endanger them...and they feel the same."
John nods along, "Yeah, I get that."
Mnar grimly points out, "They decapitated my friends, burned my Haven to the ground, and threw all my writings, research notes, and books into a bonfire. All because of rumors and a thirst for power and wealth."
She pauses and takes a deep breath, "If only their lust for material wealth matched their hunger for knowledge, but what has happened has happened. It is in the past, and I cannot change it. I can only record it- as a warning maybe- for future generations."
John quietly says, "I'm sorry, Mnar. I really am."
He leans forward and rests his elbows on his knees, "But hey, we--we can make things better here, right? There are some real bad people here in the UAE and they need to be stopped. I take it you know about the Marjan Tower bombing?"
"Yes. The doing of a military-intelligence entity associated with the Hebrew state. They were responsible for the deaths and destructions of countless innocent Kindred and mortals. It was a horrific tragedy. I felt the ground vibrating under me when that building fell."
John bitterly grimaces, "Yeah, it sure was. A whole lotta Caitiff were in there, and from where I'm standing, a whole lotta people don't seem to care about that."
Mnar indifferently points out, "The Caitiff are considered bastards and mistakes among our kind. Back in Saudi Arabia, the Caitiff were captured and enthralled to serve the higher portions of the Ashirra. Some were even fed to the Unbirthed."
John frowns, "The what, now?"
Mnar goes on to explain, "The Unbirthed, sometimes known as Moon-Flowers. Another 'innovation' of the Sabbat. They are birthed from human corpses infused with the sacrificed Vitae of a Thin-Blooded or Fledgling Kindred."
John grimaces in disgust, "Jesus Christ."
Undeterred, she goes on, "They are tall, pale, and skinless humanoid husks buried in mass graves for years on end, perhaps longer. A Necronomist then proceeds to 'feed' these ravenous, Wight-like creatures with the Vitae of the sacrificed Kindred, and they emerge from their graves, having grown stronger and more powerful."
John's expression is one of shock and horror. He stares at Mnar, speechless.
"In time, they dig themselves out of their mass graves, mad with Hunger. The Sabbat might have come up with the ideas, but the Ashirra perfected them over the years. They now serve as a deterrent to those who would dare run afoul of the Sultan."
John shakes his head and remarks, "Wow. That's...that's some crazy shit right there."
Mnar nods, "It is what it is. I left Saudi Arabia because I wanted to keep my head. The Unbirthed are no more or no less monstrous than the deeds of the Camarilla and the Anarchs- they are not as pristine and proper as they like to think themselves to be."
John slowly nods, "I guess so. I mean, I've heard some pretty messed up stuff about the Camarilla and the Anarchs, too. But Al-Kushraf is a Camarilla Domain and well, y'know..." he lets that hang in the air.
Mnar plainly nods along, "Hm, yes. Regardless, I am a scholar of our kind- the good, the bad, and what some might have trouble comprehending. I see it as my just duty to record all of this and present it to those who have eyes to see and ears to hear. That is why I do what I do, Mr. Suarez."
John asks, "And you're not worried about any of your old Ashirra pals coming after you here in the UAE?"
"The majority of them are Tzimisce- highly territorial and sedentary Cainites- they will not leave their wealth and power even if it were to be consumed in an inferno tomorrow night; they would sooner perish with it than part with it."
John nods along, "I see. Well, that's the Tzimisce for ya, huh?"
"It is unwise to paint in broad strokes. Did you know that there are many Tzimisce Bedouins? They roam the deserts and are quite nomadic. They do not worship wealth and power in the same way as their sedentary counterparts."
John raises his brows and comments, "Huh. Interesting. This whole Kindred thing, y'know, it feels like there's a whole world out there, waiting to be discovered, poked open, studied, and understood. It's kinda amazing, I guess."
Mnar smiles a little and notes, "It is a world, John. A world of darkness. I am merely its humble student."
John smiles back, "Mm-hmm. It sure is- vampires, werewolves, ghosts, and other stuff that goes bump in the night. I take it your area of expertise is limited to the Kindred alone?"
Mnar answers, "My research might intersect with matters pertaining to the Garou Nation or the Awakened Mages. Sometimes, it even extends into spheres beyond my comprehension. Wraiths and demons, for example."
John's eyes widen slightly, "Oh, really? You study ALL of those, too?"
"Not necessarily, my focus is on Kindred Society. There is so much to learn and discover within that 1 field alone. The Masquerade be damned, the Eternal Struggle be damned, I want to know everything there is to know about Caine's Childer and the various ways in which they organize themselves on these nights."
John smiles a little and nods, "That's cool. Not many people get to have access to the kind of knowledge um...sloshing around in that head of yours, haha. Anyway, we need to talk about something really important."
Mnar lifts her chin slightly, "We do. You are an outsider who has seized the power of the Primogen from Vizier Mohammed Khan. In truth, he was a much-despised figure in this Domain and did not adequately represent the interests of our Clan in the Court."
"Heh, no surprise there. He's a spineless asshole who stands for nothing."
Mnar concurs with a firm nod, "Those who stand for nothing will fall for everything. That was abundantly true for Mr. Khan. He is merely a puppet for those in greater power within the Domain- particularly the Ministry and that High Priest of theirs, the man known as Seth Steale."
John snorts, "I'm not surprised. But right now, Seth seems determined to get rid of the SI and I say we put aside our differences and work together to drive the SI outta here."
Mnar gives him a pointed look and asks, "And what happens after that, Mr. Suarez? After the Zionists have been driven off or slaughtered like the dogs that they are? What then, hmm? Do you intend to continue being our Primogen?"
John's lips part and he pauses. He didn't think about that. He's been so focused on the present and the immediate threat that he forgot to consider what would happen afterwards, long after the dust has settled. The long term is not really something he's too bothered with right now.
"I am waiting for an answer..."
John's shoulders slump and he sighs, "I agreed to hand the reins back to Mohammed. I have no intentions of leading or representing our Clan after the SI's been swept up and dealt with."
Mnar is not too impressed by that. She narrows an eye, "I see. So, you wish to revert to the way things were before you and your Blade allies fled from Dubai and arrived here?"
John shrugs, "It sucks, I know, but I can't really think that far ahead, Mnar. I'm just not that kinda guy."
Mnar prods, "What happens AFTER that, hmm? Know that, should we succeed, there will be something much more than a mere power vacuum created in this Domain. There will be a struggle for control over the Domain. The Ministry will likely be involved. It will be chaos, of that I am certain."
John scratches his chin, "Hmm. Yeah, you might have a point there, Mnar. There's neither Prince nor Sheriff and the Ministry seems to have their finger in every pie around here."
He then frowns and shakes his head, "But...but I don't want to think about all that crazy Court and Council stuff right now. There's a job that needs doing, and we're the ones to do it."
"Do you not feel that you are being used?"
Oh, she's sharp!
John side-eyes her, "Maybe. I guess. Still, though, the other Clans are not exactly fighters. The Ventrue and the Toreador don't seem too keen to lend a helping hand. The Nosferatu are good with computers and tech stuff, but they wouldn't last in a fight against these Israeli bastards. The Malks got their own thing going on."
"Hmm. And the Caitiff are gone- destroyed or fled. The Setites, however..."
"Hmph. Yeah, Seth's pretty vague on the kind of support he's offering. He said he'd foot the bill for all of this, but I dunno, Mnar. Something about him...it feels like he's got his own agenda in mind."
Mnar dryly comments, "Of course, he does. 1 of the many monikers for the Ministry is the 'Clan of Lies'. Many are Corrupters and Tempters who view themselves as Liberators. I am simply relaying to you facts, John. It is not a value judgment of any kind on the Clan as a whole."
John nods, "Yeah, yeah, sure. Impartial, objective, all that good stuff. I'm familiar with that...sorta."
Mnar mentions, "I know of your sordid past, Mr. Suarez. I will refrain from commenting further. Come, now, we will go in my car. I will need a few minutes to get ready and see to some other matters. I was in the middle of translating a Noddist tome when you arrived at my doorstep."
John raises his brow, "A Noddist tome? I'm sorry for interrupting; that sounds important."
Mnar gets up and hands him a heavy Noddist text written (seemingly) in ye olde English. It's quite archaic and John feels a headache just looking at it. How Mnar translates something like this into Arabic is quite an impressive feat!
She looks at him with a composed gaze, "I myself do not necessarily agree with all that is in this Noddist tome. Much of it is said to be written by those of Baali Bloodline, but I see it as my duty as a scholar to faithfully and accurately translate this text, even if I have many reservations about its content."
She points to a random page and adds, "I even refrain from noting down my opinions in the margins. I leave that space empty, as it should be. This is what I do, Mr. Suarez- I seek out and find knowledge, no matter how unpleasant or unpalatable it might be. It is my calling as a Child of Haqim."
John smiles at her and nods approvingly, "That's cool. That kind of...real objectivity is rare these nights. A lotta folk seem to treat the truth and facts like uh...Play-Doh. It's sad, really."
He then gestures towards the incomplete book and adds, "But, hey, this is great. I can't even understand it, haha. I'm sure you're doing a fine job of translating it and I hope that someone out there can read it in and...be a better person helping to bring about a better world, I guess."
Mnar nods a little, "Ideally, yes."
"So, what's this book about, anyway?"
Mnar cracks a small smile that doesn't quite reach up to her eyes, "It is a writing from Baali Noddists, or those said to be affiliated with that Bloodline. It would take me hours to explain this to you- I mean no offense to your intellectual capabilities, but you simply lack the proper historical context."
John holds up his hand, "None taken. I get it; I'm not exactly the smartest guy around. Hmm, yeah. I'll wait outside while you get dressed." He gets up and walks towards the door.
Mnar thanks him for his understanding and locks the door. It shuts with a clicking sound and John looks around her living room area- he sees a ton of incunabula (pre-1501 printed books) stacked on top of each other, there are candles with half-burnt wicks on every surface, and there are maps open all over the place.
John sees a stack of papers and runs his fingers over the text on the top sheet. It's a handwritten Arabic text that he can't read. He sees a few expensive-looking fountain pens lying around next to a desk with a lamp on it. There are stacks of A4 paper, file folders, and a box of trinkets nearby.
He sees some framed photos of Mnar posing with some people. Her expression is fairly neutral. She's wearing a hijab and some emerald-green kaftans in these photos.
There's an old analogue clock on the wall above the sofa and a couple of random abstract paintings on the wall.
All in all, a pretty scholarly pad for a scholarly Assamite! John patiently waits and Mnar emerges from her bedroom, looking a bit more presentable. She's wearing the same thing she was wearing, but she's applied some foundation and powder to her face.
John politely smiles and says, "You look nice."
Mnar faintly chuckles, but it's barely audible and quite quick, "A Toreador in this Domain once told me that being a walking corpse is not an excuse to look like one. I agreed with them, John. They suggest for me makeup that would make my skin appear less pale and sallow."
Her purse is slung over her shoulder, and she gestures for John to follow her. She grabs her car keys from a drawer, "We will take my car, John. It is time you met the rest of those you will be fighting alongside with."
John agrees with a nod and says, "Yeah, OK. Lead the way, Mnar."
 She leads him outside to her car and opens the driver's seat. John sits in the passenger seat next to her. Mnar's car is a stick shift Honda Civic, and it smells like it's just been cleaned recently. It smells sweet on the inside, and the leather seats are pristine.
They drive off, the windows are rolled down, and the cold night wind is blowing. John looks at the gearshift and remarks, "I'm more of an automatic guy myself, y'know? Manual is kinda tricky for me."
Mnar smiles a little and notes, "If I can learn all about the Convention of Thorns, then I most certainly can learn how to drive this machine."
John snickers, "Wow, you really are quite something, Mnar. Heh."
After a few minutes of silence on the dark and wide stretches of city road, Mnar asks, "Do you have any Childer, John?"
John tells her, "Yep. Just 1. Her name's Svetlana Bobrov. I Embraced her about 5 years ago. It was an emergency Embrace. Her body was flung out of the Al-Jamal Residential Tower when it exploded, and she was lying there, dying and gasping for breath, all bloodied over. I...I had to Embrace her."
He sighs, "It--it was unauthorized, but Prince Angela understood. Sheriff Gallagher, however, wanted to cut both our heads off. He wanted to end us, but Prince Angela stepped in and made sure that we both got off easy."
"I see. So, she's an Avetrol Childe, then. One who is permitted to exist despite violating the Tradition of Progeny."
John mumbles, "Don't talk about her like that- she's been through a lot. She's suffered a lot. She's a good woman. I trained her myself. Sheriff Gallagher eventually stepped down and left Dubai after he didn't get to bring a big sword down on me and Svetlana's necks. I dunno what happened after he came here and I--I frankly don't care."
Mnar flips the indicator and smoothly turns a corner, "Hm, neither do I. I do not involve myself in such matters, but I was told that he is quite a violent man."
John looks at her and asks, "Yep. No arguing with you there. He's a few screws loose and a massive asshole. Enough about him, so, how about you? Any Childer?"
Mnar blandly answers, "No. I do not have any Childer of my own. I have yet to find the right one who fits my criteria. In a city such as this, that is no easy task, Mr. Suarez. This city is overrun with those who chase after themselves or power for power's sake."
John remarks, "That's pretty harsh. Not that I disagree. I--I mean, this place, it's just like Dubai in every way. It's so...garish yet meaningless. Lively yet hollow and superficial. Full yet empty at the same time."
Mnar dryly adds, "Al-Kushraf is a city built on the backs of foreign slaves, filled to the brim with thieves and liars. It is not a pleasant place, but we try our best to manage and hold onto some semblance of what we call Humanity."
She glances at John and clarifies, "That does not necessarily mean that I agree with the way in which the Kindred of this Domain behave and interact with each other. We are, at our core, Beasts, Mr. Suarez. You are familiar with the Riddle of our existence, are you not?"
John nods and hums, "A Beast I am, lest a Beast I become."
Mnar gives a variation of that, "Monsters we are lest monsters we become. It is a ceaseless struggle between giving the Beast what it wants- blood- and knowing when enough is enough."
