John looks out the window, the city going by in a slow blur, "Mmm-hmm. It's a struggle that we all gotta contend and cope with. I know I've felt like biting into everyone near me and--and sucking them dry. I've felt that urge before. I've felt it in the back of my head like an angry hornet just...waiting for its chance to come out and sting."
Mnar eases her foot off the accelerator and switches gears with a little more force than usual, "As have I, John. Your own Dr. George advised me to seek out ways to keep in touch with my Humanity- he suggested hobbies, taking a lover, and so on. I politely refused the last one. I cannot afford to get too close to anyone in this Domain."
She adds, "Besides, such things do not interest me anyway."
John wistfully chuckles, "Yep, that sounds like Dr. George alright! He's a good guy, Mnar. He means a lot to me. Make sure you mention me and Svetlana in your next letter to him. I'm sure he--he'd be happy to know that the Blade of Haqim is still around, fighting the good fight and all that."
Mnar comments, "I shall do that."
The rest of the drive is spent chatting about various Clan-related matters. John is brought up-to-speed on the way the non-Blade Assamites operate here in Al-Kushraf. Mnar tells him that most of them here are either blue-collar workers or in the informal sector (i.e. bordering on being slaves).
John winces and sucks some air through his teeth, "Sheesh. I know the human rights situation is dismal here in the UAE, but whoa, that's even worse than I thought it was!"
Mnar agrees with a nod, "Yes, I have even come across several Kindred who were not Embraced willingly. They were mostly Caitiff Embraced by some rich and powerful Sheikhs with connections beyond the boundaries of this Domain. Or so I am told."
She reminds him, "Once again, I do not willingly involve myself in such matters unless it pertains to my studies and research. In my time here, steering clear of the excesses of the Kindred in this Domain has ensured that my head remains where it is- attached firmly to my body."
She adds, "You will meet some of our fellow Judges tonight at the places I am taking you to. I want to see their reactions to...their new Primogen."
John rubs the back of his neck, "Hmm, OK. Ya sure they won't be too salty about me being in charge of them?"
Mnar gives him a pointed look and remarks, "No, they won't. Like I said, Vizier Khan was despised by nearly all of his fellow Assassins. Even his Sire, now missing, could not stand him."
"What happened to his Sire?"
"I do not know."
"Hm, fair enough."
"I have made arrangements for you to meet with those who will be working closely with you to drive the SI off. We will discuss plans and go over the logistics of your new role."
John puts his hand out the window and the hot breeze blows through his fingers as the car speeds through the night, "I really appreciate all the help. I could use as much of it as I can right now."
Mnar simply nods at him and drives on like a pro. The roads are (mostly) clear and her driving is very smooth and efficient.
40-ish minutes later...
John finds out a lot of things about his fellow Assamite- she has some sympathies for the Sabbat, she's dedicated to her scholarly endeavors, and that's she's an asexual aromantic (ace aroma).
On the last part, Mnar mirthlessly chuckles, "I have never, in life and in Unlife, had such feelings for...touching, romance, making love, or any of that. My studies of Kindred Society are my Unlife, John. I do not wish for anything else to...complicate that."
She brings her car to a stop and jerks her chin over to a gaggle of people standing around a wide courtyard, just away from the streetlamps.
They're wearing suits and seem to be...out of place amidst the other passersby who are dressed more casually. It's not like there are many people around this area, though- it's a quiet little pocket of the city with a few street vendors selling shawarma and hot falafel sandwiches.
There are a few mid-rises dotted about the area- a residential district with little traffic going through. It's all residential here, and it seems fairly peaceful, if a bit sleepy.
The streets are mostly clean, and there are some swaying palm trees and small gardens. The streetlamps are well-lit and evenly spaced.
John looks at where Mnar pointed to, "What's up with them? They seem...off."
"Yes. They are. And why is that?"
"Um...they don't seem like SI. Um--"
Mnar sighs, "They are of the Ministry, Mr. Suarez. They closely watch and monitor the other Kindred around here. Especially those who are not of the Followers of Set."
John incredulously asks, "What?! W--who do they even report to, then? This city's got neither Prince nor Sheriff! It doesn't even make any sense!"
The Assamite scholar flatly answers, "To the man you and I both know as Seth Steale- the High Priest of Al-Kushraf. They are his...lackeys, so to speak. His eyes and ears in this Domain."
John is dumbfounded and just shakes his head. He gets out of the car, "Well, no time like the present, Mnar. Let's get this show on the road." She nods and follows after him, keys jangling.
Mnar struggles to keep pace with John, who's brisk walk is making her huff. She keeps a steady expression on her face as John walks past the 4 Setite spies.
He avoids eye contact and keeps walking straight towards the door of an apartment with peeling paint. He's led inside by Mnar and she brings him into what appears to be a living room area.
There are some couches, a couple of chairs, and some dimly lit lamps. Mnar seems to be familiar with this place.
John snickers, "Nice place. Who are we even supposed to be meeting?"
The speedy Assamite takes a good look around and notices that this ground floor home has things in it that strongly imply a wheelchair user lives here. There are support rails on the walls and near the doors.
It seems that someone lives here with a mobility impairment. How curious.
Mnar searches around and mutters something to herself in a different dialect of Arabic. Looking a little flustered, she pulls out her phone and calls someone.
"Hmph. Yes. OK." She hangs up and ushers John out of the living room. A couple of minutes later, they're back on the road again. Those 4 Setite spies are...nowhere to be seen.
John asks, "So--so, they all report right back to Seth?"
Mnar shifts gears and keeps focused on the road ahead, "That is what I said, yes. A man like him did not amass power through honest means. He has an agenda. The problem is figuring out what that agenda is."
She pauses, "For now, though, I will take you to your fellow Banu Haqim, John. We are on our way to meet someone who is...interesting. I will let you see for yourself."
"Cool."
The intended destination is some kind of a bazaar area that's not too far off from that apartment. It's bustling with a crowd of people. Bright lights emanate from various small shops, hookah smoke wafts from a few corners, and the smell of street food wafts through the air.
The car ride is fairly quiet with Mnar mostly keeping to herself and John being busy with his phone.
Mnar parks her car to the side and tells John to stay close to her. The 2 of them walk to a small, unassuming shop wedged deep at the end of this long stretch of various shops and stalls.
John reads the sign above the door, "Baba's Carpets?" he looks at Mnar with a quizzical expression.
Mnar replies, "Yes. What is wrong?"
John faintly chuckles and walks inside. The air is thick and heavy. There are lots of rolled up carpets in this place- it's an actual carpet shop. There are quite a few customers milling about and chatting with each other.
They seem to be browsing the various rugs and carpets on display here.
Mnar points to a rusty door behind the glass counter with some cash registers on it. She tells John to come with her through that door and he does so. It leads down to some stairs, and they follow those down.
It opens to a large and dark room with a table in the middle.
A young man in a manual wheelchair is seated at this table with some cards in front of him. He's surrounded by empty wooden chairs.
The young man in question appears to be in his 20s, his curly hair is cropped short, and he has light brown skin. He's wearing a loose beige thawb.
His wheelchair is manual and quite worn out- there are patches on the seat cushion.
Mnar makes the necessary introductions, "This is Mahmoud. He is of our Blood as well. Mahmoud, this is our new Primogen- John Suarez."
Mahmoud pushes his wheelchair forward and extends his cold hand as he looks up at John, "As-salamu alaykum (AR: Peace be upon you). We have been looking forward to meeting with you, habibi."
John smiles back, "Yo. What's up. Um...uh...Mnar?"
Mnar folds her arms and raises her chin, "Yes?"
"Mind if I talk to you, privately, for a minute?"
"Of course."
Mahmoud looks up at John with a certain sparkle in his dead eyes. He smiles warmly and nods. He wheels himself away from his fellow Assamite and goes back to his cards.
John whispers to Mnar, "I don't mean to sound like an ass or anything, but he's...in a wheelchair. I dunno how he's gonna be capable of fighting against those SI thugs. They'll--"
Mnar quietly says, "The others still have use of their legs, John. Please, do not ask Mahmoud about how his...current predicament. And, yes, it is permanent."
"So, what are we here for?"
"Mahmoud! Do you have it for me?"
The wheelchair-bound Assamite lifts his finger and groans as he pushes himself forward. He opens a large drawer behind him and pulls out a box. He hands it to Mnar.
John looks at it and sees that it's an ornately decorated box with a lock on it. Mnar pulls out a small key and turns the lock. The box opens and John sees a bit of his reflection in the shiny blade of a gnarly looking scimitar.
Mnar carefully takes the blade out and slowly brandishes it around, nodding to herself and saying something or the other. John watches her do this as she examines the blade.
It has a slightly curved hilt, a double-edged blade, and a golden handle. It looks like it has recently been given some maintenance work.
Mnar looks at the blade with a look of reverence.
John remarks, "Cool blade! I myself got a katana. We could uh...maybe spar sometimes?"
"Perhaps."
Mahmoud speaks up, "So, habibi! You are of the Blade of Haqim, yes?" his accent is quite distinct.
John smiles at him, "Yep. That's right. We're here to take care of those Zionist shitheads who are terrorizing us all. Don't mind me asking, but how are you gonna help us in this? I hope that didn't come off as insensitive or anything, seeing--"
Mahmoud chuckles, "Haha. Oh, walla, it is no issue. I have heard worse. So, you are our Primogen now, yes? I want to know how you got rid of that useless donkey of a Vizier."
Mnar glares at Mahmoud and shakes her head, "Mahmoud, enough. Vizier Mohammed Khan might've been a man who stands for nothing, but calling him a donkey is...childish, even for you."
John holds his hand up, "Yeah. That's for another time, but he folded pretty quickly when I challenged him for the position of Primogen."
Mahmoud thoughtfully nods and cracks a cheeky smile, "I have the other thing you requested, Mnar. 1 minute, please." He begins pushing himself forward again, grunting.
Mnar sighs, "I apologize for him, John. I assure you that he means well."
"Yeah. No problem. He seems like a cool dude. Banu Haqim, just like you and I. Seems like an interesting guy. What's his story?"
Mnar wearily exhales and continues twirling her scimitar, "He tells me many variations of his 'story'. 1 time, he told me was from Morocco. Another time, he said Algeria."
"Ah."
"As for his Embrace, he gives me equally confusing accounts. I think that he mainly does it to...pull my leg, as you Westerners say. It is a little frustrating, since I am trying to write an account of those of our Clan in this Domain."
She adds, "I need to get more details from him. I did not expect him to be such an evasive man, but I have found ways to make him more cooperative."
"Um...like?"
Mnar holds up her scimitar, a barely noticeable smirk dancing on her lips, "Like this. It is my old sword, in my possession since I was a Fledgling. In his state, Mahmoud needs things to keep busy, so I gave it to him for maintenance and restoration."
John whistles, "Wow. That's some pretty intense history there."
"Yes. I have many such items that I have collected over the years. Mahmoud takes interest in some of them, and we work out a deal of some kind. He works on restoring them, and I...hopefully get to a coherent account of his past and how he came to be here."
"Ah. Gotcha."
Mahmoud returns, clutching a picture frame close to his chest. He has a large smile on his face when he turns it over. It's a painted portrait of Mnar.
The Assamite scholar is wearing a kaftan and a hijab. A hand is placed on her hip and she's looking down on something (or someone).
She takes the frame and examines it for a few seconds. She licks her lips and silently nods.
Mahmoud sighs and pats his legs, "It was from an admirer of hers back in Saudi Arabia. A Toreador scholar--"
Mnar holds up a stern finger and Mahmoud snickers, "Hahaha! Oh, oh, sorry."
Mnar glares at him for a moment, "That's...personal. I keep it only as a reminder, nothing else. Thank you for restoring it, Mahmoud."
Mahmoud bows slightly, "I do my best, Mnar. You know that I am reliable in such things."
"You are. I will see you later."
"As will I. So, John habibi..."
John presses his lips into a thin line, "Yep?"
Mahmoud rolls his wheelchair closer to him, "You and the Blade have been in this city, what, a few weeks now. Yes?"
"Yes, that's right. After the SI hit Dubai, we had no other choice but to flee here. Seth welcomed us, the Malkavians, and a few others, with open arms."
Mahmoud thoughtfully nods his head, his lower lip shifting from side to side as he listens, "We knew of your presence here, habibi. We, the Banu Haqim of this Domain, have been...waiting for you to come to us."
"Oh?"
Mnar puts her portrait aside, places her scimitar back into its box, and looks over at Mahmoud, "John is still new here. Keep that in mind. He does not fully know the extent of what is going on. He will learn, however."
Mahmoud nods, "Yes. Yes. I understand. Still, I cannot help but be excited by this! The arrival of a new Primogen is very exciting, don't you think?"
Mnar shrugs, "Eventually, after the Zionists have been driven off or slaughtered, your new friend wants to give back his position to Vizier Khan. Is that right, Mr. Suarez?"
"Uh...yeah. It's something I promised, but only because I wanted him to cooperate with me and--and allow me to come to you for support."
Mahmoud's expression sours and he throws his hands up in disbelief, "Ah! Alqumama (AR: rubbish)! I like this little American man and wish for him to continue as our Primogen after the dust, it settles."
He looks up at John with expectant eyes, "Right, John? Y--you will continue to--to be our Primogen, yes? You do not know how much I despise that donkey of a Vizier!"
Mnar sighs, "Mahmoud, let him talk. Please."
John clears his throat, "Well, like I said, it was a deal that I made with the Vizier. We just need help in fighting the SI. They're vicious, man. We need people, we need support, and we need all the help we can get. It's not just us, but--"
Mahmoud clicks his tongue, "Of course, habibi. You are new here, so you do not know who is on our side and who is not. Have you met any Nosferatu yet?"
"Yeah. They saved us by taking us down into their Warrens when the SI cornered us. I'll always be grateful for their hospitality towards us."
"I see. Hmm. So, you have been to the Nosferatu Warrens, then? Hmm."
John senses that Mahmoud wants to say more, so he plainly gestures for the wheelchair-bound man to go on.
Mahmoud's lips curve into an almost-smile. He nods and pats his legs again, "Did you notice anything odd while you were down there, habibi?"
"Apart from all the misshapen heads, pointy ears, hunched backs, boils, scars, and stuff...nope. What else was I supposed to notice?"
Mnar steps in, "That is because The Clan of the Hidden knew about your imminent arrival to this city EVEN BEFORE the Ministry got word of the attacks on Dubai."
John's face scrunches in confusion, "Huh? How?"
Mahmoud continues, "Yes, it is true, habibi. Those Crawlers have been watching you even before you and the rest of the fleeing Kindred set foot in Al-Kushraf."
Mr. Suarez is genuinely taken aback by this revelation. He stammers, "Wh--what? But...why? They--they've been spying on us?!"
Mahmoud sucks some air through his teeth, "They would not really call it 'spying,' habibi. Think of it more like a bucket under a leaking roof. The water merely trickles down into the bucket. It is not the bucket's fault that the water might be contaminated, no?"
What an oddly interesting analogy!
Mnar sighs, "He is right. The Clan of the Hidden knows many things that happen throughout this Domain and even beyond its borders. They have their own ways of acquiring information and passing it on."
Mahmoud points out, "Things of varying...quality trickle down until the bucket is full, then a new bucket takes its place. Does that make sense, habibi?"
John shakes his head, "You're saying that the Nosferatu have been keeping tabs on us and feeding that info to the Ministry?"
Mahmoud rubs his face with his palm, "Oh. Walla. No. The Nosferatu in this city keep to themselves, only sharing information and secrets when it can bring them some or the other benefit. As for the Ministry, they have their own...ways around this city."
John lifts his chin, "Seth Steale. What do you know about him?"
Mahmoud simply shrugs as way of response.
He gestures to the cards on the table and smiles, "Would you like to spare a few minutes for a humble game of cards with your fellow Assamite?"
John glances over at Mnar. She gives him a barely noticeable shake of the head. He clicks his tongue, "Not tonight, pal. We got other people to see."
Mahmoud's wide smile falters a little, but he understands the gravity of the situation, "Ah! It was worth an ask. Perhaps another night, yes?"
"Sure."
Mnar clears her throat, "We must go now. There are others to meet. What are you doing now, Mahmoud? There are some documents that I would like you to look over. There's also some more restoration work that I need you to carry out."
Mahmoud wheels himself back to the table, "There is a meeting at the Jameel Party Hall. It was organized by the families and friends of the victims of the Marjan Tower explosion. I want to be there to show my support."
John's interest in this event is piqued, "Oh, really? Is that far away from here? I wouldn't mind coming--after I meet up with whomever Mnar is gonna introduce me to, of course."
Mahmoud's expression brightens up, "Oh! Of course! Yes, I can get you on the list. Mnar will have to drive you over there, though."
Mnar shrugs, "It is fine with me."
Mahmoud begins shuffling his deck of cards and looks up at John and Mnar as they head out, "I will see you soon, habibi! I am sorry that I cannot fight, but I pray for victory over our enemies!"
John waves at him, "Thanks! See you there!"
On the way out, they spot an elevator in the corner of the dingy basement room. Mahmoud uses it to move himself (and some stuff) around.
The 2 of them walk up the stairs, leave Baba's Carpets, and go back to Mnar's car. She starts the engine, and John tells her that he's ready to go to wherever she wants next.
On the way to wherever, John asks, "So, the scimitar. I guess we can see you, besides us, fighting?"
"No. Well, maybe. That scimitar, if anything, was always more for shows or ceremonies. It has been sharpened, but I do not know of its efficacy in a combat situation."
"I see. Cool. I hope we get even with those Zionist maniacs soon. They've done enough damage, and it's time to make 'em pay for it."
"I do not disagree. As a matter of fact, you will find a lot of us have a very...dim view of the Hebrew state."
"Heh, yeah. It's a crazy fucking country. Seeing what they did- and are doing- to the Palestinians is just...it's insane. It's a bloodbath! Something's gotta give."
"Hmm. Yes. A correct assessment, Mr. Suarez."
During a traffic stop, Mnar reaches into the glove compartment and hands her fellow Assamite a few strange drawings.
It looks like some kind of hulking fleshy, monstrous mass with tentacles and other such nasties protruding out of its blob of a "body".
She points to it, "Have you seen anything like this around here? Do you know what it is?"
John examines the drawings closely, "Uh, no, I haven't. It looks fucking nasty! What the hell is this?!"
"It is supposed to be a drawing of a Vozhd. A creation primarily of the Tzimisce Clan."
John grimaces, "Oh. Yuck. How does it end up looking like...this?!"
The light turns green. Mnar shifts the gear, puts her foot on the gas pedal, and gets them going again, "A lot of bodies...melded together into a singular walking, biological weapon."
"Christ! OK. That's...that's horrible. Just...ew."
"The Vozhd are the primary reason why many Kindred fear the Tzimisce Clan so much. They can be controlled, but...things tend to go wrong."
"I get the feeling that you're speaking from experience."
Mnar's expression reflects some kind of dark memory. She nods and says nothing.
The rest of the drive is quiet with neither John nor Mnar saying anything for the time being. They meet up with a few colorful and interesting characters and are reassured of full support for when the time comes.
Mnar made the necessary introductions, and John explained the current situation. All in all, the non-Blade Assamites are absolutely ready to jump into the fray and crush the Zionist scum in these lands.
Good. They're eager, they're sincere, and they genuinely mean well. This fight can- perhaps- be won, after all.
(What happens after the dust settles, though?)
Much later...
Mnar drops off John at the Jameel Party Hall where Mahmoud had arranged to meet. The speedy Assamite thanks her for tonight, bids her farewell, and goes to the meeting hall.
The Jameel Party Hall is a fairly drab-looking structure in the middle of a busy street. The walls are painted white with a few windows in them, and there is an orange-and-white sign on the front of the building with English and Arabic writing on it.
John takes note of a few people milling about, talking amongst themselves. The floors are grimy and leave a lot to be desired, and the place feels a bit stuffy inside.
A few people turn their heads to look at John. Some of them whisper to each other while others just ignore him. A few more are walking out, so he assumes that the meeting is about to start.
Mahmoud waves and calls out, "John, over here! I have reserved a seat for you. Come! Come!"
John sees Mahmoud wheeling himself into 1 of the larger hallways. He follows behind, noting that there's a big banner on the wall with a picture of the Marjan Tower.
There are hearts, drawings, and little notes scribbled all around the photo of the destroyed tower.
As John walks down the hallway, he hears people crying. Many people are in tears as they're walking down the hallway or into the various rooms.
The lighting is bright and there's a projector that's been set up, displaying slideshows of the victims.
Some people are wearing shirts with the words "WE DEMAND ANSWERS" printed on them. Others are wearing shirts with the word "SHAME" printed on them.
The whole atmosphere is reserved yet tense. Sadness hangs in the air. Some people are standing by themselves, lost in their own thoughts, while others are huddled together in groups and having discussions.
A man in a black suit stands in front of a podium. He clears his throat, taps the microphone, and says something. Everyone else quiets down and starts filing into the room.
He begins his speech in English. The speaker is clearly distraught. Besides him, there's a large board with photographs of some of the victims of the M-Tower bombing.
John quietly sits down next to Mahmoud and listens intently. Mahmoud has a notepad in his lap and he's busily writing down notes.
What none of these poor people know is that the Marjan Tower bombing was the work of Unit 8211. They do not even suspect foul play.
All they want are answers and accountability from the image-obsessed Emirati authorities who could care less about them.
It is truly heartbreaking to hear and see these families and friends, grieving and crying over the loved ones who were violently snatched away from this world.
John can't help but wonder what he'd do in their shoes. The best he and his fellow Assassins can do is Judge those Israeli bastards accordingly when the time comes.
He feels sorry for these innocent victims, and he promises them in his head that justice WILL be served in due time.
(But the Israelis aren't the only responsible party. The apathetic and callous Emirati authorities ALSO have blood on their hands. Who will Judge them?)
This meeting was called to discuss the aftermath of the Marjan Tower explosion, what should be done going forward, and how the authorities have been (mis)handling the situation so far.
There's a lot of anger and sadness in the room, but there's also a lot of determination to see this through to something tangible.
When the speaker gives the attendees a chance to speak, the heart wrenching stories of the victims' relatives begin.
Mahmoud is scribbling notes in Arabic and muttering to himself, clicking his tongue every now and then. He's probably taking down quotes and statements, but it's hard to say.
Some people are angry, others are sad, some are trying to be reasonable, but they're all hurting greatly. What all these people want is an investigation into the matter. A proper, independent one.
Not a single soul in this room buys the official "gas leak" narrative, and for good reason. A few point out to how eerily similar this event was to the AJRT explosion 5 years ago.
The speaker says that the authorities have been refusing to cooperate with the families and friends of the victims, and that their efforts to find the truth behind the tragedy have been repeatedly thwarted.
There are attempts to present a comprehensive count of the deceased (and destroyed). It's in the high 100s.
John places his hand on his mouth, eyes wide in shock. Mahmoud shakes his head in disgust and winces.
1 man says that he knew 1 of the (mortal) victims personally. He starts weeping and wailing as he explains how the victim was the father of 4 young children who are now all orphans.
That man was simply in a hard place, out of a job and struggling to get by and feed his family. His kids were taken away, and he found himself squatting in the M-Tower when it came crumbling down.
A Tamil-speaking woman hobbles to the front. Her young daughter translates. This woman's son was only 18. He ran away from home 2 years ago, and she never saw or heard from him again until the news came.
There were many people living in the M-Tower, most of them seemed to be poor immigrants working for a pittance, just trying to get by in a city with an extremely high cost of living.
More people come forward and share their stories. Some of them were students, some were workers, some were lovers, some were old friends, and all of them were taken too soon. All of them.
The meeting continues like this, and John stays through the entire thing. Mahmoud watches on, his expression a mix of disgust, horror, sadness, and anger.
There's a simple table to the corner, with rows of Fanta poured in transparent plastic cups, chunky veg samosas, and a bowl of seedless dates.
Eventually, the speaker announces that there will be a march tomorrow to the site of the explosion, demanding the truth behind it.
Objections are raised, wherein the obvious is pointed out: the authorities WILL clamp down hard, and this could escalate into violence. People may even die. This could lead to the authorities cracking down harder.
This is an issue, and the speaker asks for the crowd's opinions. Many are reluctant, but the younger folk in attendance seem willing. Some are eager, even.
A Southeast Asian man from a local Pentecostal church plays a remembrance song in honor of the victims. A woman reads a poem in Urdu, a group of women sing in Tagalog, a young child recites a somber poem in Arabic. It's a moving moment. Truly.
John thinks to himself, "Goddamn. They--they were innocent people. It wasn't just Kindred in there. Hell, I'm convinced that--that there were barely any Kindred in the tower. Just...people. Mortals. Living their lives and struggling. They died, and for what?!"
The meeting lasts about an hour and a half. The speaker finally announces that the meeting is over, and everyone files out of the room, either in groups or by themselves.
John and Mahmoud go out with the rest of the attendees and head their separate ways.
John's dead heart is heavy, as are the (still-beating) hearts of the mortals who were present. They all feel drained and exhausted, and not sure of how to proceed.
Protests will be crushed, demands for answers will be silenced, attempts at accountability will be stonewalled. This is how things are (by deliberate design) here in the UAE.
Some people stick around and sit in circles, discussing or just trying to comfort each other and share their feelings.
Soon enough, people begin leaving, and many of them are still crying on the way out. Some are talking to each other, some are wistfully looking at pictures on the board, and others are just staring into space.
John asks if Mahmoud can get home safely, "You need a lift or anything?"
Mahmoud chuckles, "Habibi, I have been confined to this thing for...a long time. And you know what 'a long time' usually means to us Kindred, yes?"
"Damn. I'm so sorry."
"Tch. Do not apologize. It is not your fault. If anything, it is...mine. Ah, you have things to do now, no?"
"Yep. I guess I do. Still. If there's anything I can do to help you, please don't hesitate to ask. Seriously."
Mahmoud tells his fellow bloodsucker, "Just give Mnar whatever she asks. She is my friend and I trust her completely. I hope we see each other again soon! I will keep you in prayer, habibi!"
"Yeah, me too. Thanks! You have a good night, man."
"You too, habibi! Alwadae (AR: Bye)!"
The 2 Banu Haqim part ways. John heads back to his Haven to exercise, train, and listen to Kristin Mainhart tunes on full blast. He needs to be ready for the upcoming battles against the Unit 8211 scum.
Meanwhile...
Mark Kincaid's penthouse is a stunning, lavish, and luxurious dwelling. It has 2 master bedrooms, an office, a study, a spacious living room with a fireplace, and a dining room that can fit at least a dozen people.
The air is conditioned, cool, and crisp. The floors are marble, and the windows are made of tinted, bulletproof glass. Automatic shutters act as additional security, just in case.
There are a few random paintings on the walls, and a state-of-the-art security system that has a team of private security guards ready to respond to any threat or intrusion.
The Ventrue Primogen's Haven is definitely a place that only the wealthiest in this city could possibly afford.
Mark is dressed in a random anime hoodie. Some random anime plays from his wall-mounted flatscreen television. A PS3 and XBOX360 are connected to the TV as well.
The Blue Blood has his bare feet propped up on the coffee table, and his attention is focused on the stuff he's watching. He laughs along at the crap on the screen. The lights are bright, and the volume is high.
His doorbell rings. Mark immediately turns off the TV, dims the lights, pats the sides of his head, ruffles his hair, and walks towards the door. He takes a deep breath, composes himself, and opens it.
Seth stands there, his snake head cane planted firmly on the floor, his hand covering its emerald eyes. He is dressed in a patterned blue shirt, a blazer, and a pair of khakis. His eyes are hidden behind tinted eyeglasses.
Mark welcomes his visitor, "Seth! Wazzup, buddy! C'mon in. I'm so glad that you could make the time to come and--and see me."
Seth smiles, but it's more serpentine than sincere. He says, "Of course. You asked for my help and I came."
Mark is already making his way to the couch. He gestures to the couch, "Please. Take a seat. Make yourself at home. Mi casa and all that crap."
The Setite High Priest takes a good, long look around the Ventrue's fancy Haven and remarks, "You've truly outdone yourself, haven't you, Mark?"
Mark plops down on the couch and extends his arms, "Hey, man, if you got it, flaunt it. Y'know? Am I right or am I right? What's Unlife without a little...pizzazz, huh? You know a bit about that, don't you?"
Seth is still standing, but he is leaning on his cane. His smile remains, "I guess I do." He slowly walks forward and takes his place. He looks around and nods at the dimmed lights.
The Ventrue sniffs, "So, what's up?"
"You tell me, Mr. Kincaid. How are things with you? How's your debt situation going? Owing half the city is not exactly enviable, is it?"
Mark rubs his face, "Eh, whatever. I've got some influence and I'm doing my best to leverage that to my advantage. I uh--I uh...called you here to...well, y'know."
Seth lifts his chin, "Of course. Offering help of a spiritual nature is my specialty, Mark. I'm glad that you're seeking Typhon's guidance."
Mark leans forward, "Uh, yeah, yeah. So, you're gonna help me. Good, good, good. So, like, um, when do we start?"
Seth tilts his head, "Whenever you're ready. How 'bout at the beginning?"
The Ventrue scratches the back of his head, "I tried, like, therapy. A lot of it, man. It just wasn't my--my vibe, I guess?"
Seth dismissively states, "All of that is...nonsense, Mark. Another pointless fixture of modernity. That sort of thing isn't for our kind. We're better, hell, we can do better."
Mark points his finger and nods his head, "Exactly! Yeah, totally. Like, they want you to talk about your childhood or something, and then they're like, 'dude, maybe your parents didn't hug you enough'."
The Viper chuckles, "Hmm, yes. If anything, you should detach yourself from what binds you. Tell me, Mr. Kincaid, what is it that binds you the most?"
Mark strokes his chin and thinks for a long moment, "Uh...I'm Ventrue and we got a thing in our Clan where the very name of our Sires carries weight and--and puts these expectations upon you."
"Of course, I understand completely. What else?"
"Well, uh, you know. Uh, stuff. My Sire, she was- and probably still is- a sorta liaison working with the UN. She acts as a sorta go-between between herself and really eminent people from all over the world."
"Wow. You've told me this before, but it was a long time ago, wasn't it?"
"Y--Yeah. Point is, she probably saw something in me and Embraced me. And boy...did I royally screw the pooch, hahahaha! I had no choice but to leave America and take my chances here in the UAE. The rest you already know."
Seth thoughtfully nods, "Hmm. Yes, I do. You didn't quite live up to her expectations, correct?"
"Yup! I screwed up majorly. Some people got hurt and killed, the Masquerade got breached, and I ended up having to pay a big fine, and it still ain't enough. But hey, we're here to talk about me. So, let's do that. What do you think?"
Seth shrugs, "And after that, your Sire was disappointed in you. She was this close to destroying you, so you had to flee."
Mark laughs nervously, "Hah, yeah, she was, like, super mad at me. Super-duper mad, man!"
"But you've changed, haven't you?"
Mark shrugs, "Eh, I guess so. I came here, made mad money, networked with some dope people, and--" he stops to do an encompassing gesture of the entire penthouse, "--look at this, man! Look at all of this!"
Seth faintly chuckles, "Yes, look at all of it. It's giving me some ideas on some...redesigning that I need to do myself."
"Yeah, sure. Hey, I'm all about the hustle, man. I'm just out here, making the best of Unlife."
"Of course, Mr. Kincaid. And yet, I sense an...emptiness within you. Your calling me here tonight shows me that much."
Mark leans forward and inquires, "Hey, where's your Ghoul? Eddie, right?"
With mild annoyance lacing his tone, Seth responds, "It's Edwin. And I told him to wait in the car. I didn't want him here with us. Truth is, I'm starting to...get a bit wary of him."
Mark's jaw drops, "Holy crap! What?! You serious? Why? What'd he do?"
"He's...lacking in certain areas. He's a decent driver and fairly adequate when it comes to the cleaning. That's really just about it, really. Anyway, I didn't come here to talk about him. Forget him. I'm here for you, Mr. Kincaid."
The Ventrue grins and nervously wiggles in his seat, "Oh, drop the whole 'Mr. Kincaid' thing. Mark's fine, seriously. We've known each other for fucking decades now."
"Yes, of course. Tell me what bothers you the most, Mr. Kincaid. It does concern the debts that are currently looming over you, yes? You can't keep them off of you forever, correct?"
Mark wrings his hands together, "I thought that I COULD keep it all at bay by waving my hands and Jedi mind tricking my way through it, but that's becoming increasingly harder to do."
"Of course, I figured as much. Frequent use of Dominate on the same people over and over again does have certain...unforeseen side effects. What are your options, then? How will you proceed from here?"
The Ventrue Primogen cluelessly shrugs, "Man, I don't know. I was thinking of, like, changing my name, getting new IDs, maybe a new hairdo, and going, like, hermit mode for a few years before resurfacing, but--"
Seth cuts him off, "Not half a bad plan, Mr. Kincaid. But I think that you can do so much better than that."
Mark raises his palms, "Well, what do you think I should do?"
The Typhonist suggests, "We're all just going with the flow here, aren't we? Doing what comes naturally to us, heh. You could, of course, lighten the load on yourself."
"And how would I do that, exactly?"
A predatory smile forms on Seth's face as he leans closer, "Back in the States, my father was a preacher- the fire and brimstone kind. It was a very core part of my upbringing. His booming mid-Atlantic voice boomed through all radios back then."
He continues, "During my younger years, I accompanied him and my mother on preaching and revival trips throughout most of the Northeastern United States. Mom would go crazy with the tambourine..."
"Wow."
Seth faintly chuckles, "Heh, yeah. That's 1 way of putting it. And little old me, dressed smartly, would go around with the collection plate. Yep, I was the one who'd go around, do a little puppy-dog eyes look, and watch those hicks part with what little they had."
"Sheesh, that sounds kinda manipulative. I've seen my fair share of churches, but I've never seen kids go around and collect tithes and offering."
The Serpent shrugs indifferently, "Well, times were different back then. My dad knew what he was doing when he had me go around, shaking that shiny plate. Anyway, it's all water under the bridge now. I'm sure you're wondering what this has to do with your situation, right?"
Mark's lips quirk upward, "Yeah."
Seth goes in for the "kill" by saying, "Lately, there have been talks among the other Kindred. With the SI swarming around in our backyard, people- who shall remain unnamed- have been claiming that the Ventrue aren't doing a thing about it."
Mark's face scrunches in confusion, "That's not true, man! It's not. It's not true. At all. Like, we might not be on the frontlines, fighting against those goddamn bugs and--and..."
Seth raises his hand, "The point is: people are making all sorts of insinuations, and you know how rotten people can be. Well, we need some way to...shut them up, don't we?"
Mark's expression softens, "Sure. What do, like, have in mind?"
Ah.
Seth forces a deep breath, and his amber eyes momentarily become slits. His fingers grip the emeralds on his snake-headed cane. He begins, "I'll tell you exactly what we should do."
Mark is attentive, but the Setite's expression and tone are...worrying, to say the least.
"What's that, then? Come on, tell me."
"If I'm going to give you my help, if I'm going to give you Typhon's help, then I'm going to need something from you in return. Call it a...little favor, if you will."
"Oh, sure, dude, of course. You can name it. Seriously, I owe you so much. Anything you want. Just, like, name it and it's done."
Seth loves the sound of that, "The Ventrue, more so than any other Clan, are associated with money, prestige, and power. People say you're not doing your part in the fight against the SI threat..."
Mark lets the High Priest's words sink in.
"...Despite your current problems, you are STILL a man of considerable means, a man of many friends, and a man who knows how the world works, am I right?"
Mark scratches his head, "Uh, sure, yeah. I'm still a high roller, the whole debts thing is...like a phase, I guess. Just a phase."
"Good, good, good. Now, what I'm about to propose will help both of us in the long run. I'm going to have to ask you to make a very public and...large contribution to our efforts to eradicate the SI."
WHOA!
Mark's eyes widen in shock, "HOLY SHIT! That's--that's--that's insane, man!"
Seth waves his hand dismissively, "Relax, relax. It's not for me- I won't see a cent of it. It's for the good of all Kindred here in Al-Kushraf. We could do a lot with that kind of money."
(It is abso-fucking-lutely for Mr. Steale!)
Mark sighs deeply, "OK. I could...write a check, I guess. But why?"

"Yeah, I guess."

Seth's eyes are closed, his cane rests between his legs, and his hands are clasped over his stomach. He recalls his time as a child, going with his father and mother to preaching trips throughout impoverished and rural portions of the Northeastern US.
Dad would be howling at the top of his lungs and sweating. Mom would rock back and forth, lift her hands up and scream "Amen!" at random intervals.
It was your typical obscurantist fire and brimstone claptrap and blustering nonsense so common of those types of people in the first half of the 20th century.
There was plenty of conservative, racist, and misogynistic drivel and nonsense to be had, along with the usual anti-intellectualism and paranoia that was so common back then.
(Add to that the Red Scare, and it's truly a toxic sludge).
But the best part of those "divinely ordained" trips were the people who would drop a few dollars into the plate that little Seth Steale would go around shaking.
They were mostly poor, simple country folk who were being taken for a ride by an obnoxious man threatening hellfire for every single thing under the sun.
Many were white. A few were black, they were not wholly welcome, but their money was accepted all the same.
On these nights, Mr. Steale's own sermons at his cult come from his preacher dad's incoherent scribblings and yikes notes (plagiarized to the last syllable, basically).
Add to that Seth's time with the Young Republicans, because Seth Steale (at heart) is very much a Republican, despite being in the UAE for decades now.
(Seth will always be a Young Republican, and they are a foul fucking bunch).

Seth was a little boy back then, but he's a man now. His dad and mom used him as a prop to help with "The Lord's Work". Next, his Sire (Rafael) led him on, treated him cruelly, and used him as a glorified errand boy.

The Sand-Snake's amber eyes snap open and a smug smile forms on his pale face.
Seth preaches detachment from whatever binds you, yet he owns 2 Havens within this city. He tells his devotees that his messages come straight from Typhon, when it's all just rehashed religious conservative obscurantist bluster mixed in with various other things.

Seth's mind races. He's so close.
(So. Fucking. Close.)
His plans are in motion, the wheels are turning, and the dice are cast.

(Mr. De La Cruz is in Torpor, so yeah.)

The harsh light emanating from the various passing cars causes Seth to hiss and wince in pain. His Clan Abhors the Light, be it natural or artificial.
And yet, Seth doesn't roll up the window or look away. He likes the sounds. He likes the sights. He likes the energy and the atmosphere. He likes this city.
Hell, he even likes the pain that hits him when a high beam headlight strikes him dead-on.
He doesn't mind it, because it reminds him. It reminds him of all the pain, all the torture that he had to endure. It reminds him that, despite being a blood-drinking creature of the night, he is also something...greater.
Destined for greatness, if you will.
Al-Kushraf city is his home now, but the Typhonist has ambitions beyond its borders.

Disturbing obsession drips from literally every word uttered.
The Ventrue Primogen shakes his head and is taken aback, "Jesus, Seth. OK. Take a chill pill. She's not my type anyway. Have you asked her out yet or--"
"I have something in mind. The Celebration Of Power is coming up. I'm going to ask her then...or before that, Typhon willing."
"Oh. Um. Yeah. Sure, yeah. Go for it, man. I'll, uh, leave her alone."

Seth makes his way back to the car and is driven away.
Mark Kincaid, shaken by the Setite's bizarre behavior and threats, closes the door and takes a deep breath. Either way, he decides to do some little rearranging of his money and finances while the night persists.
A little Dominate will have to be (mis)used to mush people's brains and get some bankers, nosy managers, and other "types" to make him look better off.
After some stressful encounters with some guys (and gals) who were not quite easy to persuade, Mark goes to a nightclub that he is a VIP member of (was, since his membership officially expired years ago).
The loud, thumping music does cause his dead heart to act up. The flashing strobe lights make his skin crawl and the smells, the smells are a mixture of sweat, booze, perfume, and...blood.
He needs to feed. Since he's a Ventrue, any ol' warm body won't do. Nope.
Blud has got them Rarefied Tastes- the Ventrue Clan Bane. He needs a very specific type of person to feed from. Luckily, his Rarefied Tastes are not so complicated (or yikes-level problematic).
It's just bouncers, that's it. Age, build, and gender doesn't matter.

The Ventrue Primogen cracks a knowing smile and goes with this large man to a more...discreet area, where no one can see them.
Mark's fangs pop out, and his eyes sparkle in the near-dark and hazy club. He sinks his fangs into the bouncer's neck, and the larger man shudders in ecstasy.
The big guy's eyes glaze over and his head lolls to the side. He lets out a tiny gasp.

After a few euphoric seconds, Mark stops, wipes the blood off his lips, licks the wounds closed, and tells the bouncer to forget what just happened.
The bouncer guy waddles off, almost losing his balance and falling down. Mr. Kincaid's Beast rumbles in satisfaction and the night carries on till the sun rises.
Chapter 20: Slasher- Part 2
"The great bulk of the fascists consists of human dust." -Leon Trotsky
The sun does what it must. For a time, the city is bathed in a golden hue. People rush to get to work, and the air is filled with the sound of vehicles.
The Kindred sleep throughout the day. They slumber on beds, hidden rooms, abandoned buildings, and the like.
Life in this gilded cage of a city carries on. The tragedy of the Marjan Tower continues to weigh heavily upon the hearts and minds of many. The city is on edge, and the Inquisitors are still on the prowl.
At sundown, the Kindred begin to stir from their day-long slumber. These nocturnal predators awaken and begin their night anew. Some are hungry (for the only special thing), some are cranky, and others have a different kind of appetite.
Once these immortals awaken, their Hunger (to varying degrees) hits them with full force. Some might find it easier to feed (be it easy pickings, unusual arrangements, or whatever else), while others will have to hunt and stalk the dark summer night.
But ALL Kindred have their ceaseless Hunger to contend with. The Beast demands satiation, 1 way or another. And there are plenty of ways for the Kindred to quench their thirst in this gilded cage of a city.

What's the High Priest doing here?

The Setite High Priest is dressed in a fulvous turtleneck, dark-ish corduroy pants, and brown moccasins. Like always, he has his trademark snake-head cane with its piercing emerald eyes.
He is calm. The magical cane is for partly for show, partly for utility. Partly to intimidate, to show authority, to be intimidating.
But it's mostly for show, of course. A status symbol, so to speak. Or at least a marker that indicates his station and position as a devoted Follower of Set.
Seb grins as he guides his guest to where Gorman and Helene are. The High Priest takes the seat that the eyeliner fella was sitting in earlier. Seb sits across from him.
The ladies (mortal, presumably) on the couch are either dazed and nodding off or in the middle of an argument about who's "it". Gorman and Helene have their heads turned to where the noise is coming from.
Gorman regards Seth, his eyes going up and down. He squints, "The fit is just not doing it for me." He nods in Seth's direction, "Hm. Yes. Anyway, how are you keeping, darling?"
Helene regards Seth, her eyes also running up and down. She extends her cold hand, "Helene. I'm just passing through."
Seth shakes her hand and nods back, "Pleasure. Seth Steale, Ministry High Priest." His eyes are unflinching and piercing as always, with not much emotion present on his face.
The snake-head cane is placed on his lap, but not in a threatening manner.
Helene remarks, "Ah. The Clan of Faith, hmm? I don't get along with your kind very well. No offense." She takes a drink from her glass.
Seth's eyes glance at her drink for a moment, then look back up to meet hers. "None taken." It's a small gesture. His words are non-threatening, yet he still seems so...at ease.
Gorman leans closer, "Turtlenecks, Seth, are so 2007. So Steve Jobs, so the Apple store at the Palm Springs Mall. Not really my style. It's...meh. Vanilla. Uninspired. Lacking in boldness."
He holds his head high, "My, my, my."
Seth chuckles lightly, "I'll be sure to keep that in mind, Mr. Gorman. Any...recommendations?"
Gorman waggles a finger, "Skinny jeans and polo shirts with a popped collar. The lighter colors would suit those intensely piercing amber eyes of yours, doll."
"I'll be sure to keep that in mind," Seth replies with a fake and forced smile on his face. He adjusts himself in the chair, trying to get comfortable.
His hand brushes against the cane. He makes sure that his facial expression doesn't give anything away.
The Toreador Primogen snaps his fingers and orders a baggy-eyed woman in her 30s to bring a "drink" for the esteemed Viper. She briskly returns with a tray in her hands, bearing 1 wine glass.
"It's freshly drawn," Seb offers, a knowing smirk dancing on the corners of his mouth.
"It's always freshly drawn," the baggy-eyed woman chides. Her gaze lingers on the snake-head cane's emerald eyes for a few seconds, then it flits back to the Primogen.
Seth takes the glass of blood and brings it up to his nose to sniff at it. It smells...salty, with a mix of some drugs. The High Priest brings the rim up to his lips.
Sebastian goes back to what he was talking about, "So, like I was saying: skinny. That's the stuff now. That's how it's gonna be for the foreseeable fucking future. It's always been like that, if you ask me."
He adds, "Fuck the haters. So what if my last thing flopped? The next one's gonna be my epic comeback, just you wait." His tone reeks of the desperation of a wannabe.
Gorman's expression darkens a bit, "And what of the...incident?"
Sebastian clicks his tongue, "I got a Lasombra lawyer named Titus- he's the best in the business. If that Slavic bimbo bitch tries anything else, I'll have him--"
Seth interjects by clearing his tongue, "Mr. Gorsky. A word, please. In private."
The Epicurean sighs deeply and stands up, "Fine. Let's take it to the balcony. C'mon."
Seth quickly gulps the remainder of the blood down and sets the glass aside. He picks up his cane and follows Sebastian to the balcony. He takes a moment to appreciate the view of the city's skyline.
He is unperturbed and indifferent. There's a plume of smoke visible in the far distance.
On the balcony, eyeliner guy is busy making out with some random chick whose entire aesthetic is a clashing mixture of goth and office professional. They're pressed up against each other and moaning into each other's mouths.
There are visible bite marks on the woman's neck. Seb raps his knuckles on the screen door and moves aside while eyeliner dude takes the woman by her hand to a different spot, so they resume their amorous activities.
(He's giving her a kiss and the Kiss, it would seem).
The woman's hair is matted with sweat, and her eyeliner is starting to run a little. Her lipstick is smudged and it's starting to leave stains on mister eyeliner's pallid cheeks.
Sebastian slides the screen doors closed. Gorman and Helene continue to chat amongst themselves.
Seth raises his chin and looks down at the scene below him. He regards the Toreador with his usual cool, yet indifferent stare. "Well? I'm listening," he starts.
Sebastian replies with a question of his own, "What's going on over there?" he gestures towards the smoke plume.
"That, my friend, is the sweet sight of victory over the forces of the Second Inquisition."
"Ah. Those Assamite crazies, right?"
"Mm-hmm. I have a question of own, now."
"Shoot."

Sebastian's shoulders drop a little, "After that...whatever Tower came down, I hired additional security. I have 'em sweep for bombs or any kinds of explosive devices every half hour or so, y'know."
With some fear in his voice, he adds, "You can never be too careful, Mr. Steale."
He wags a finger and wistfully reminisces, "That was a traumatic event for all of us."

"Hmm."

"Oh, yeah. Yeah. Worth every penny. Why? Those mercs at your compound starting to bug you?"
Seth simply stares ahead. Another plume of smoke rises in the distance.
Sebastian leans his elbow against the balcony, "So, what's up?"
The High Priest adjusts his sleeves, "A trust has recently been setup..."
"Oh. OK...?"

"Why?"

"Right..."
"Right," Seth affirms, "By the time we're done, this whole damn country will be mi--ours again. I'm not an accountant, Sebastian, but I don't see what's so complicated about that."
The Toreador wrings his hands together, "How much are we talking here? And why does this thing even exist? You know, I could just write you a check for however much you think it's gonna cost to fight the--"
Seth gives the Primogen an amount, in dirhams.
Sebastian's mouth drops and hangs open, "W--what?! Sheesh. Uh...OK. That's not the number that I had in mind. S--sure. But why does it exist?"
Seth cracks a subtle smile, "The Ventrue have been saying that the Toreador haven't been making any meaningful contributions to the fight against the SI."
He presses on, "People talk. Human nature is rotten to the core. I can't do anything about that, but what I can do- as a friend- is make sure that all your bases are covered."
Mr. Steale leans in closer, "But the bottom line is: you don't wanna go to sleep in the middle of the day tomorrow, thinking about the fact that the Assamites are kicking out the SI and your Clan has yet to contribute something substantial."
Sebastian sighs deeply and clicks his tongue, "Hrrf. Fine. We've known each other for decades now. S--sure, sure. I can write the check whenever you want. The Ventrue said that about us, huh?"
"Indeed. They're saying all kinds of nasty things."
The High Priest pauses for a moment before resuming, "Once the last Inquisitor has been cut down, what happens next, hmm?"
Sebastian chuckles and does a wide, sweeping gesture, "A massive fucking party, obviously! With the usual. Why, did you have something else in mind?"
Seth rubs the back of his neck, "As your friend, I don't want anyone to say that the Toreadors didn't do their part in sending the Inquisitors to an early grave, and I don't want them to say that you didn't contribute."
He rubs his chin with his thumb, "Your Clan will get its due credit. The Ventrue will, as well. As for me and mine...well, that's a bridge that'll have to be crossed when the time comes."
Sebastian's eyebrows rise. "Hm. Well, uh. Sure." He goes silent for a moment before continuing, "Anyway, we got ourselves a deal? What about the other Clans?"
"What about them? The Assamites contribute by doing the dirty work, the Malkavians are out there as well, the Nosferatu...well, the less said about them, the better. The Caitiff are a non-issue now."
He explains, "I'll do my best to keep them from...I don't know, whining, I suppose."
Sebastian shakes his head and grumbles, "I don't like or trust those goddamn Assamites, Seth. Especially that blonde Slavic bimbo--"
Seth turns to face the Degenerate and glares at him with his serpentine eyes, "I would recommend moving on from that, Mr. Gorsky." He narrows his gaze even more, "Svetlana and I...we...we have something special."
He warns Sebastian, "So, don't you even entertain the thought of seducing her or using her for your own ends, understand? We are...destined to be together, in a manner of speaking."
Sebastian nods furiously and looks down at the cityscape in the distance, "O...kay? That was super awkward. What the hell do you see in that bit--woman, anyway?"
Seth dreamily answers, "She's special. From the moment I first laid eyes on her all those weeks ago, I sensed that we were meant to be together. You could even say that the fates conspired to bring us together. Heh."
He sighs a bit and continues, "It's fate, Mr. Gorsky. Our fates have intertwined for the past few weeks. You find that...what, disagreeable, don't you?"
Sebastian shakes his head, "Chicks like Svetlana are a dime a fucking dozen in this city. Besides, you were in fucking Italy a few months before all--all of that shit started in Dubai."
Seth raises his chin and smiles widely, "Ah, yes. I was. That, my Bullfighter friend, was more of a...spiritual journey. I wasn't there to...score, heh."
"Hm. You're missing out. Italian tail's good, man. It's got all the right proportions. The skulls are shaped a certain way. The lips...so soft. They're not fat, but they can get quite animated...if you don't tame 'em right."
(Is he talking about people or cattle?)
The High Priest replies with a hint of scorn in his tone, "Like I said: my trip to the Cave of Apples in Naples was for the purposes of long meditation. I sought insight and powers from the very foundations of the Founding Temple."
Sebastian sardonically prods, "And how'd you get there? On a fucking bicycle?"
Seth mirthlessly laughs, but keeps his composure, "No. I flew there- on a private jet belonging to a fellow Viper."
He raises his chin and declares, "I don't fly economy, Sebastian. It's not my type. Is that a crime?"
Seb shrugs, "Dunno, don't care. I was just...messing with you, man. Relax. Jesus."
Seth replies in a cool manner, "Ah, of course. Haha. Your sense of humor has always been...politically incorrect, hasn't it?"
"It sure fucking has." Sebastian sees an Gen4 Security operative patrolling the front. He gives him the OK sign. The operative holds a small PDW and is clad in a gray suit.

Seb scoffs, "Of course I am! I'm a qualified phrenologist and I can also tell a person's entire character just by reading their face. That shit never gets old!"
(Physiognomy AND Phrenology? What a lovely combo.)
He shrugs and laughs, "And people come to see me work my magic, but modern quote-unquote 'science' trashes us because they're afraid that we know all of people's deep, dark secrets and what makes them tick."
The Primogen snarls, "Afraid that they're wrong about everything and afraid that they'll have no more power if people like me tell 'em exactly what makes them who they are!"
Seth muses, "Yes, it does seem that not offending anyone dictates a lot of what's acceptable in these...modern times of ours." He says "modern" with quite a dose of venom in his voice.
"Of course it hasn't!" Sebastian sneers, "All this PC bullshit, all this...'sharing is caring', and 'make love, not war'- it's all an illusion! And it's pathetic!"
He waves a dismissive hand, "But people keep falling for that same ol' song and dance, year in and year out, because...they're people. But we're Kindred, we're the shit."
Seth chuckles a little, "I guess we are, Sebastian. I guess we are."
Sebastian then asks, "So...The Celebration Of Power is coming up. You got a theme for this year? And you told me that...you're taking care of the refreshments? You sure about that?"
Seth twirls his snake cane and exclaims, "Ah. The Celebration Of Power. Yes. I have everything planned out. My Herd will, hopefully, be adequate for this year's...festivities. As for this year's theme...do you remember last year's?"
The Toreador nods, "Yeah. Yup. Uh...'Seizing The Initiative'. Right?"
"Bingo. I almost thought you forgot it...tsk, tsk, tsk."
