"All will be made known in due time. I think I have something a lot better in mind for this year, haha. You'll see."
"That's how we keep our power," Sebastian grins and chuckles darkly, "You and I? By...by...um...hmmm...how should I put this?"
Seth cuts in, "By seizing the initiative and taking what is rightfully owed to us after decades of floundering around without much of a purpose? After years of being forced to hide in the shadows of our Sires and Elders? After being hunted by mortals and our fellow Kindred, no less? Hmmm?"
Sebastian snaps his fingers and he beams, "Yup. You nailed it! Yes, yes, that's exactly it! Floundering, purpose, being held down, all of it! Exactly right, Mr. Steale!"
Seth leans forward and smiles sinisterly, "Exactly. I seized the initiative. Once this all blows over, I'll have Svetlana all to myself...and we...oh, we'll be inseparable. That is how I plan to spend eternity with her."
Sebastian's eyebrows shoot up, and he stifles a sigh, "Uh...huh. OK. I still do not get what you see in her, but hey, it's your funeral, man! And what's this I hear about a new Banu Haqim Primogen??"
Seth snaps out of his deluded reverie, "Oh. That. It's a temporary arrangement. It doesn't really concern us. We just have to sit back and let them get down and dirty with our foes."
He rubs the back of his neck, "Anyhow, Mr. Gorsky. Thank you for your time. I'll see you around."
Before Seth walks away, he looks over his shoulder, "Things...are not going to be the same around here." It sounds as ominous and cryptic as can be.
Sebastian has an unsettled look in his eyes as Seth confidently exits. He doesn't bother making small talk or mingling with any of the Toreadors (or their mortal hangers-on) over here.
Gorman is still sitting there, with Helene's hand in his, rubbing it in circles with his thumb.
Sebastian mutters to himself, "Y--yeah. Here's to new beginnings, a new era, or whatever the fuck." With a trembling hand, he lifts a shot glass into the air and holds it out.
He lowers his voice to a hush, "...here's to my comeback. A grand comeback."
After that, he steps back into his Haven and stands in front of that large painting on his living room wall. That woman in the painting is...his Sire.
She often referred to herself as, "The Fairest Of Them All" She "gently suggested" that others do so as well. Not doing so had...dire consequences and was a rather messy affair.
(It was quite hard to get the gore off the walls).
As a Fledgling, this Karl Lagerfeld wannabe has had his fair share of cleaning up after his "eccentric" Sire.
Till this very night, Sebastian Gorsky does not know the name of the Elder Toreador who Embraced him into this world...
...this world of darkness.
Seb doesn't know if she's still around. They lost touch with each other as time marched on. Sebastian moved around a lot while she...
...well. Not many are privy to her whereabouts. Accounts are contradictory and all over the place. Some say that she was Beckoned off to some far-away, desolate place to guard it from the Second Inquisition.
Others say that she is simply in Torpor, like some Kindred Sleeping Beauty or whatever.
After a while, Gorman stands up and runs his hand through what remains of his silver hair. He decides to do a little mingling with whoever else is around here.
Helene downs the last of the blood from her glass and opines, "That snake tattoo on that man's neck. Does he have to be so obvious and wear his Clan on his skin? Hmph." She gets up and joins her fellow Toreador for some mingling of her own.
On the 15th floor of this same apartment building...
Camille (yes, the very same one from all those nights ago) bites her thumb as she dials a phone number and waits. No reply, no one picks up. The woman growls a little in frustration before hanging up.
She doesn't bother to leave a message, either. She just throws the cellphone down onto a nearby sofa, grabs a bottle of some sort of beverage, and gulps some of it down.
She's dressed in PJs and mostly keeps to herself. She's not fully aware that Sebastian lives 8 floors beneath her. While she's brushing her teeth, the phone rings.
The call is coming from somewhere in Turkey.
Once she finishes rinsing her mouth, she picks up the phone and answers, "Yeah? Hello?"
She shakes her head and groans, "Oh. Y--yes. I understand. Oui (FR: Yes). She--she has been delayed again?" there's a hitch in her voice.
The woman sits down, "Uh-huh. Of course, yes, I understand. I see...OK. Mm-hmm." She nervously nibbles her thumb.
Her breathing climbs, "I can manage--" she winces when she hears the static on the other end of the line.
After that, a few tears begin to stream down her face. Camille wipes them with her palm, gathers her composure, and trudges over to the sofa.
She sinks into it and lets out a heavy sigh. She turns on the TV and mindlessly watches some show, attempting to get her mind off things.
There's more to Camille than meets the eye. In time, it shall be made known.
Right before sunrise, the Unit 8211 thugs have already done their best to clean everything up. They blasted a few police officers and firefighters dead and recovered Lt. Hilda Klein's body before extracting.
The cops have the presence of mind not to investigate further. They just close their investigation on the spot due to certain pressures from outside, external forces.
There are, after all, many ways to skin a cat.
Besides, the "gang" narrative will begin to take root in the public mind. That narrative, in its own perverse way, helps to maintain the Masquerade.
Chapter 21: Rescue
The sun rises over the land. After last night's fierce fighting, the vampires scattered back to their Havens to rest, mend their wounds, recuperate, and prepare for whatever comes next.
There is not much room for respite in this struggle, however. No time for a vacation, to put it bluntly. During the day, the Kindred are vulnerable- completely still and prone to attack.
The immortal (but not indestructible) beings of the dark night succumb to their day-sleep as the sun rises, and the skies burn bright with the rays of life (and light).
Just like they did for Abdullah, the Zionist thugs record videos of a few captured Assamites being obliterated by the rising sun. The videos, somehow, find their way onto the systems of the Nosferatu.
(It's going to be quite a nasty waking-up surprise).
Those videos are sent as a warning of what will happen to the Kindred in this part of the world. Lt. Raz herself edited the video and put it together after the recording equipment was brought back to the main base.
She has a callous and indifferent reaction to seeing captured Kindred writhing in agony and burning to ashes. She looks over at a few of her fellow soldiers and sees that they all feel the same way.
Some even gleefully chuckle and high-five each other.
Like last time, she has the video end with big, bold white text on a black background that reads: "AM YISRAEL CHAI".
Adding insult to injury, Lt. Liora Raz added some kind of dark synth pop music to the grim video before sending it off.
That's Unit 8211's way of doing PSYOPS and sending a message to the Kindred that they're not backing down anytime soon.
The day goes on with the mortal denizens of the city remaining none the wiser. Panic and fear set in once the papers and other media outlets start running with the whole "gang" narrative.
Either way, the Emirati authorities are hellbent on reassuring everybody that Al-Kushraf city is still THE place to come shop, set up a business, shit like that.
The families of the emergency personnel who were killed by the Israelis last night are given generous "compensations". Basically, a shut the hell up and deal with it kind of deal.
Not every family member is willing to accept that, however.
1 man, whose firefighter son was gunned down by the Zionists, is seen crying as he walks away from a reporter. He wants answers, not dirhams.
Absalom, the Malkavian Primogen, is still in the throes of the day-sleep. The sun slowly descends upon the land. The Kindred in this Middle Eastern metropolis are already preparing to stir awake.
The Elder Malk can feel his entire mind being yanked into the inescapable depths of the Malkavian Madness Network. He finds himself unable to move, unable to speak, unable to do anything.
Creepy carnival music plays all around him. Colors and shapes dance about him and mock him. His mouth opens and closes, but he cannot even scream. He cannot speak.
His limbs are stiff and unmoving. He cannot feel them. Absalom can't move a single digit or twitch a single facial muscle.
The voices swirl all around him.
"This is a fucking travesty! It's depraved, disgusting, immoral, and unsanitary!"
"Agh! Can't you see that I'm in here? I finally...finally get some alone time. HEY! STOP! What are you doing?!"
Some hoarse-voiced woman calls out, "I can make my own fairy book ending."
"BITCHES!"
The Elder grits his teeth and pushes all of his mental strength into trying to break free, but it's not enough.
A gentle, barely audible call tickles the Elder's ears, "Absalom. Absalom. Hey, it's me."
Absalom's lips quiver, "Ma--Madeline?"
"Y--yeah. Just do what you did last time. Easy steps, now."
"But--but--I cannot remember...I--"
"Do it. You know the words; you know the dance. You know what to do."
"I..."
Madeline's voice takes on a more synthetic, computerized tone, "Absalom. Do. It."
"I cannot!" the Elder Malkavian cries out in near pain.
The voices laugh maniacally and directly taunt Absalom, "Aww, it's the feudal lord. Look at him struggling. Dumb son of a bitch. He was a fucking tyrant in his time. Serves him right."
Madeline sighs softly. Beeping and whirring noises follow, "Absalom, focus. Focus."
Absalom's mind immediately goes back to his past. It was literal centuries ago.
Even to this very night, he vividly remembers it all. While others might've chosen to forget, Absalom has chosen to remember.
It was a hot summer day during the Middle Ages, and not all were having a good time. The peasants were not so happy about the latest order of their lord.
Absalom, who went by a different name back then (obviously), had ordered the serfs to work till the end of the day. Severe beatings would await those who disobeyed or defied the benevolence of the then-mortal Absalom.
Absalom and his large family would have a loud celebration. Wine goblets clinking, sparkling red wine flowing like water itself.
In the middle of the revelry, Absalom would rise up, his healthy face flushed with wine, and proudly declare, "Set thine eyes upon mine lands! Behold my vast riches and wealth!"
A ragged looking man with a scraggly gray beard would often roam Absalom's vast estate. He was only ever seen at nights and was constantly drooling.
He spoke in grunts and growls, barely forming cogent words. Even the peasants stayed away from him and chided their children to AVOID going out during the night.
Absalom had a large portrait of himself hung up in the main hall. The portrait was painted by a skilled artist of the time, and it was said to have captured the Absalom's visage in the finest of details.
His piercing blue eyes, his broad shoulders, and his long, flowing black hair.
The scraggly man was suspected of being a runaway from a local asylum. He would often go around town, and the locals would shun him as well.
Absalom would try- time and again- to get this annoyance off his land, but that man always had a way of giving the well-armed guards the slip. There were even times when Absalom's children would see that same man standing over their beds in the dead of the night.
He would just stare at them, growling softly.
It got so bad that 1 night, Absalom himself decided to find this fellow and get rid of him. Permanently. Personally. No guards, no help from any virile showoff cousins, just him and a shiny sword that had recently been sharpened on a whetstone.
Absalom crept around the estate, sword in hand, looking for this interloper.
He was quite drunk at the time, and it didn't take much effort to stumble his way into a field and see the man standing there. He was dressed in tattered gray rags, and his hands were outstretched and raised to the moon overhead.
With his eyes firmly heavenward, the seemingly insane man was babbling something, his voice hoarse and scratchy.
Absalom approached, his sword out, ready to strike at his first opening.
That man noticed Absalom, turned, and smiled at him. Without warning, Absalom struck the first blow. This alone should've killed him.
Instead, his gashing wound...it began to heal before Absalom's wide eyes. No blood seeped through the flesh, the leathery skin pulled itself together, and the wound healed over in a matter of seconds.
"What...art...thou?"
That man bore his fangs and leaped on Absalom. Despite looking so old, frail, and weak, he had the strength of a 1000 knights.
He pinned Absalom down and bit into his throat. That man...is Absalom's Sire. After the Embrace, the man left the land and was never seen again.
Absalom himself awakened in a field. In the post-Embrace Frenzy, he had killed at least a dozen peasants, and some of the nearby villagers fled in horror.
This, for the peasants, was the straw that broke the camel's back. Absalom's tyranny and ruthlessness to his subjects was at an all-time high, and many were gathering torches and sharpening pitchforks.
From the beginning of his Unlife, Absalom had quite the headstart in the Auspex Discipline. He could sense danger even before it came knocking.
The then-Fledgling felt something was coming, and he knew what was going to happen next. He packed some stuff into a sack, abandoned his family, and ran away from his own vast lands into the woods.
His head was a mess (still is). He barely even recalls his own name, and he could not remember how he became Kindred.
In time, most of his memories returned. It took years, and some of the details are fuzzy, but they've trickled back.
His Sire had given him the means and opportunity to escape his mortal doom. It was a kind, merciful gift, if anything. That roaming, roving Madman would go on to Sire more Childer in lands far and near.
Absalom has been through the Madness Network many times, and it's the only thing that's kept him from going completely insane (paradoxically, it's also nearly driven him nuts). He's made his peace with it, regardless.
Madeline's voice cuts through the shroud of Absalom's memories, "Hey. Hi. How are ya?"
"I am...I am fine, Madeline. How do you fare?"
"Everything's green on my end. Optimal, running, and stable. It's always nice and clean. How are you holding up, Absalom? Are you still there?"
Absalom's eyes slowly open, and he blinks a few times, "Yes. It takes time to...come around."
"Yeah. So, about what we discussed last night..."
The Elder groans, "Yes. You will help us to defeat the foe that has beset us? You will...ask the God-Machine?"
Madeline weakly chuckles, "I'm just a node in the God-Machine. I'll have to go through proper channels, send a few prayer signals up, and the like. It'll take a few cycles or so. But yes, I can absolutely give you a hand. If the God-Machine wills it, of course."
"Thank you. I don't know what else to say. What I have witnessed in regard to the God-Machine continues to...confound me. Is there anything else you wish to add?"
Madeline's synthetic voice cracks and signs of wistfulness and grief bleed through, "I ca--can't believe it's only been a decade since my--my assimilation. It feels like centuries, heh. I feel so...odd."
"Yes. What happened to you in Flimont City was...tragic. But you got vengeance on those who destroyed you, yes?"
Madeline ignores that and states, "We have to stop them, Absalom. The Second Inquisition, whoever they are in your part of the world. They're bad news. Everywhere."
Absalom sighs, "We shall do all we can possibly do, Madeline."
Some machine-like noises begin to fill the air. Madeline starts mumbling, "Optimizations required at Sector Theta-45. Dispatching. Optimizing. Logged. Store. Acceptable."
The Elder remarks, "Such...complexity."
Madeline goes on, "Infrastructure not found in current operating point. Insufficient resources to expand. Interest in expanding = negligible."
The Elder inquires, "Why can the God-Machine not make its presence known here?"
Madeline flatly answers, "It doesn't want to. There were a few Linchpins back in the 1990s, but when the UAE started growing, those same Linchpins started to...vanish."
"I see. What is this Linchpin that you speak of?"
Madeline shakily asks someone beyond Absalom's reach, "Ma--Master? Seeking permission to share limited info with entity? Entity is named Absalom. Like my former self, a Malkavian. Understood. Thank you."
"..."
Madeline resumes, "Permission granted. The God-Machine has deemed you worthy of access to certain data streams."
"That is most kind of it. Please relay my thanks."
"Access granted. You are welcome. All of the God-Machine's Infrastructure has a single, unremovable weak spot- a Linchpin. In the UAE, this was a prototype android who gained sentience/freewill and had to be destroyed/discarded."
"Excuse me? What are these androids you speak of? Is it like the phone operating system?"
Madeline's chuckle comes off as rather robotic and hollow, "No. It was a person who had undergone the process of Rewiring. Their consciousness was uploaded to the Infinite Matrix of the God-Machine."
Absalom is dumbfounded, "You are losing me, Madeline. Even for an Elder like myself, this is all far too much."
Madeline comes out and says it, "Androids are real, Absalom. They often call themselves the Rewired/Inorganic, just like vampires call themselves Kindred/Cainites. You got the Embrace to make new vamps and androids go through this whole process called Rewiring."
"How does that even work?"
Madeline makes a painful, strained noise, "Agrh. I--I can't divulge that. But the Rewired are out there, there are even some in your immediate location. Like the Masquerade, the Firewall protects them...provided they uphold/defend it."
Absalom dryly remarks, "How very intriguing. And you say that the consciousness of all of these...robots is inside the God-Machine?"
"That is...1 way to put it. Yes. Also, robots is a bit reductive. The Rewired have bodies of flesh, but their insides are...well...wires, circuits, chips, all that. They go to sleep while recharging themselves."
Absalom's eyebrow twitches, "They can be...defeated, can they?"
Madeline goes on, "Well, if you're talking about their physical forms, sure. But their consciousness is always safe/secure in the God-Machine. If anything happens to the shell/body, then a new one will be assigned to them. It's a pretty huge waiting list, heh."
"Can Kindred become androids? Can they go through this Rewiring process you speak of?"
"It depends. Why? Y--you wanna go through it?"
Absalom replies, "Why did you not go through with it? Or are you still on this waiting list?"
Madeline's voice quivers, "I--I have a different purpose within the God-Machine. It chose me all those years ago because of my...unique relationship with numbers. Numbers, equations, algorithms, data...all that."
"You are merely a node in a machine of infinite complexity. You are...happy with this? Truly?"
Madeline's reply is a whisper, "Yes. And I wanna to help you out, Absalom. So, yeah. I'm happy, or as...happy as can be, I guess. You don't know what it was like...looking back..." she trails off. She wishes to say more, but she does not.
Absalom sighs and picks up on a few things, "Very well. Let us discuss strategy."
Madeline whispers, "Absalom?"
"Yes?"
"Something's come up and it requires my immediate attention. I really have to take this. Oh, by the way, tell Mr. Bean I said hi. OK. We'll try to make contact later and discuss strategies. Logging. Store."
A high-pitched noise screeches across the air and the Elder Seer jolts awake. His mind is still reeling from learning about the existence of androids.
Over the course of his long Unlife, the Malkavian Primogen has encountered Garou, Mages, a few Wraiths, and fewer Changelings. He's even heard rumors of aliens being real.
This world is truly a strange and magical place. And a pretty dark one, too. Full of secrets, mysteries waiting to be unraveled.
Absalom rises from his day-sleep and feels his entire body shake as a shiver runs down the entirety of his cold, cold body.
His eyes dart around, and he looks over to the side, where a glass is filled with ruby-red liquid.
Mr. Bean left a handwritten note under it that reads: "Last of our supply. Kept it 4 u. Heading out for a walk. Have fun :-)"
Absalom gulps down the liquid and feels a rush of blood pumping into his Unliving body. His fingers tingle and his Beast rumbles in contentment.
With a shaky hand, he takes a look at his face in a nearby mirror. Still him, still around, still Absalom, still here.
He only came to the UAE back in 1970s.
When he was in Chicago, Absalom was quite good at running a Blood Bank. His super Auspex also makes him quite adept at planning and optimizing routes for the Blood Trade (amongst other things).
When he was driven here a few weeks back, the Elder helped to optimize a few of the paths of the Circulatory System in this part of the world.
The Circulatory System is basically an international network of smuggling Vessels across state lines, national borders, or even whole continents. Its operations are global in scale and cut across Clans, Sects, and Domains alike.
For reasons obvious, this shit is illegal since it involves trafficking of human beings whose blood might have that certain tang to it, that peculiar taste, that sugary kick, a certain sensual saltiness, that...Resonance.
So, yeah, Absalom's been involved in all of that for quite a while. Around these parts, the Ministry has a monopoly on the sordid Blood Trade. As of late, the Tremere in Abu Dhabi are the #1 customers.
Absalom takes a bath, brushes his teeth, and walks around his penthouse. It's lacking in furnishings. The A/C makes this place feel so cool, though.
Almost too cool, but Absalom likes it that way. The Elder Malk plants his butt on the blue sofa and throws his head back.
Not even a minute goes by when the doorbell rings. Absalom groans and rises from his seat. The sound of the doorbell is annoying as hell. It's like a sharp knife stabbing into his ears.
Mr. Bean insisted on getting something that sounded crazier, but Absalom put his foot down.
The Elder opens the door and sees a familiar face. It's Seth Steale, all by his lonesome. The High Priest is dressed in smart casuals and holds his magical snake cane by his side.
Seth smiles, "Good evening, Absalom. I hope this isn't a bad time?" the politeness appears forced.
Absalom steps aside and silently ushers the Setite inside. His icy blue eyes follow his guest's every move. The Seer closes the door behind him and follows the High Priest to the living room.
"Sit, please," Absalom offers. He has to be a proper host, after all. Centuries of vampire politicking have taught him that much.
Seth sits down on the couch and places his cane across his lap. Absalom sits on the opposite sofa, facing the High Priest.
The Elder asks, "To what do I owe the pleasure?"
Seth dryly shrugs, "Just checking up on everyone. After all, the Banu Haqim weren't the only ones who were driven out of Dubai."
"Hmm. Yes. Like I had mentioned last time: by the time my vision of the attack came to me, it was too late to act upon it. Even now, certain things about that evening continue to perplex me."
Seth sighs, "Yeah. So you say. So you say. And how's your Clan faring against the SI? I know you refuse to work with the Assamites- I'm alright with that. But I do hope we can all set aside our differences and fight against a common foe."
"I have been in contact with what I perceive to be a powerful ally. It will help us to vanquish the Second Inquisition once and for all."
Seth's ears perk up and he leans forward, "Oh? My, my, my. You Malkavians really do have some nifty surprises up those sleeves of yours. This sounds like quite the promising development, my friend. Can you share any details?"
"It will be a secret between me and the source of this...power."
Seth nods and looks at the snake cane, "Yes, yes, I see. Hm. Fair enough. And this...whatever it is, can it be trusted? Does it have the best Kindred Society at heart?"
The Malkavian Primogen responds, "I believe so. Tell me, High Priest."
"Yup?"
Absalom lifts his chin, but his intense eyes remain focused on the Viper, "Do you know of anything called...the God-Machine?"
Seth shakes his head from side to side. A chill goes up his undead spine as he does so. He's never heard such a term before. It's not like the name of the Setite deity, Typhon, Apep, the Chaos Serpent, etc.
It's an entirely new concept. The Setite doesn't know how to feel about it. Something is happening that even he is not wholly privy to.
The Typhonist furrows his brows, "OK. Is this...God-Machine thing gonna help us out? Is that why you asked me that question?"
Absalom gives a slight nod, "Yes. That is correct."
"I see. So, you've gone and talked to someone and got all of this info out of them."
"In a way of speaking, yes. I do not, at this moment, feel comfortable sharing all the details, however."
Seth smirks, "Understandable. What would be the point of asking if you were just gonna spill the beans anyway, eh? But what does this God-Machine want with us?"
Absalom turns his head aside and mumbles, "Its ways are vast and beyond us, High Priest of Apep. I have a feeling that the Second Inquisition will meet a terrible end in the not-so-distant future. They will learn the true meaning of fear."
Seth's smirk widens into a full-on toothy grin, "Now we're talking. Yeah, you tell this God-Machine I'm down to play ball."
The lights violently flicker and come on at full intensity. The A/C gets louder. The sudden intensity of the lights causes Seth's eyes to widen. Pain begins to shoot across his head, and his fangs are borne.
His skin itches and his chest aches. His eyes begin to bleed, and the light burns into his retinas. He feels sick.
"Ugh...what's..." he falls to the ground and extends a shivering hand towards his cane.
Absalom is unfazed. He springs up from his seat and calmly turns the lights down to a more acceptable level, his own lips part into a knowing smile.
The High Priest groans, "Ugghh..." he can feel the dimming lights eating into his eyes and making the pain even worse.
Absalom's voice booms throughout the penthouse apartment, "Madeline! Are you there? It's Absalom. Do not do that again. The Setites Abhor the Light. Or..."
Something dawns on the Elder. When she was still around, Madeline wouldn't have possibly known about all the Clans, their Banes, Compulsions, etc. But now that she is 1 with the God-Machine...
Absalom's mouth is a thin line, and his jaw tenses up, "Ah. Of course."
Seth struggles to rise, and the lights return to a dim normal, "What's...happening? Who the...hell is M--Madeline?!" his teeth are gritted in agony.
The Malkavian Primogen helps his guest back up and sets him down on the couch. The snake cane's emerald eyes flash for a quick moment.
Seth is a mess. Absalom sits on the opposite sofa and looks at the Setite's red-soaked face, "I am truly sorry about that."
The Sand-Snake dabs his face with a handkerchief and gruffly asks, "Does shit like that happen here often? The whole place acting up? Is it some Malkavian thing?"
Absalom answers, "It is not a 'Malkavian thing', no. That is, however, not important."
Seth scoffs, "Really now? Well, the timing seemed off. So, this God-Machine buddy of yours--"
The automatic shutters slowly close and cover the windows.
Seth rolls his eyes, "OK. That's just ridiculous. Are you sure this Haven of yours isn't haunted? I know Wraiths and...other spirit entities love to make things...messy."
Absalom shakes his head, "I assure you, High Priest. This place is not haunted by the denizens of the Shadowlands. If it were, I would have seen them before they even saw me."
The Malkavian Primogen points to his left eye, "My Auspex has never failed me...and it never will. It tells me that there is something bigger going on in this Domain."
Seth abruptly twitches and winces, "Ow! Shit..." he turns his head away, "I got...a nasty headache all of a sudden, y'know?"
"Hmm. I see."
The Tempter regains his composure and wiggles on his seat, "I've suspected as much, but what about you? What do your visions show?"
Absalom spreads his hands, "Did you ever hear of the tragedy of Icarus, Mr. Steale?"
Seth chuckles mirthlessly, "Nope. I mean, I went to school and all, but all of that...crap wasn't exactly in the uh...curriculum. Why? What relevance does it have to us on nights like these?"
Absalom counters, "You must not be so dismissive of such things. Even while I was still Primogen in Dubai, I knew of your cult and its distaste for...modernity."
"So?"
"Icarus ignored Daedalus's instructions not to fly too close to the sun. He was so overcome with hubris that his wings melted, and when it did, he fell from the sky, plunged into the sea...and drowned."
Seth smirks, "Alright, so...what's the point in all of this, Absalom?" his hands tremble and he holds his cane in front of him.
Absalom's intense eyes burrow into Seth's very being, "YOU must be cautious. In my visions, I see you flying too close to the sun...and getting burned."
Seth dismissively waves his hand, "That's all very pretty and poetic, too. But I'm not Icarus- a figure of make-believe and mythology. I'm Seth Steale, High Priest of this fine city...and something more."
Absalom's smirk is fiendish and knowing. He regards the Viper with a level gaze and says, "Then you have only proven my point. In my...visions, I see glimpses of what you have planned."
Seth gulps and tightly holds onto his cane, "Oh?" he tries to keep it cool, but his lips quiver.
Absalom nods, "Yes. And I have to say that it is quite the ambitious plan- if my premonitions are to be believed, that is. In my visions, I can see a great war on the horizon. A slaughter...chaos shall follow, but it shall soon subside."
The Elder Lunatic goes on, "I see a figure, closely resembling you, ascending a staircase of ashes and corpses."
Seth's eyes widen, and his mouth opens slightly in surprise, "You--you've been having visions about me?" the Setite tenses his shoulders a little.
Absalom dispassionately says, "Be at ease, Seth Steale. I have no intent of thwarting your plans. If anything, I will give you a hand."
Seth's smile is lopsided, "Whoa. You--you scare people just by starting at 'em. Heh. You had me scared shitless there for a second, haha. So, you AND this God-Machine are gonna help me out?"
Absalom dryly responds, "Yes. That seems to be my destiny. Our fates are more intertwined than you think. The future has shown me much. I see glimpses of the past and the present as well."
"I mean, I could care less about all that stuff. Just give me the juicy bits, you know?"
"No."
"Well, why the hell not?"
"Because much of it is...muddled. Murky and hard to grasp. I will admit that there are times where I have been wrong. My Unlife has been long, longer than yours, Neonate."
Seth shrugs, "Yeah. Alright. Fair enough, heh. So, I um...I win in the end?" he has an expectant look on his face.
Absalom gives a slight nod, "Yes. Then again, it depends on how one defines 'winning'."
The Setite's grin widens, "Cool. Anything else? Uh...what about Svetlana? Is she...with me?"
"What of the Assamite Neonate?"
Seth clicks his tongue and repeats himself, "Is she with me? Svetlana Bobrov."
"If you mean to ask whether or not she will stand with you once the time comes, then I do not know the answer. Everyone else surrounding you appears as a...dark blur."
The Corrupter takes a deep breath and mumbles, "Shit. You knew Svetlana back in Dubai, right?"
"In passing. I know that her Embrace was unauthorized. Yet, Prince Angela saw fit not to have Sheriff Gallagher destroy her and John. Why do you ask, High Priest?"
Seth dreamily looks up, "I'm--I'm in love with her, Absalom. I want her to myself. I don't want anyone else to lay a finger on--on her. She's a sweet little thing, you know. I'd kill for her, burn down entire blocks just to see her smile."
Absalom nods ever so slightly and flatly asks, "Would you really go into your Final Death for her? Are you certain you are in love? Where does the line between love and obsession end for you?"
Seth growls, "The hell is that supposed to mean?! I love her! I WANT HER! Ha--have you ever had feelings for her, huh? Have you tried to--"
Absalom lifts his finger and firmly advises, "I would advise you to refrain from speaking any further, High Priest of Apep. As I have said, my vision is limited. I cannot see everything."
"But you can see me, can't you?! What happens to my Svetlana?!"
Absalom sighs deeply, "You must be cautious with her, Seth Steale. Your passion for her may burn you even before you've had a chance of attaining your lofty goal. I sense that Svetlana is more than what she seems."
Seth calms down, but he glowers daggers at the Malkavian Primogen. The Setite bares his fangs and asks, "What do you mean, dammit?!"
"Please, do not bare your fangs in my Haven. It is unbecoming of you. I am not sure. She is no ordinary Assamite. For 1 thing, I sense a great deal of pain and suffering around her."
Seth replies, "I'm sure it's beautiful, whatever it is. I just wanna hold her and--and comfort her and tell her to forget her past, leave it all behind, and be with me forever, by my side."
"Yes. I can sense that. You wish for her to be by your side...forever."
Seth smiles, "Yeah. I know she'll come around eventually. I just--I just have to make sure that nobody else tries anything funny. Did she have a--a boyfriend back in Dubai, anyone she was close to?"
"Not that I know of."
"What about a girlfriend? Was she that type of person?"
"I don't think so, no."
"What about other friends? Family? Anybody she was close to?"
Absalom stifles a groan, "I am not her father, Seth. If you have such questions and feel so strongly for her, then perhaps you should approach her and ask her instead of asking me. It would be the proper thing to do, no?"
Seth nods and rubs his chin, "Right, right. I think I'm gonna do just that. I just need to find the time. She--she's so busy, fighting off the SI, y'know? So, finding the time with these clashing schedules is really tough."
"Indeed."
The Elder Seer clasps his cold hands together, "Why the interest in this woman? You have given me certain reasons, but I do not find them to be...satisfactory. There is more to your infatuation with this Assamite than mere physical attraction, is there not?"
Seth leans forward and answers, "I don't know. Maybe, maybe not. But hey, can you blame me? She's beautiful! I mean, have you seen those green eyes of hers? That straight blonde hair?"
"Is that all? In the mere weeks she has been here, you know nothing else of her save for her physical appearance? What of her...personality, her character, the Blood that courses through her veins, and other such aspects? Do they not interest you?"
The obsessed High Priest scoffs, "She's a woman! I'm a man! She's an Assamite. I'm a Setite. What more do we need to know about each other?!"
(For Seth, it's not about attraction, curiosity, or genuine love- it's about power. It always has been for the Young Republican at heart. He only calls her beautiful, but is that it?)
Well, yeah. To guys like Seth, that really is...it. They just want a piece of tail and somebody to show off at parties and the like.
Absalom shakes his head and dryly responds, "So much more, High Priest of Apep. There is more to her than meets the eye. I feel it, I sense it, and I see fragments of it. She is a strange creature. I would advise you to be cautious, all the same."
Seth dismissively waves his hand, "Tsk. It can't be that bad. Besides, you Malkavians often get shit wrong all the time, so y'know."
Absalom gives a slight nod, "True. I concede that there are times when our insanity, for lack of better words, gets the better of us. But you have not seen what I have seen over the centuries, Neonate."
Seth smiles and raises his hands, "Yeah. Sure. OK. Whatever you say, Absalom. Y'know, all this Icarus talk got me remembering something..."
"Oh?"
"Mm-hmm. But before we get to that, who was...Daedalus in this Icarus fable?"
"Did you not attend school? Daedalus, the master craftsman, was the father of Icarus."
Seth chuckles a little, "Ah. So, if I'm supposed to be Icarus, then Daedalus would be my...Sire, I guess?"
Absalom replies, "If that is how you wish to interpret it, then yes. Did your Sire teach you about the ways of Unlife?"
The Serpent lightly shakes his head and his eye twitches, "Well, Rafael De La Cruz taught me something, alright. He taught me that Kindred Society needs--well, it needs--never mind, it's not worth it."
Absalom sighs, "I see. He was, what, a cruel man?"
"Something like that. He left me out for the rising sun while he watched from the safety of the darkness. It was a test of my faith in Typhon, you see."
"That is...not ideal."
"Heh, yeah. Yet here I am after all those years," Seth proudly declares. But there's a hint of bitterness in his tone. A touch of anger. He's angry at his Sire. He even harbors some resentment for the man.
Forgiveness is not in the picture. Probably. Typhon has given Seth the strength to push forward, regardless.
Paradoxically, Rafael was also the man who gave his Childe the opportunity to advance up the ranks, so to say. If not for him, Seth would still be a lowly Neonate of low power levels. He would never have been able to become the High Priest and be on the path to attaining his goals.
Absalom notices the tics on Seth's face, the twitches, the erratic blinking, and so on. Nothing escapes his notice.
He proceeds to inquire, "You speak of your Sire with some...bitterness. Why?" There's no real emotion behind his voice.
The Viper shrugs, "Oh, don't get me wrong. I--I--a part of me is grateful to Rafael for all that he bestowed upon me. For the revelations he brought forth from Typhonist doctrine. But..." he trails off and looks away.
His fingers tightly grip his cane. His dead heart races.
The Elder folds 1 leg over the other and leans back, "What troubles you?"
Seth turns his head aside. His lower lip shifts and trembles, "It's about Svetlana. I--I can't stop thinking about her. I want her, I crave her, and I have to have her. I KNOW she feels the same way, too!" he exclaims.
Absalom is silent. He merely regards his guest with a cool, level stare.
Abs asks the obvious question, "Have you at least told her how you feel?"
Seth lamely answers, "I...might've said something to her a few nights back, when we gathered at that abandoned power plant. You remember the one, right?"
The Lunatic raises his chin, "I do, yes. How did she react?"
"Uh..."
Absalom heaves a sigh and shakes his head, "I am not a love advisor, or however they call themselves. You said that the cautionary tale of Icarus reminded you of something. Do you care to elaborate on this?"
The Sand-Snake sniffs and nods, "Yeah, sure, sure. When you were helping to optimize our Blood Trade routes, you mentioned being quite well-read in a lotta stuff. Do you know much about The Hymn Of The Pearl?"
The Malkavian Primogen takes a moment to think through all of the stuff his 2 eyes have ever seen. He answers, "I am not. Perhaps you would like to tell me more of this Hymn, yes?"
Seth chuckles and begins, "Oh, it's not just some boring old poem. No. My Sire had me memorize it down to the last goddamn word. It's the words of Typhon, Absalom." He looks up with a fanatical gleam in his eye.
It's almost like a proud child telling their parents about the time they scored a goal in soccer or something like that.
"It sounds like a Masquerade breach."
Seth allays the Elder's fears, "Ah, it's not like that. You don't have anything else to do now, right? No places to be, people to meet, or whatever?"
"No."
The Typhonist clears his throat, "I'll start from the beginning, and then I'll explain its meaning and--and significance to you. The Hymn goes like this..." he takes a deep breath and begins reciting it from the top.
Officially, mainstream explanations regarding The Hymn Of The Pearl tell the story of a boy sent to Egypt to retrieve a pearl from a serpent (!). On the way, he encounters obstacles and is thrown off the path.
The boy receives a letter and is reminded of his past and purpose. With newfound courage, the boy overcomes the last of his trials and gets the pearl. He returns to his homeland and lives happily ever after.
Sorta.
However, the Typhonist interpretation is a tad more...colorful in its telling.
Seth finishes the last lines of the Hymn with fervor lacing his voice, "The Hymn of Judas Thomas the Apostle, which he spoke in prison, is ended."
As way of politeness, Absalom lightly applauds. He dryly remarks, "It was quite the performance, Seth Steale. Tell me, why did you recite that in its entirety? I would assume that a summary would have sufficed."
Seth smirks widely, "This is where it gets interesting."
The Hymn is commonly associated with Gnosticism and other such religious beliefs. But it's not that clear-cut.
The boy in that poem was actually a young man. But not just an ordinary young man. He was a Revenant- a hereditary Ghoul capable of producing trace amounts of Vitae. Their aging process is also considerably slowed.
Anyways, this lowly Setite Revenant was sent on a journey to retrieve the Pearl. The quest was supposed to be simple, easy, and straightforward.
The Revenant, however, got lost along the way.
He overcame the obstacles in his path, fought off those who meant ill, and made his way to the place where the Pearl was.
The Revenant seized the Pearl from a physical, tangible incarnation of Typhon. He returned and got a gift by way of fangs sticking into his neck and draining him whole. He was a vampire now.
And as time rolled on, that very same young man would go on to Sire Rafael De La Cruz.
Seth folds his hands on his lap, "So there you have it. The story of my...Grandsire, I guess. From a lowly Revenant bred for servitude to someone who came face-to-face with Typhon and lived to tell the tale."
Absalom slowly nods, "I see. This is quite the...fascinating story, indeed. And the mortals, till now, they do not suspect a thing, yes?"
"Nope. They don't suspect a damn thing. It's not like they ever will. Heh. They're too stuck up, wise in their own eyes, too damn enlightened for their own good. All those goddamn modernists...and their notions of modernity," Seth growls.
The Seer refrains from commenting.
Seth goes on, "They're weak. Stupid and soft. They don't realize what we have. They'll never know. The fools, the idiots, and the dupes."
"Hmm. While I do not necessarily share in your distaste for modernity and the current state of the world, I do find this interpretation of The Hymn Of The Pearl to be...fascinating, if nothing else."
"Ah. Yeah. It's the Blood that's in my veins. So, the significance of it is that, when I read the Hymn, it reminds me of my Grandsire and what he did."
"It is, in my view, the journey of the hero. The Hero's Journey, perhaps. Are you familiar with that concept?"
Seth clicks his tongue, "Nope, can't say I am. But the Blood does have a certain...weight to it. It's not like the others, y'know? I mean, it's the Blood of a--a--"
"Revenants are hardly special or unique at all. The Tzimisce breed entire armies of them."
"Right. Yeah. So, when you look at it from that angle, you could say that Rafael and I are a part of a great, noble, and ancient line that uh...had a hero who stood toe-to-toe with Typhon and survived."
Absalom merely nods.
The Corrupter is a bit excited, "I'm gonna recite the whole thing during the Celebration Of Power! I'm gonna make sure that Svetlana knows what the deal is with me, how important I am!"
Absalom equably responds, "If that is what you wish. I do look forward to attending this Celebration Of Power. Back in Dubai, we often heard many things about it. Is it truly as...extravagant as the rumors say?"
"Oh, trust me, it is. Every single year, we go all out. Your meals are taken care of, everything is discreet, and there's not a chance that anyone's gonna walk in on us. You can do just about anything, my friend."
"I see."
Seth leans back in his chair and lets out a deep, content sigh, "Ah."
Absalom prods, "Why do you want that Saracen by your side? Will she not slow you down?"
"Not if I break her first, Absalom. I--I mean, liberate her from the radical teachings of the Blade. It's just a matter of time before she's eating outta my hand. Besides, the others are too stupid to recognize what they have right in front of them."
"Which is?"
"She's a beautiful woman. She's got the right stuff to climb the ladder of success. She's not gonna get there without my help, though. And all that Palestine stuff is holding her back. I can...free her from it. I know I can. I gotta do it."
"And the other reason why you want her with you?"
Seth cracks a smile that doesn't quite reach his eyes, "I need somebody I can trust by my side. She's got all the right qualities. A little bit of molding, and she'll be ready...for me."
He gulps and adds, "Well, that and I'm just mirroring society's demands. Me and Svetlana could be, like, a Kindred power couple or something. She's quite ferocious with those daggers of hers and I'm...well, y'know, heh."
Absalom has a very unimpressed look on his face. He's as still as a statue. His cold, dead eyes stare straight ahead.
Seth's smile widens, "She's a killer, Absalom. We both are. And once she's with me, we're gonna carve a bloody swathe through all the trash and filth that's standing between us and the top."
The Lunatic musters a smile, but it's forced.
"It's funny, y'know? After my last time, I kinda gave up on it all, but when all of you showed up on that night, well, it rekindled the flame, so to speak. It rekindled the fire of--of something within me."

OBED: "Any word on securing additional funding?"
ILHC: "That is not your concern, Commander Gallant. But we are in talks with some private individuals and interested parties. However, without tangible results from your efforts, the likelihood of any meaningful funding materializing is extremely low."
OBED: "Understood. We're working hard here to eliminate the blank body threat and avenge Am Yisrael's fallen. If the Israeli High Command would be able to dispatch additional forces, we would be grateful."
ILHC: "That is out of the question. You have been sent to Al-Kushraf, UAE to perform a specific task and to achieve a very specific objective. If you are unable to achieve said objective, we will have no choice but to consider this mission a failure."
OBED: "I understand that completely, but our resources have taken a significant hit over these past few days."
ILHC: "You will manage with what you have. That is an order. The most that we can do is dispatch a Pave Low from the nearby Al Dhafra Air Base. That should help with some of your issues. Any more than that is out of the question for reasons that are obvious."
OBED: "Thank you for this. We'll make good use of it."
ILHC: "In the meantime, Commander Gallant, you are to find and exterminate the blank body threat. The pilots of the Pave Low have explicit orders to apply the Hannibal Directive. That directive supersedes your own authority. Is that understood?"
OBED: "Yes. Loud and clear."
ILHC: "Remember what is at stake here, Commander Gallant. Continual inefficiencies will result in swift action being taken to correct these errors. You have been warned."
OBED: "Understood. The LVNDR system has come through with some positive results. We're confident that it might help us neutralize the blank body threat."
ILHC: "Do elaborate, Commander Gallant."
OBED: "A few more residential buildings where blank bodies are known to congregate. LVNDR says that there's a 51.86% chance that the flagged individuals are present in the targeted locations. We plan on striking them tomorrow evening, just like last time's operations."
ILHC: "Lt. Maximillian Veifer will be leading the charge?"
OBED: "Yes. He is keen to see these unremarkable structures crumble to the ground and kill all who reside within."
ILHC: "Very well. Do as you must for the good of Am Yisrael, for the freedom and security of the Jewish Nation. Secure complete victory or suffer the total consequences."
OBED: "Yes. As God is my witness, not another one of my brave soldiers will die in vain."
ILHC: "Keep us updated on the situation, Commander Gallant. We will keep you informed of any developments on our end. We will speak soon."
OBED: "Shalom aleichem (HEB: peace be upon you)."
ILHC: "Aleichem shalom (HEB: unto you peace)."
The secretive chat comes to an end. The messages begin to automatically "delete" themselves. Commander Gallant removes his kippah and buries his face in his hands with a long and drawn-out sigh.
Lt. Raz is the first to learn that there is now air support available to the field units. She smirks and continues on with her tasks. She's not going to waste any time.
There are so many other things to do.
For starters, Lt. Raz wants to see a few teams being dispatched to track down any Kindred hiding in the sewers of Al-Kushraf. So far, requests for such have been denied.
The main reason cited was the sheer complexity of the sewer system. It would take too long to find anyone down there and the enemy might know it better than they ever will.
Lt. Veifer is busy assembling some high explosive devices for tomorrow's ops. The LVNDR system has flagged a number of targets. Most of them are residential buildings in low-class neighborhoods.
Sparks fly from whatever bomb Lt. Maximillian is assembling. The smell of gunpowder is strong in the air. He's wearing a welder's mask, thick gloves, and a welder's apron.
Lt. Shem Davidai sifts through some phone calls that might be of interest in generating more leads to tracking the blank body threat. A few of them seem promising.
These assholes now have a helicopter at their disposal. A Pave Low, at that.
Yay.
Sometime later, down in the Nosferatu Warrens...
Samir's face is illuminated by the bright glow of a refurbished laptop. He's looking through some data that has been salvaged off those SD cards. It's a lot of junk to trudge through.
The Assamite sighs and wipes a bloody tear from his eye. He feels his heart ache as he thinks about that grim daylight execution video he saw when he woke up earlier tonight.
Just like Abdullah, all those unfortunate Assamites were defanged, stripped, their heads were shaven, and they were left out for the approaching dawn.
They were burned alive. Their screams, agonizing as they are, continue to echo in Samir's mind.
Samir closes his eyes and rubs his temples. He tries to focus on the task at hand, but his thoughts keep drifting back to that awful scene.
For whatever reason, Tommy saw fit not to show this video to the other Banu Haqim. His reasoning was that they don't need this kind of additional taunting. They nae need that now.
Especially when things are so parlous.
Samir wishes that he didn't see the video. It only added fuel to the fire burning inside of him. He wants vengeance, just like his fellow Assamites he yearns for Judgment to be meted out against their foes.
It is not that long before the sun begins to peek over the horizon, its bright rays shining down on this city.
As Seth prepares to be taken in by the clutches of the day-sleep, he feels the oddly sonorous voice of his Sire, Rafael De La Cruz, echoing in his head.
Rafael's sonorous voice was always meant on radio. Seth used to point it out back then.
Rafael, for his part, would just shrug indifferently.
When it was time for Seth to by-heart the Hymn Of The Pearl, Rafael would often tell his Childe, "Your Blood Brothers- Sean and Shaun- refused to learn the Hymn Of The Pearl. They did not wish to memorize it in its entirety. Stubborn ones, those 2."
Seth blinked, "I'm not them, though? Right?"
"No, my Childe. You are not. Typhon has another plan, another purpose, for you. You know what that fine Hymn truly means now, right?"
"Mm-hmm. Your Sire's journey- from a humble, lowly Revenant to being Embraced. That's quite a journey, if I--I do say so myself."
Rafael lightly chuckled and nodded his head, "Indeed. It is a beautiful tale. Now, get out there."
Seth gulped deeply and looked at the sun peeking over the horizon, "Do--do I have to? I--I mean, out in the sun?"
Rafael sighed and shook his head, "Yes, my son. You must. You must go out into the sun's light, stand out there for a few moments, and come back to me...only when you have memorized every last syllable of this sacred Hymn."
A look of anguish formed on Seth's ticking face. He slowly stepped outside and felt the first rays of sunshine hit his skin. He felt its warmth. He felt the burn.
Rafael watched him with a stern look on his face. He did not waver.
Seth tried to keep his composure as the sun continued to shine down upon him.
He tried not to look at the papers he was holding as he began, "W--When, a quite little child, I was dwelling In the House of my Father’s Kingdom. Aaaaaaaaah!"
His bloodcurdling screams punctured the air. But no one paid any attention to it. Rafael's Ghouls had their orders- the door was to remain shut until Seth Steale recited the Hymn Of The Pearl in its entirety.
(Without looking at the papers that he was holding).
"AAAAAAARGH!" the rays of the rising sun dug deep into his skin and burned it badly.
Seth fell to his knees, but he continued to scream, "And in the wealth and the glories Of my Up-bringers I was delighting. YAAAAARGH! Typhon, have mercy!"
Rafael raised his chin and coldly watched his Childe writhe in pain as the sun continued to fry him slowly, "Continue, my Childe. Continue."
Seth struggled to speak, "T--T--Typhon! PLEASE! NOOOOOOO! AAAARGHRHG!"
Back in the now, Seth tosses and twitches in his dark room. The comfort of his bed does not soothe him. He's trapped in a terrible nightmare, one that has haunted him since that day.
Back then, Seth thought that he was a goner.
He thought that he was going to end up being fried to Final Death.
He was even sure of it.
But, alas, Rafael De La Cruz had other plans in mind for him. He wanted Seth to embrace the pain. He wanted him to become the pain.
Even now, Rafael's oddly sonorous voice rings in Seth's ears, "Fight through the pain, my Childe. Fight through the pain, embrace it. Become the pain, my son. Know that Typhon is with you through it all."
Seth inconsistently babbles, "T--through it all...through it all. Typhon is with me through it all...Apep is with me through it all..." it's not long before the High Priest succumbs to the pull of the day-sleep.
